item.title: SR RF Engineer
item.description: Details: Our client is a leader in products and services focused on RAN and network optimization for Mobile Operators. They offer the best products in the wireless industry. Our client is looking for a SR RF Engineer who has a strong background in data-collection/post-processing and is looking for a corporate engineer career. This role will be in the lab and corporate office interacting with customers, sales, marketing, quality, engineering, and R&D with minimal field travel. This position will be heavily involved with company’s data collection and post-processing products. This roles offer: Working under excellent leadership and a strong manager who enjoys coaching and mentoring Challenging role constantly learning and staying on top of the newest technologies in the wireless field Working with a dynamic team who are very professional and viewed as some of the best in the industry Opportunity to utilize your back ground in RF Engineering, RAN, and network optimization to become a top asset to their R&D, Quality and Testing team Working for a company who is a well-known leader in the wireless space, they are debt free, loaded with cash, always focused on being innovative leaders in the industry, growing rapidly and has a strong focus on culture and professional progression of all employees This is a full-time/perm role that should expect future growth within the company, as well as a great salary, bonus, 401K, perks and excellent benefits. FOCUS: Provide support for wireless network drive test & post-processing tools Contributes knowledge and experience to enhance product functionality, usability and quality Test and validate product and system performance against requirements prior to commercial release Works directly with customers, to investigate customer issues thru analysis and experience Provide training to customers and coworkers

item.title: Restaurant | Executive Chef | Bar Manager | Fort Worth Texas
item.description: Details: We have become known for the place to find outstanding food, mouthwatering appetizers, and unique cocktails. Our staff makes sure every guest that dines at our restaurant is treated as a VIP. We’ve received numerous awards for our menu items, from the finest selection of menu items to the variety of wines to go with it. With everything made from scratch by our Executive Chef and culinary staff, you can count on quality whenever you visit. Our restaurants also feature private dining options to further enhance your experience, whether it’s for a birthday or business meeting. At this time we are seeking an Executive Chef | Bar Manager in the Fort Worth area! Executive Chef Job Description : Our Executive Chef needs to be extremely motivated, hardworking, energetic, experienced and fully capable of leading a group of culinary experts. The Executive Chef must obtain a strong passion for the hospitality industry and work every single shift to ensure an exceptional dining experience. The Executive Chef in this position must set the bar high with regards to creating the finest dishes and upholding food safety guidelines. Food and labor costs, along with building sales and guest counts will be a huge portion of the Executive Chef and their job description. ARE YOU AN EXECUTIVE CHEF READY FOR A CHANGE? APPLY TODAY!

item.title: Customer Service Specialist.
item.description: Details: Accelerate your Career! The Bill Jacobs BMW luxury dealership seeks an experienced Customer Service Specialist. The Customer Service Specialist manages the service department's loaner vehicles on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis. The Customer Service Specialist is responsible for ensuring our Loaner Car Program is utilized in a way that maximizes our guests BMW experience. Essential Job Duties: Communicate with the Service Advisors, Service Management and Client Care Center on how many vehicles are available for future appointments. Conduct a "Walk Around" with loaner vehicles with guests 100% of the time noting any damage on vehicles as well as current miles on the loaner car. Check in all loaner vehicles with customers to notate any damage to vehicle and mileage in.

item.title: Fleet Administrative Supervisor
item.description: Details: PAE , a leader in providing worldwide solutions for base operations, logistics, construction, airfield operations, and personnel placement, is currently seeking a Fleet Administrative Supervisor to support the Antarctic Support Contract and the National Science Foundation's United States Antarctic Program. This position is based in Centennial, Colorado and deploys to Antarctica several months every year. Responsibilities Directs the activities necessary to maintain and repair approximately 300 light vehicle and heavy equipment assets of the United States Antarctic Program. Responsible for implementing and maintaining a safe workplace program and ensuring that safety is the highest priority in the workplace. Sets deadlines and establishes the sequence of work operations to be followed; maintains balanced workloads by shifting assignments, workers, and other resources to achieve the most effective work operations. Reviews and analyzes work accomplishments, cost, and utilization of subordinates to evaluate work progress, control costs, and anticipate and avoid possible problems by recommending corrective action to upper level management personnel. Ensures all employees are trained for the specific task assigned. Manages budget and remains within parameters. Position supervises the work of all mechanics, skilled and unskilled labor engaged in the repair and upkeep of USAP Capital Equipment. Responsible for the maintenance and repair of all assets; must maintain vehicles and equipment in accordance with manufacturers recommendations and industry standards. Determines annual re-supply requirements and ensures all requisitions are submitted in accordance with schedules, guidelines and policies in order to meet shipping deadlines for annual supply vessel delivery. Position monitors all work in-progress to ensure quality, timely completion and control of material. Incumbent provides labor and material support to USAP field camps and other stations as directed. Performs follow up inspections as required on equipment. Documents work order progress, maintains records of shop activities and prepares and submits reports as requested. Incumbent handles confidential matters (personnel actions, management reports, etc.) in accordance with PAE and management guidelines and policies. VMF Supervisor will perform duties in support of Operations Division metrics and will provide training and orientation for subordinate employees on performance, documentation and activities that affect the achievement Operations Division metrics. Adequately and honestly track all data related to metrics. Supports the achievement of ASC metrics, whether metrics can be directly or indirectly affected by this position's activities. Updates Cost Account Manager (CAM) with monthly financial projections and reviews time sheets for personnel in VMF WBS (work breakdown structure). Complies with all ASC Environmental Health & Safety, and Quality Assurance, requirements and goals and provide documentation to these divisions as necessary to ensure adequate and legal documentation. Position may perform other duties as required.

item.title: Financial Systems Administrator/Analyst
item.description: Details: Vaco Atlanta Financial is recruiting for a newly created Financial Systems Administrator for our client located in Midtown Atlanta. This is a perfect role for systems oriented accountants to progress their career with a stable and growing company that affords multiple growth opportunities: Responsibilities: Own the GL (mapping, structure and integrity) Design and produce reports, forecasts and budgets Responsible for set- up and maintenance of application profiles, codes, templates and users Responsible for systems training and documentation Manage internal helpdesk tickets related to the application , track ing and resolving known bugs/issues with IT and the external software company's support group . Project manage all patch releases and upgrade implementations Build user specified, custom reports with the application Accounting department representative for certain IT rollouts Other special projects as requested and some travel will be required Requirements: 3+ years of accounting and/or systems related accounting experience Bachelor's degree required Great written and verbal communication skills including experience with process documentation and training Proficiency with databases including query knowledge of financial systems Strong base of knowledge in the underpinnings of financial systems including reconciling out of balance conditions Advanced Microsoft Excel skills Ability to create SQL queries and design MS Access reports a big plus Prior experience as a systems administrator a big plus Project management skills a big plus

item.title: Customer Service Rep DIRECTV
item.description: Details: Customer Services Reps Needed! 15 Full time positions open! At Wolverine Specialized Marketing we specialize in in-store marketing campaigns for DIRECTV. We work inside of America’s largest retail stores helping them promote their brand and acquire new customers. We offer a guaranteed starting salary of between 30k-40k yearly based on 40 hour weeks and also offer a commission structure on top. Our commission plan is aggressive. The most successful employees earn well above guaranteed hourly rate. We are looking for future leaders to grow into a management role with our company while focusing on the following areas: • Development of marketing campaigns and strategies • Customer service and client acquisition • Implementation of product launches • Rigorous leadership training • Expanding this exciting program into over 700 additional retail locations throughout the US • In-store promotional advertising

item.title: Senior Accountant
item.description: Details: CompanyProfile : Bethlehem Shared Services provides professional services exclusively for CigarsInternational and its affiliates, the fastest growing cigar company in thecountry, and leading online and direct marketer of fine cigars, premium pipetobaccos, luxury gifts and accessories, and more. Our Corporate Headquarters is located in the heart of the Lehigh Valley inhistoric Bethlehem, PA. While our roots are in direct marketing and we have astrong e-commerce presence, we also have two (2) Retail locations in the LehighValley, and our flagship 10,000 square foot retail super-store in Hamburg, PA. Benefits of working at Bethlehem Shared Services: We operate in a very open environment and you will be tested and genuinely empowered. We work with the latest tools, technology and techniques to continuously improve our business. We tap into the imagination and creativity of our team members to help us be at the forefront of our industry. We are dedicated to providing a world-class experience for our customers. We operate in an environment in which you will be challenged as well as demands initiative and innovation encourages open communication and the sharing of ideas at all levels, and provides the opportunity for every employee to make a difference. We expect our people to never stop seeking new ways to help us grow and win. You will be challenged daily and genuinely empowered. You will be a part of an organization 300+ employees strong and possibly you can make us stronger and help us continually grow. If you feel that this is an environment where you could thrive and grow, and are looking for a challenge that will leave you energized and itching to get to work each day, then you could find a great home within our organization. Come grow with us! We are currently seeking a Senior Accountant in our corporate offices in Bethlehem, PA who is up to the challenge outlined above and of course below. Responsibilities include but not limited to : Assist with month end close including preparing journal entries Reporting within COGNOS Assist with annual budget preparation Assist with preparation of monthly reporting packages for management Prepare and analyze monthly departmental P&L’s Assist with tax planning needs for auditors Assist with internal control testing and reporting needs Financial analytics Reviewing and analyzing monthly financial performance Provide explanations to management Attend weekly retail meeting Work closely with retail managers to be efficient and effective Work closely with Retail Director to analyze stores and determine trends, focal points, areas for improvement relating to sales, margins, and expenses Assist with inventory maintenance including Retail store cycle counts Retail order picking/delivery process and procedures Retail order returns to warehouse Managing min/max inventory ordering tool Perform various reporting relating to shipping revenue and expense Prepare and record month end journal entries Support and participate in special projects (AD-HOC reports) as assigned Perform other duties as required.

item.title: Genius / MINI Genius
item.description: Details: As a Bill Jacobs MINI Genius, you will be the go-to guy or girl for all facts great and small about the magnificent MINI range. You are a people person, your natural enthusiasm combined with the vivid descriptions of MINI vehicle features you share on test drives will make a memorable customer experience better still. Don’t worry if you’re not a MINI mastermind right now – our training will ensure MINI will be pumping through your veins in no time. As one of the most adventurous automotive brand in the world, Bill Jacobs MINI relies on a motivated retail network that can really deliver the goods. The handpicked teams we employ have a dedication and spirit that sets them apart from mere mortals. In return for their passion and commitment, a thrilling career awaits the chosen few. We go to the ends of the earth (and sometimes farther) to find men and women with the right stuff to join Bill Jacobs MINI, so when we find them we do everything we can to keep hold of them. Their enthusiasm and positivity sets them apart, as well as their pride in all things MINI. As an important cog in the MINI dealer network, you’ll be at the forefront of the automotive industry, promoting the world’s most charismatic car brand, as well as working with cutting-edge technologies that make motoring both exhilarating and sustainable. You’ll be working alongside motivated people who will respect your energy and professionalism. You’ll be part of a team of like-minded MINI enthusiasts who will inspire and motivate you. You’ll receive on-going training and development which will keep you up to speed with the latest industry innovations. And, of course, you’ll be rewarded with a generous compensation package and attractive fringe benefits including rich health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, employee assistance program, tuition reimbursement, 401K Plan with company contribution, generous paid time off program, employee discounts on vehicle purchases, parts, and service, and wellness programs for employees and family members.

item.title: SOX Audit job in Dallas, TX (25% travel)
item.description: Details: Parker &Lynch is looking to fill a SOX Audit job in Dallas, TX. This position is open due to growth within Fortune 500 manufacturing organization. This position has 25% Travel. The SOX Audit job duties include: -Participates in the development and execution of test plans, and assists those that perform tests as needed. -Performs testing of internal controls in accordance with annual SOX audit plan. -Assists in documenting the company’s process flows, policies, and controls. -Provides input in scoping and planning the timing of the company’s SOX activities. -Assists in changing processes and controls that result from management testing results or external audit team recommendations. -Coordinates SOX testing with other departments, locations, divisions, and external auditors, including senior management. -Prepares and submits reports on the results of SOX audit, recommending improvements in policies, procedures, and operations. -Communicates status of audit results to management. Qualifications: -Bachelor degree in Accounting or equivalent education and experience -Two to four years of professional accounting or auditing experience -Public Accounting experience preferred -CPA preferred If you are interested in this SOX Audit job or other Accounting and Finance career opportunities from Parker + Lynch please email Rami Muhanna at or visit our website at www.parkerlynch.com.

item.title: Project Manager/ Field Supervisor
item.description: Details: South Bay property management company, located in Redondo Beach, seeks a Project Manager/Field Supervisor We are looking for a team player that works independently, learns quickly, is a self starter and works efficiently to meet deadlines. Responsibilities Include: - Perform monthly and semi-annual inspections of the properties - Be responsible for managing vacancy turns and standardization in the company - Supervise maintenance staff for quality control and standardization - Work with maintenance staff and onsite managers to establish onsite inventory - Purchase necessary hardware and fixtures for unit turns, as needed - Perform some maintenance work, as needed - Perform internal billing of maintenance performed - Be the lead for any project management needed at the properties - Responsible for preparing budgets for projects and vacancy turns - Post 3-day notices to Pay or Quit - Collect coins from Laundry machines

item.title: Senior RF DAS Engineer
item.description: Details: Our client is a global OEM and professional services provider of Fiber DAS products headquartered here in the US. They are a well-known manufacture of DAS, small-cell products and solutions. Our client is a leading choice on most carrier’s vendor/approval list for DAS IBS solutions. They operate in the carrier, enterprise and public safety markets. They have been growing over 20% year-over-year and forecast 2015 to be their best year yet. They are currently looking for a Senior RF DAS Engineer to be the right hand person to the Director of the group supporting the West Region. This person will be working virtually out of a home office and traveling on-site when needed. Our client has a strong professional reputation as their focus is on having the best engineers in the business providing training, certifications, and support to all engineers on the team. This role offers: Working for a company with a strong reputation in the wireless industry already on many vendor/approval list for both carriers and integrators. Fast growing company that has doubled in size over the past few years, had a banner year in 2013, and is looking to double in size again. Professional growth as they encourage motivate and support individual growth in external learning, training, and certifications. Leadership and visibility as this person will be the right hand engineer to the Director helping to maintain the engineering team’s strong morals, professional reputation, and team building. Full time position with a generous base salary, bonus, benefits, stock options, 401K, tuition reimbursement, trainings, certifications, perks, etc. FOCUS: Designing using iBwave software. Conducting on-site analysis, data collection and processing data. Optimizing distributed antenna systems (DAS) to maximize coverage and capacity needs. Perform troubleshooting while making recommendations for improvement of current systems. Presenting reports and presentations as well as on-site and/or online training. Producing technical materials. Spec sheets. User manuals. Troubleshooting guides. White papers. Managing all steps of turnkey projects. Site survey. RF design. Installation. Commissioning. Optimization. Testing.

item.title: Cooks/Servers/Dishwashers
item.description: Details: Cook, Server and Dishwasher positions Cooks Responsibilities include the preparation and serving of meals, sanitation of food service area and serving in accordance with company compliance. In serving the residents you will ensure all needs are met and prepare food as directed. Compliance with all food safety and risk management requirements are essential. item.title: Financial Analyst job in Dallas, TX
item.description: Details: Parker + Lynch is looking to fill a Financial Analyst position with an established healthcare company. This position will support the senior management team and various operating groups. This position will be responsible for financial modeling and forecasting. The ideal candidate will have two plus years’ experience working in a finance group as an analyst. Financial Analyst duties include: -Forecast and analyze capital projects for financial justification -Budget and forecast depreciation and yearly capital spends -Meet regularly with project management regarding latest project spend and financial reviews -Design, improve, and rebuild financial and capital models -Present monthly P&Ls and forward looking forecasts to operations -Work with cross functional teams on various operational and capital projects -Analyze project operations, including ROI, IRR, NPV, and payback -Identify cost-saving and profit maximizing opportunities to improve current processes Desired skills and experience: -Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Business Administration required -MBA preferred -At least 2 years of related analytical experience -Experience with large ERP systems If you are interested in this Financial Analyst job or other Accounting and Finance career opportunities from Parker + Lynch please email Rami Muhanna at or visit our website at www.parkerlynch.com.

item.description: Details: We are working with our client who is a global integrator working with the mobile operators. This is a permanent positions (Aggressive base salary, performance bonus, 401K W/company match, stock options and equity, full tuition/education reimbursement, trainings, certifications, full Blue Cross medical benefits with excellent company coverage, travel perks, per diems) We are looking for engineers who enjoy being part of a team and want to grow professionally. Perform troubleshooting while making recommendations for improvement of current systems. Train, coach, mentor Jr engineers and technicians Managing all steps of turnkey projects. Site survey. RF design. Installation. Commissioning. Optimization. Testing.

item.title: DCS - Director of Nursing
item.description: Details: Director of Clinical Services At Consulate Health Care, we’ve succeeded because of our employees – a caring team of highly trained professionals who are committed to providing health services with compassion, honesty, integrity and respect. From short-term transitional care and rehabilitation to long-term nursing and Alzheimer’s care, you help us achieve excellence by setting and exceeding high standards in healthcare. We are a proud network of people who care for our residents. At Consulate, you can build a challenging and rewarding career with competitive benefits, and a full range of opportunities for professional growth. As a Director of Clinical Services you are delegated the administrative authority, responsibility, and accountability necessary for carrying out your assigned duties. Essential Responsibilities of the Director of Clinical Services are: Supervise Nurse Practitioner, Assistant Director of Clinical Services, Clinical Nurses, and Nurse Techs In the absence of the Executive Director, you are charged with carrying out the resident care policies of the facility Recruit and hire a sufficient number of qualified nursing staff to deliver efficient resident care Prepare and adhere to an annual operating budget for the nursing department Establish and monitor compliance with an effective medical record documentation system

item.title: Full Time: Retail Sales Positions- Immediate Hire with Room to Grow!
item.description: Details: Don’t want to be stuck in a cubicle? Looking for growth and career advancement? Are you a motivated professional that likes to work in a team environment? Have a proven track record of driving results and providing excellent service? Then come join a winning team! Our company has a great opportunity for you as a Junior Account Manager! A day in the life of an Account Manager: As a Junior Account Manager, you will play a key role in our client's success by selling their products and services at designated big box retailers to customers in store. We offer: Competitive pay Full Benefits (Anthem Blue Cross) Cell phone reimbursement Career Advancement Travel Paid Training Personalized Development Track

item.title: Senior Staff Accountant job in Dallas, TX
item.description: Details: Parker &Lynch is looking to fill a Senior Staff Accountant job in Dallas, TX. This position will be responsible for monthly financial reporting and analysis along with monthly consolidations. The Senior Staff Accountant job duties include: -Monthly financial reporting and analysis -Prepare month end financial statements/reports for several entities -Consolidating of several entities -Account analysis and reconciliation -Journal entry preparation -Bank account reconciliations -Inter-company account reconciliations -Ad-hoc financial analysis Qualifications: -Bachelors Degree in Accounting -2-5 years of current accounting experience -Strong analytical skills and ability to focus on details -Proficiency with Excel -Excellent verbal and written communication skills If you are interested in this Senior Staff Accountant job or other Accounting and Finance career opportunities from Parker + Lynch please email Rami Muhanna at or visit our website at www.parkerlynch.com.

item.title: DCS - Director of Nursing
item.description: Details: Director of Clinical Services At Consulate Health Care, we’ve succeeded because of our employees – a caring team of highly trained professionals who are committed to providing health services with compassion, honesty, integrity and respect. From short-term transitional care and rehabilitation to long-term nursing and Alzheimer’s care, you help us achieve excellence by setting and exceeding high standards in healthcare. We are a proud network of people who care for our residents. At Consulate, you can build a challenging and rewarding career with competitive benefits, and a full range of opportunities for professional growth. As a Director of Clinical Services you are delegated the administrative authority, responsibility, and accountability necessary for carrying out your assigned duties. Essential Responsibilities of the Director of Clinical Services are: Supervise Nurse Practitioner, Assistant Director of Clinical Services, Clinical Nurses, and Nurse Techs In the absence of the Executive Director, you are charged with carrying out the resident care policies of the facility Recruit and hire a sufficient number of qualified nursing staff to deliver efficient resident care Prepare and adhere to an annual operating budget for the nursing department Establish and monitor compliance with an effective medical record documentation system

item.title: Office Cleaning Associate-part time
item.description: Details: Part-time Office Cleaning Associate Cary, NC Job Description: We are currently looking for a part-time Office Cleaning Associate. As the Office Cleaning Associate you will be responsible for cleaning offices, restrooms and break rooms. This involves dusting, vacuuming, cleaning glass, removing trash, cleaning restroom fixtures and break room areas, dust mopping and wet mopping. This position will perform various daily/weekly cleaning tasks, minor repairs and projects. The hours will be Monday-Friday 10am-2pm. Key Responsibilities: • Cleaning offices • Clean and sanitize restrooms • Clean and maintain break rooms • Clean and maintain kitchen • Dusting • Vacuuming • Glass cleaning • Trash and recycling • Refilling towel dispenser and toilet paper dispensers • Sweep and mop floors • Maintain a clean working environment for all staff and visitors. • Ensure all areas are safe • Other duties as assigned

item.title: Loan Operations Data Intergrity Specialist
item.description: Details: Description: The Loan Operations Data Integrity Specialist will prepare loan booking sheets on new loans, renewals and modifications to ensure accuracy, consistency and regulatory compliance for all data entered in the loan accounting system. Responsibilities include but are not limited to: Review each loan approval for appropriate lending authority based on loan type, exposure limit, etc. to ensure approvals are in compliance with Bank’s Lending authority requirements as outlined in the Credit Policy Manual. Review loan packages for compliance with regulatory requirements i.e. Flood, HMDA, CRA, REG B, etc. Review lender supplied loan forms; i.e. TDR Assessment, LTV Calculator, Loan Exceptions, CIP, etc. for accuracy, consistency and compliance with procedures and directives published by Credit Risk Management. Work with lender to resolve any issues found; report any discrepancies to supervising manager as appropriate. For New loans: Read loan documents, approved loan offering and commitment letter (if applicable), and prepare booking sheets for processing clerks to utilize for Miser input. Select appropriate loan account type and Miser codes required to accurately input borrower information, loan terms, billing parameters, collateral information, escrow impound, deferred fees , deferred expenses, prepayment penalties, scheduled rate and payment changes, CALL Report codes, ticklers for exception tracking, etc. based on loan terms, bank policy, procedures and regulatory requirements. For Line renewals and modifications: Prepare coding sheets based on new loan terms approved on loan offering and/ or commitment letter and new/ modified loan documents. Earn out any existing fees, reset prepayment penalties etc., as applicable. Resolve any discrepancies in borrower name, address, tax id, etc. with lender, documentation department, branch system and / or CIF Department as needed. Distribute prepared loan booking sheets to Note Tellers for processing. Audit output review to identify and resolve any keying errors. Update error tracking spreadsheets for Sr. Mgmt as needed. Distribute files and insert documents to scanning, post closing or record retention for processing as appropriate.

item.title: Project Accountant needed for a top tier Real Estate Investment Company
item.description: Details: Parker+Lynch is looking to hire a Project Accountant in Dallas TX. The ideal candidate has three years of experience within public accounting. This position is with a top tier real estate company. The position will be a mix of general accounting and analysis. Motivated individuals looking to advance their career should apply. Project Accountant duties include: -Assist with management reporting, financial statement preparation and budgets -Prepare and review of monthly and quarterly reports -Prepare and review cash flow projections for valuation model and variance analysis -Assist with the formation of new projects -Assist with supervision of Staff Accountants Desired skills and experience: -Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance -CPA or CPA candidate is a must -Must be able to multi-task and pay attention to detail -Possess strong written and communication skills If you are interested in this Project Accountant job or other Accounting and Finance career opportunities from Parker + Lynch please email Rami Muhanna at or visit our website at www.parkerlynch.com.

item.title: RN Registered Nurse (Home Healthcare / Nursing)
item.description: Details: North Arkansas Home Care seeking applicants for PRN Home Health RN. As a Registered Nurse, you will educate patients and their caregivers on their conditions and the steps needed to ensure proper recovery. Additional responsibilities of our Registered Nurse include: Provide admission, case management, and follow-up skilled nursing visits for home health patients. Administer on-going care and case management for each patient, provide necessary follow-up as directed by the Clinical Manager. Confer with physician in developing the initial plan of treatment based on physician''s orders and initial patient assessment. Render hands-on care, management and evaluation of the care plan and teaching of the patient in accordance with physician orders, under Clinical Manager''s supervision. Revise plan in consultation with physician based on ongoing assessments and as required by policy/regulation. Coordinate appropriate care, encompassing various healthcare personnel (such as Physical Therapists, Occupational Therapists, MSW, Home Health Aides and external providers). Report patient care/condition/progress to patient''s physician and Clinical Manager on a continuous basis. Implement patient care plan in conjunction with patient and family to assist them in achieving optimal resolution of needs/problems. Coordinate/oversee/supervise the work of Home Health Aides, Certified Home Health Aides and Personal Care Workers and provides written personal care instructions/care plan that reflect current plan of care. Monitor the appropriate completion of documentation by home health aides/personal care workers as part of the supervisory/leadership responsibility. Discharge patients after consultation with the physician and Clinical Manager, preparing and completing needed clinical documentation. Participating in the Quality Assurance/Quality Improvement Process Preparing accurate, orderly and timely reports and documentation Adhering to all practice standards as they apply to patient care Required Skills: Associate''s of Science degree in Nursing Valid RN license in state of employment Valid driver''s license and one year clean driving record Ability to drive within 30-60 miles daily Ability to successfully complete required background check and drug screen Excellent writing and charting skills, experience with electronic medical record preferred Required Experience: Minimum 1 year acute care nursing experience, home health experience preferred At LHC Group, you’ll find the support and resources you need to keep learning, achieve work-life balance and be recognized for your achievements. Your ideas can take root among a talent team of healthcare professionals focused on providing quality patient care. The quality of care we deliver is a direct result of our 10,000-person strong work force that brings clinical innovation to life each day. At LHC Group, we are committed to investing in the growth and development of our employees – from an industry-leading internal credentialing program to a state of the art learning management system. Benefits packages for qualified employees include: • Flexible schedule• Competitive compensation• Health, dental, and vision coverage (health coverage for part time employees)• Short- and long-term disability• Disability buy-up gap plan• Life insurance• Cancer insurance• Critical illness insurance• Medsupport insurance• Accident insurance• Flexible spending accounts• Employee assistance program• 401(k) with company match• Employee stock purchase plan• Bereavement pay• Orientation period• CEU’s through online management systems• Paid time off• Holiday pay• Company vehicle program available for qualified employees The LHC Group difference With hundreds of locations across the nation, we partner with local physicians, nurses and therapists to provide high-quality and compassionate care to nearly 100,000 patients annually. Our commitment to innovation and service excellence influences every facet of patient care and is the cornerstone of our industry-leading clinical programs, like T3 and Beyond Balance. We are proud to be the preferred post-acute care partner for leading hospitals and health systems around the country – operating more than 100 joint venture locations nationwide. Strength, stability and clinical expertise – that’s the LHC Group difference. LHC Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and drug free workplace.

item.title: Lead Mechanical Design Engineer - 62367
item.description: Details: Job Summary As a Lead Engineer, you will be able to technically lead the entire cross functional design team on their interactions and responsibilities for that project. A Lead Engineer is responsible for insuring the phase gate technical milestones are met, is the leader of technical reviews, and is responsible for making sure that the specification requirements inputs and design outputs align. This engineer will have demonstrated experience at releasing product into a production environment. Essential Duties & Responsibilities - Meet the requirements of Sr Design Engineer - Would be considered a SME (Subject Matter Expert) in their field of competency - Will represent Jabil Design Services in technical customer discussions / meetings - Work with Project Managers in the quoting process - Provide technical input to help identify and solve project risks that may affect overall project plans and schedules - Is expected to support the development and utilization of processes for design - At the appropriate process phase gates, drive the delivery of a complete design package to be entered into our PDM system consisting of requirements and design documentation, databases, BOM’s, etc. - Lead all elements of design engineering including design reviews, design verification requirement & Spec developments and implementation - Mentoring Sr Design Engineers and below - Provide onsite technical support for all manufacturing builds including engineering prototypes, NPI & production releases - Stay abreast of the latest technology and techniques to provide designs that are competitive and cost effective - Support management in identifying internal and external resources to support product development - May perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned Education & Experience Requirements - Bachelor's degree in Engineering from an accredited four-year college or university - Plus a minimum of 9 - 10 years of related experience and/or training - With a minimum of 2 years experience as a Sr Design Engineer - Specific requirements as defined by the market sector - Or an equivalent combination of education, training or experience

item.title: Pharma Operator-Chemical Technician
item.description: Details: Kelly is a global talent and workforce recruiter for 90% of the Fortune 500 and 89% of the Fortune 100. We are the staffing and talent recruiting partner for major employers and manufacturers throughout North Iowa. We are searching and interviewing skilled machine and manufacturing Chemical Technicians to join the team of our global chemical-pharmaceutical manufacturing leader, based in North Iowa. This is an opportunity to join an employee based company who is excelling in the pharmaceutical manufacturing industry. As a Pharma Operator, you will be expected to successfully produce chemical and pharmaceutical products in our client's manufacturing environment. Pharma experience helpful, but not required. These are Direct Hire Career Opportunities. No placement fee!

item.title: SEO Statistical Analyst
item.description: Details: Acurian is looking for a Statistical Analyst to support the Site Enrollment Optimization (SEO) Department who has the ability to analyze large healthcare-related datasets in order to produce actionable insights for internal teams and pharmaceutical clients. If you love to crunch numbers and analyze data, you may be the person for this job! No pharmaceutical industry experience required. Company Overview: Acurian is a leading full-service provider of clinical trial patient enrollment and retention solutions for the life sciences industry. Acurian distinguishes itself as technology-enabled service company with unparalleled investment in analytics and software. Acurian is a subsidiary of PPD, a leading global CRO, who provides drug discovery, development, lifecycle management and laboratory services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device, academic and government organizations. Job Overview: As part of the Analytics team primarily supporting the SEO department, you will be responsible for making recommendations on enrollment strategy, both within the U.S. and globally, as well as identifying issues and opportunities hidden in the data. Ability to work well in a fast-paced and collaborative team environment coupled with excellent communication skills are crucial to the success of this position as you will be interacting extensively with internal teams to ensure that business objectives are met. Job Responsibilities: Provide in-depth operational analytics for the Site Enrollment Optimization (SEO) department in order to solve current business problems and improve performance. Develop and execute reports to help measure the effectiveness of the Enrollment Optimization efforts that also strategize where additional site-support efforts should be targeted. Evaluate historical experience with prospective site footprint in order to make site optimization recommendations to PPD and the client. Work with the SEO group to develop and maintain data structure best practices as well as helping to develop more automated reporting to improve efficiency. Using client-provided reports identify patients in our internal database to accurately report project enrollment.

item.title: Panda Express - Restaurant Manager - Red Oak, TX - West Texas
item.description: Details: 22,000 Panda Associates living one common mission: “Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives.” Known as the ʺPanda Way,ʺ our company culture places special emphasis on encouraging our Associates to focus on a healthy lifestyle, continuous learning, developing others and acknowledging others. We believe that this, coupled with our five fundamental values – proactive, respect/win-win, growth, great operations and giving – provides our Associates with an environment where they can both inspire and be inspired. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn concept, our full service restaurants; Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food served in a fast casual environment; and Hibachi-San, our Japanese grill mall-based restaurants. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. With annual sales of more than $1.5 billion, we continue to add more than 100 new units annually. Panda offers excellent benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have opportunities available in our restaurants nationwide as well as within our corporate office located in the Los Angeles area. Join our growing team with more than 1,500 locations across North America. Job Description Are you Craving a Career? Ready for Growth? COME SEE WHY PANDA MIGHT BE THE RIGHT PLACE! At Panda, we all share a common mission: "Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives." We invest in our people because great people run great operations that will exceed our guests' expectations. Talk to any of our associates and you will experience a culture dedicated to its mission and our five fundamental values- Proactive, Respect/Win-Win, Growth, Great Operations, and Giving. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn fine dining restaurants, Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food concept served in a fast casual environment, and Hibachi San, our Japanese grill concept. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. Panda offers competitive benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have restaurant positions available nationwide and support center positions in Rosemead, CA. Come join the nation's largest and fastest growing Asian restaurant company. Our continued growth in this location has created new career opportunities for Management, Crew Members, and Kitchen Team Members!!! Come join us. Restaurant Management Team responsibilities: Lead all or some People aspects of a Panda Express restaurant including hiring, training, coaching, and development Ensure the safety of our Guests and Associates through training and execution of food safety and restaurant safety standards and guidelines Lead all or some Guest components of a Panda Express restaurant including excellent food quality, guest service, associate friendliness, and restaurant cleanliness through your team using proven systems and routines Lead all or some financial areas of a Panda Express restaurant including sales growth, cost management, and profit growth Applies thorough knowledge of all policies, procedures and practices utilized within unit managed Understands ways in which unit relates to and impacts PRG Demonstrates knowledge of PRG operations and objectives Seeks information regarding trends affecting food service industry We offer our Full-Time Management Team: Progressive Compensation Package and Excellent Bonus Opportunity 5 or more Weeks of Comprehensive Training to prepare you for success On-Going Career & Leadership Development Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 401 K with Company Match Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Associate Discounts (Panda Express, Hibachi San, Panda Inn plus Theme Parks) and free meals when you work Lucrative Associate Referral Bonus Pre-Tax Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account Qualifications Qualifications: College degree or equivalent experience preferred High school or GED required Additional expectations of our Management Team are: Excellent leaders with great people skills Proactive – Sees life as choices and chooses to make a positive impact. People Oriented – enjoys working with our guests and associates, possess good communication and interpersonal skills. Growth Oriented – knows that learning and growth are keys to personal and professional success and is willing and able to share learning with others. Results Oriented – focuses on getting results without compromising guest, people, and financial areas. ADA Statement: While performing duties, counter areas are often hot with steam from steam table and food vapors. Work space is restricted and employees are expected to remain standing for long periods of time. Employees must prepare hot and cold foods, use Chinese cook knife and other kitchen equipment and work quickly without losing accuracy. Employees may be required to lift up to 50 lbs., stand up to four hours and reach across counter tops measured at 36 inches to serve customers. Kitchens are hot and noise levels are usually high; storage space is limited and shelving is high. Panda Restaurant Group, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer Panda Restaurant Group, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

For immediate and confidential consideration on this Permanent (Direct) Hire Position, please contact me directly, Carrie Danger, Division Director Permanent Placement Team, Iowa Region at 515-282-6876 , and e-mail resume confidentially to (profile on LinkedIn). Your resume will not be submitted to any client companies without your direct permission. Our fees are paid by our client companies, never any fees to you, our candidates. (PERM POSITION)

item.title: BH - Host/Hostess
item.description: Details: Greets and welcomes guests upon arrival. Answers telephone, takes reservations and manages the efficient and timely seating of guests to a table providing menu and server information once seated. Manages special seating requests consistent with table seating guidelines and table availability. Relays guest seating and information to servers and bus persons. Oversees dining room activity to ensure guest seating efficiency.

item.title: Customer Service Rep
item.description: Details: Our client is looking for entry level associates with a Bachelors degree or equivalent experience within a call center and a solid work history. This opportunity will be within resolving issues for homeowners about their mortgages, providing information on amounts owed, due date, payoff amounts due, principal balances, etc. There will also be payment processing plans set up and reviewing homeowner accounts to see what best options are available to them when they are no longer able to pay for their home without falling into foreclosure. *Research and resolve customer problems that require in-depth research and provide written explanations of research problems. *Review trial and final escrow analysis reports to determine the accuracy of the analysis. Provide verbal and written explanations of escrow analysis to mortgagors. *Review short payments to determine if these payments should be applied. *Provide mortgage verifications as requested by mortgagors. *Assist with tax research, HUD subsidy loan re-certification, monthly HUD subsidy billing, partial release of security processing, and optional insurance set-up and remittance as assigned. *Complete other duties and projects as assigned by the Customer Service Manager. Must be comfortable in a call center environment Customer Service skills a must These positions are for contract-hire assignments and pay ranges $14-15/hour About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: Quality Control Inspector
item.description: Details: This position is for a Quality Control Inspector and they will be responsible for testing and inspecting products to determine & maintain the quality and reliability of the company's products. Only 2 positions available - Direct Placement They will perform required inspections to assure incoming materials and finished products conform to customer specifications, company standards and regulatory requirements. Inspections shall verify that products meet food safety and regulatory requirements using established procedures at prescribed frequencies. Results of all inspections shall be documented per company standard operating procedures including immediate reporting and corrective action of deficiencies. Must Have Skills WANTED: GMP, Inspection, documentation, good attitude, Food or Plastic Packaging Experience About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: CDL Class A & B Drivers
item.description: Details: CDL Class A & B Drivers wanted. Must have at-least 1 years’ driving experience Must have good driving record Must have current medical card

item.title: Medical Payment Poster
item.description: Details: Ref ID: 00210-139734 Classification: Accounting - Medical Compensation: $16.00 to $18.00 per hour *Payment Poster* Robert half is experiencing a high demand for a Medical Payment Poster. The Medical Payment Poster will be accountable for posting patient payments through the practice management system. Development of relationships with both internal and external customers is essential to the success of this role. This includes: proactive information sharing and communicating effectively to facilitate complete understanding of payment posting as needed to the appropriate parties through established communication channels Balancing payments against accounting department totals, completing the closeout process of journals, generating ERAs, zero pay remittances, and all other pertinent EOB information which defines pay status or non-payment due to deductibles, ensuring all needed information is accounted for. Applying payments and insurance credits to patient accounts, and balance to bank accounts Filing appeals to insurance carriers for improper payments or disallowances. Answering phone calls from insurance carriers regarding patient billing, balance billing and incorrect payment by the carrier.

item.title: Inside Sales
item.description: Details: Inside Sales / Manufacturing background (Valves)1St Choice Staffing – Houston, TX Inside Sales / Manufacturing background (Valves) • Prepares quotes, sales orders and purchase orders in QuickBooks. • Makes outbound lead follow-up calls to potential and existing customers by telephone and e-mail to qualify leads and sell products and services. • Handles inbound sales lead calls to convert calls into sales. • Overcomes technical and business objections of prospective customers. • Tracks inventory levels. • Estimates date of delivery to customer, based on knowledge of own firm's production and delivery schedules. • Builds and maintains customers’ relationships. • Prepares reports of business transactions. • Enters new customer data and other sales data for current customers into computer database. • Works with outside sales representatives to keep account activities and literature up to date. • Investigates and resolves customer problems with deliveries.

item.title: Sports Minded Consultant - Sales - Marketing - Management
item.description: Details: Sports Minded Consultant - Sales - Management Have you always loved sports and competition? Do you enjoy working in teams or being management for that team? Do you love a challenge and have you always been looked at as a leader? Do you enjoy being rewarded for your hard work? For Immediate consideration submit resumes to: or Call Tara in HR at 708-800-6330 Welcome to South Chicago Marketing , where you won’t get stuck in an entry level sales position with no potential for growth into management. We start all our sports minded consultants at entry level for the sole purpose of developing a strong management team from within; with the mentality that no one can coach a sport they haven’t played. We do not believe in seniority, we promote to management those who get the job done. What we are looking for: Competitive individuals with a winning mentality to move up into management FAST! Sports minded and Energetic team players Team captains ready to lead and train Superior student mentality Candidates who are serious about a long term career with a growing industry Candidates who are ready to grow from the ground up into one of our next Market Managers! Our Sports - minded team enjoys: Excellent work environment where fun meets success Support and backing from Fortune 500 clients Weekly bonuses and incentive plans Upward mobility with a personal business mentor provided to each crew member Paid training bonus’ and weekly leadership development meetings Travel opportunities

item.title: HUMAN RESOURCES COORDINATOR-BENEFITS
item.description: Details: The Salvation Army - San Diego, CA. Assist the Divisional Human Resources Manager in giving support when processing any and all personnel matters.Responsible for benefits and HIPAA compliance. Assist the Divisional Human Resources Director in giving oversight and office related support when processing any and all personnel matters pertaining to employee benefits, child safety and HIPAA compliance. Provide appropriate paperwork and processes for employee benefit programs to include, 403B, Health, Dental, and Aflac, Medical continuation, Flexible Spending, Short term disability etc. This may include inputting newly hired benefit eligible employee into database and sending out confirmation letters. Establishing a system to track timely enrollment into company benefits. This may include sending out reminder notices about enrollment eligibility. Reconcile benefit deductions between payroll and HR on a monthly basis; process payment to vendors via check approval process. We offer an excellent benefits package which includes: medical, dental, vision, short term disability, long term disability, retirement plans, educational assistance, life insurance, paid holidays and generous vacation and sick leave benefits.

item.title: Senior Staff Accountant job in Frisco, TX
item.description: Details: Parker &Lynch is looking to fill a Senior Staff Accountant job in Frisco, TX. This position will be responsible for monthly financial reporting and analysis along with monthly consolidations. The Senior Staff Accountant job duties include: -Monthly financial reporting and analysis -Prepare month end financial statements/reports for several entities -Consolidating of several entities -Account analysis and reconciliation -Journal entry preparation -Bank account reconciliations -Inter-company account reconciliations -Ad-hoc financial analysis Qualifications: -Bachelors Degree in Accounting -2-5 years of current accounting experience -Strong analytical skills and ability to focus on details -Proficiency with Excel -Excellent verbal and written communication skills If you are interested in this Senior Staff Accountant job or other Accounting and Finance career opportunities from Parker + Lynch please email Rami Muhanna at or visit our website at www.parkerlynch.com.

item.title: RN Registered Nurse (Home Healthcare / Nursing)
item.description: Details: PRN Home Health RN needed for Elite Home Health - Fort Smith, AR. As a Registered Nurse, you will educate patients and their caregivers on their conditions and the steps needed to ensure proper recovery. Additional responsibilities of our Registered Nurse include: Provide admission, case management, and follow-up skilled nursing visits for home health patients. Administer on-going care and case management for each patient, provide necessary follow-up as directed by the Clinical Manager. Confer with physician in developing the initial plan of treatment based on physician''s orders and initial patient assessment. Render hands-on care, management and evaluation of the care plan and teaching of the patient in accordance with physician orders, under Clinical Manager''s supervision. Revise plan in consultation with physician based on ongoing assessments and as required by policy/regulation. Coordinate appropriate care, encompassing various healthcare personnel (such as Physical Therapists, Occupational Therapists, MSW, Home Health Aides and external providers). Report patient care/condition/progress to patient''s physician and Clinical Manager on a continuous basis. Implement patient care plan in conjunction with patient and family to assist them in achieving optimal resolution of needs/problems. Coordinate/oversee/supervise the work of Home Health Aides, Certified Home Health Aides and Personal Care Workers and provides written personal care instructions/care plan that reflect current plan of care. Monitor the appropriate completion of documentation by home health aides/personal care workers as part of the supervisory/leadership responsibility. Discharge patients after consultation with the physician and Clinical Manager, preparing and completing needed clinical documentation. Participating in the Quality Assurance/Quality Improvement Process Preparing accurate, orderly and timely reports and documentation Adhering to all practice standards as they apply to patient care Required Skills: Associate''s of Science degree in Nursing Valid RN license in state of employment Valid driver''s license and one year clean driving record Ability to drive within 30-60 miles daily Ability to successfully complete required background check and drug screen Excellent writing and charting skills, experience with electronic medical record preferred Required Experience: Minimum 1 year acute care nursing experience, home health experience preferred At LHC Group, you’ll find the support and resources you need to keep learning, achieve work-life balance and be recognized for your achievements. Your ideas can take root among a talent team of healthcare professionals focused on providing quality patient care. The quality of care we deliver is a direct result of our 10,000-person strong work force that brings clinical innovation to life each day. At LHC Group, we are committed to investing in the growth and development of our employees – from an industry-leading internal credentialing program to a state of the art learning management system. Benefits packages for qualified employees include: • Flexible schedule• Competitive compensation• Health, dental, and vision coverage (health coverage for part time employees)• Short- and long-term disability• Disability buy-up gap plan• Life insurance• Cancer insurance• Critical illness insurance• Medsupport insurance• Accident insurance• Flexible spending accounts• Employee assistance program• 401(k) with company match• Employee stock purchase plan• Bereavement pay• Orientation period• CEU’s through online management systems• Paid time off• Holiday pay• Company vehicle program available for qualified employees The LHC Group difference With hundreds of locations across the nation, we partner with local physicians, nurses and therapists to provide high-quality and compassionate care to nearly 100,000 patients annually. Our commitment to innovation and service excellence influences every facet of patient care and is the cornerstone of our industry-leading clinical programs, like T3 and Beyond Balance. We are proud to be the preferred post-acute care partner for leading hospitals and health systems around the country – operating more than 100 joint venture locations nationwide. Strength, stability and clinical expertise – that’s the LHC Group difference. LHC Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and drug free workplace.

item.title: ENTRY LEVEL MARKETING-Hospitality/ Food & Beverage Experience Wanted-Full Time- Training Provided
item.description: Details: The Monarch Team is hiring for an Entry Level full time Management Training position. We are looking for a candidate we can teach our sales and marketing systems to, but also someone that would feel comfortable stepping into a leadership role within the company. We are looking for candidates that posses good Communication, Interpersonal, and Leadership skills. We find candidates that come from the hospitality, customer service, and food and beverage industries are extremely successful in our Management Training Program because of the strong communication and interpersonal skills fostered in these industries. At The Monarch Team we want to teach sales and marketing fundamentals and then move individuals into management as soon as possible! It’s how we expand our company. This position is full time and involves responsibilities in: Entry level sales & marketing Entry level management training Sales and marketing presentations Face to face sales and marketing of new services for our clients Sales and marketing techniques Training sales and marketing representative The Monarch Team cross-trains all employees within leadership development which includes: Interviewing Sales and marketing training fundamentals Team building and mentoring Entry level marketing and sales consulting Benefits & Our Culture The management, sales & marketing team at Monarch offers an environment where our employee’s ideas are not only heard but implemented. We offer a team based and structured environment, however employees are expected to be self-disciplined in managing their own time and work schedule. · Fun, team building environment · Travel Opportunities · Leadership workshops & development · Financial management, business management, time management · Philanthropy events – a chance to give back to the community · Recognition for top performers · Advancement to management based on performance Philanthropy is an important part of our culture Our Management and Sales & Marketing team and employees are involved in helping organizations Nationally as well as in the Las Vegas area.

item.title: Customer Service Call Center Positions!
item.description: Details: Get your foot in the door at one of the most recognized companies on the Fortune 100 list! Staffmark has openings for Customer Service Representatives to support major name brand retail stores across the US. Working from the Atlanta call canter, these positions will be responsible for supporting store managers with the hiring of their personnel. The Customer Service role/HR Staffing Analysts will conduct interviews over the phone and ensure outstanding service and successful placements at retail stores throughout the country. This is a contract temporary, long term opportunity. Conduct telephone interviews with candidates using behavioral based scripts. May receive between 70-100 calls daily. Document interview results in staffing system. Judge recommendation for further interviews with candidate. Work with the store to ensure all testing, background investigations and drug screens of new hires are completed, including the administration of the process if necessary. Ensures job placement and new hire process are completed to HR standard operating procedures. Skills, Ability and Experience Required: Strong written and verbal communication skills – ability to interface with job candidates as well as management team via phone and email. Attention to detail in processing HR hiring materials with accuracy. Comfortable with computers and navigating multiple screens.

item.title: Immediate Hire Customer Service and Sales / Training Provided
item.description: Details: Customer Service and Sales The Monarch Team, Inc. is a sales and marketing firm retained by major companies to execute local face to face marketing and sales programs on their behalf. We are looking for talented and hard-working Entry Level Account Executives to advance quickly at our privately owned company to oversee campaigns for our fortune 50 and 500 clients. The Monarch Team is in high demand because of our results driven marketing approach and second to none work ethic. Professional, energetic, and goal oriented individuals are the types of candidates that we want to complement our organization. We are looking to train individuals who will expand with our company this year. Account Executive Responsibilities: Meet with new and existing clients Consistently meet the needs of current perspective clients Serve as a liaison to the local businesses for the client Work closely with the client to facilitate good client relations The Monarch Team Offers : Leadership Training Courses (Covey, Blanchard, Maxwell) National and International Travel Opportunities Personal Coaching and Mentor ship Program Non-Profit Community Assistance Programs Professional Career Driven Environment

item.title: Admissions Representative - Sales
item.description: Details: Admissions Representative - Sales An Admissions Representative will provide basic information, routine guidance, and will assist prospective student in the admissions process, maintaining their decision to attend school. Admissions Representatives are given predetermined admission’s specific goals and objectives and are expected to comply in an accurate, professional, and ethical manner; using Vista College’s approved admissions processes and procedures. This is accomplished through a high-level of hourly telephonic interaction and daily face to face Admissions Interviews. Conducts interviews with prospective students. Evaluates the prospective student’s needs, interests and qualifications while providing clear and concise information to help the prospective student make an informed decision about attending school Achieves the expected goals and objectives defined for the Admissions Representative position, applicable federal and state regulations, school policies and procedures, and in compliance with all accrediting standards and requirements including, but not limited to: the setting of the appointment, interviewing the student, facilitating and processing the enrollment, setting the proper expectations, providing information about and facilitating attendance at new student orientation, and the start of class Presents information in factual and ethical manner regarding the school’s program and tuition Consistently operates within, and is measured with respect to, the school’s expected behaviors: Collaboration and Teamwork, Execution, Communication, Student-Centered, Integrity, Drive, Adaptability and Change Management, and Decision Making Partners with departments outside of Admissions including Financial Aid and the office of the Registrar to ensure the delivery of a high level of service to every student Actively generates referral business to help maintain Company goals

item.title: Restaurant Manager - Starting Salary $58K - Odessa and Midland - West Texas
item.description: Details: Job Description Are you Craving a Career? Ready for Growth? COME SEE WHY PANDA MIGHT BE THE RIGHT PLACE! At Panda, we all share a common mission: "Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives." We invest in our people because great people run great operations that will exceed our guests' expectations. Talk to any of our associates and you will experience a culture dedicated to its mission and our five fundamental values- Proactive, Respect/Win-Win, Growth, Great Operations, and Giving. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn fine dining restaurants, Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food concept served in a fast casual environment, and Hibachi San, our Japanese grill concept. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. Panda offers competitive benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have restaurant positions available nationwide and support center positions in Rosemead, CA. Come join the nation's largest and fastest growing Asian restaurant company. Our continued growth in this location has created new career opportunities for Management, Crew Members, and Kitchen Team Members!!! Come join us. Restaurant Management Team responsibilities: Lead all or some People aspects of a Panda Express restaurant including hiring, training, coaching, and development Ensure the safety of our Guests and Associates through training and execution of food safety and restaurant safety standards and guidelines Lead all or some Guest components of a Panda Express restaurant including excellent food quality, guest service, associate friendliness, and restaurant cleanliness through your team using proven systems and routines Lead all or some financial areas of a Panda Express restaurant including sales growth, cost management, and profit growth Applies thorough knowledge of all policies, procedures and practices utilized within unit managed Understands ways in which unit relates to and impacts PRG Demonstrates knowledge of PRG operations and objectives Seeks information regarding trends affecting food service industry We offer our Full-Time Management Team: Progressive Compensation Package and Excellent Bonus Opportunity 5 or more Weeks of Comprehensive Training to prepare you for success On-Going Career & Leadership Development Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 401 K with Company Match Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Associate Discounts (Panda Express, Hibachi San, Panda Inn plus Theme Parks) and free meals when you work Lucrative Associate Referral Bonus Pre-Tax Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account Qualifications Qualifications: College degree or equivalent experience preferred High school or GED required Additional expectations of our Management Team are: Excellent leaders with great people skills Proactive – Sees life as choices and chooses to make a positive impact. People Oriented – enjoys working with our guests and associates, possess good communication and interpersonal skills. Growth Oriented – knows that learning and growth are keys to personal and professional success and is willing and able to share learning with others. Results Oriented – focuses on getting results without compromising guest, people, and financial areas. ADA Statement: While performing duties, counter areas are often hot with steam from steam table and food vapors. Work space is restricted and employees are expected to remain standing for long periods of time. Employees must prepare hot and cold foods, use Chinese cook knife and other kitchen equipment and work quickly without losing accuracy. Employees may be required to lift up to 50 lbs., stand up to four hours and reach across counter tops measured at 36 inches to serve customers. Kitchens are hot and noise levels are usually high; storage space is limited and shelving is high. Panda Restaurant Group, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: General Education Instructors- Math, Eng, Psy
item.description: Details: General Education Instructor Our customer-driven employees are what set us apart. Each teacher, administrator, and staff member is essential to providing excellent service and producing graduates the business community would be pleased to employ. The optimal General Education Instructor candidate will be responsible for teaching students general studies in applied math, psychology, English and/or writing at our Killeen, TX Campus . Key responsibilities include: Utilizing the training syllabus, equipment, and learning materials to give the best learning experience to our students Testing students to gauge their development Support after-class student assistance as needed Meeting deadlines for grade submissions and required duties Be a mentor to the students Assure company and government compliance is maintained in your classes Support campus initiatives

item.title: PT Behavior Support Specialist (Richmond, VA)
item.description: Details: As one of the nation's fastest growing Christian foster care ministries, The Bair Foundation is currently seeking candidates for a part-time Behavior Support Specialist in Richmond, VA. Core Responsibilities: Responsible for providing support, guidance and education to foster children and foster parents in their home. Visits and calls to assure the quality and appropriateness of services provided to each client. Provides individual and or family counseling sessions to promote each client's mental health recovery. Coordinates services to assure effective communication with the treatment team. Bachelor's degree in human services or a related field with at least one year of clinical experience. Must met QMHP qualifications.

item.title: Sybase DBA
item.description: Details: ​​ Position: Sybase DBA Location: Nashville, TN Duration: 6+ Months HMG America LLC is a leader in IT,Software,Web Development and other professional services.One of our direct client is looking for at Nashville, TN . Background Our client needs a Level-3 Sybase Database Administrators with very sound experience Sybase 15.7 and involved in migration initiatives/ projects and in BAU in the capacity of a Level-3 resource. Requirement:1 Nos. The offered position is for Level-3 Sybase Database Administrators, with significant exposure to Sybase 15.7, to become part of the migration initiatives/ projects, with overall experience of at least 8 years with excellent communication skills and business interfacing experience. General Description Responsibilities :- - Being an a SME and Level-3 Sybase DBA for the migration initiatives/projects - Adhering to SLAs - Mentoring / Training /Grooming Team Members - Handling tickets / requests - Perform root cause analysis - Troubleshooting technical issues - Defining processes and ensuring that the processes are adhered to - Oversees and is responsible for successful completion of Installation, configuration and migration - Ensure maximum uptime according to the SLA - Understanding of Multi-geo support environment - Responsible for building / maintaining a test environment - Responsible for strategizing a backup plan and test plan for failure scenario - Improves and maintains customer and employee satisfaction - Suggests new technologies and design changes - Monitoring and maintaining SLA requirements by the team members - Planning Backup/Restoration Strategy for 24x7 operation support - Suggesting patches/upgrades to maintain security level - Testing / Auditing/processes as required from time to time - Identify Skill gaps and plan for training / knowledge updating Technical Requirements - Evaluate the Database Server Hardware. - Define/Recommend/Maintain Database Standards and Architecture. - Recommend Server H/W, Adaptive Server Editions & Replication Server for a new Build - Expert in Database Design. - Research and Recommend Patch management for database/Server Impact Analysis. - Initiate need and Impact Analysis for Database Migration/Upgrade - Technical Consultation. - Vendor Support and Interaction - Advance Database Performance tuning (Optdiag,Reorg , Replication tuning , Database Tuning etc.) - Recommend and Review Backup and Recovery Strategies. - Knowledge about new feature of Sybase 15.5/15.7 (online reorg, Data compression, Shrinking log, Etc.) - Well versed in MDB table, Sybsecurity Auditing Etc - Designing/Recommending Database Security Policy. - Configure multiple tempdb - Having experience of DR Solution/Implementation/Execution through various synch methods. - Designing strategy towards Capacity Management for DB tracks. - Designing Sybase Server Security (Server hardening,Auditing,SOXcompliance,Sybsecurtiy) - High Availability Features (Failover Clustering, Database Mirroring, Replication warmstandby and table level) - Expertise in UNIX (job , unix scripting and cronjobs) Soft Skills - Excellent communication and conversation skills (Verbal and Written) - Good documentation skills - Good working knowledge of MS OFFICE (Including MS Project and Visio) - Should have a great customer handling skills - Able to handle unforeseen situations - High level of acceptance - Can drive HCL’s value and its methodology Other Skills / Experience - Worked on Production systems - Experience with Database Migration, Installation, Upgrades and Patching - Datacenter understanding - Knowledge of Data warehousing and Other RDBMS - Knowledge of Gateways/Direct connect for Other DBs - Storage Management Techniques - Experience on Sybase SQL BACKTRACK - Experience on Third Party backup tools such as SQL BACKTRACK etc Certification requirements - SCP/ SRSAP Apply @ Or call me at 732-645-1610
