item.title: Paralegal III-PAR3
item.description: Details: United States Attorneys (also known as federal prosecutors and, historically, as United States District Attorneys) represent the federal government in United States district court and United States court of appeals. There are 93 U.S. Attorneys stationed throughout the United States, Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands, Guam, and the Northern Mariana Islands. U.S. Attorneys and their offices are part of the Department of Justice. U.S. Attorneys receive oversight, supervision and administrative support services through the Justice Department's Executive Office for United States Attorneys. A Paralegal III performs, but is not limited to the following duties: Assist attorneys, provide Legal Clerk and Paralegal/Legal Assistant II review Analyzes and evaluates case files against legal standards Notes and corrects case file deficiencies (e.g. missing documents, inconsistent material, leads not investigated) before sending the case on to the concerned trial attorney Reviews and analyzes available precedents relevant to cases under consideration for use in presenting case summaries to trial attorneys Gathers, sorts, classifies, and interprets data to discover patterns of possible discrimination activity Interviews relevant personnel and potential witnesses to gather information Reviews and analyzes relevant statistics Performs statistical evaluations such as standard deviations, analyses of variance, means, modes, and ranges as supporting data for case litigation Consults with statistical experts on reliability evaluations May testify in court concerning relevant data This position will remain open until a suitable interview pool has been established. The hiring department is not required to accept resumes after an interview pool has been established. However, additional back-up resumes may be accepted at the discretion of the hiring department. Forfeiture Support Associates (FSA), LLC is proud to be an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, genetics, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

item.title: Human Resources Manager
item.description: Details: Great Lakes Credit Union (GLCU) is a growing financial institution chartered in 1938, with 220 employees serving nearly 60,000 members at 12 locations in Lake, Cook, DuPage and Kendall Counties in Illinois. We are searching for a HR professional with a strong generalist background to manage the functions and staff of the HR Department, and to join with our management team in contributing to the on-going success of the credit union. 1. Manage staffing and recruitment, employee benefits, and payroll functions. 2. Supervise, train, and coach performance of Senior HR Generalist and Payroll Specialist. 3. Conduct recruitment activities, including sourcing applicants, screening and interviewing candidates, and making offers. 4. Assess department procedures, practices and reporting and make changes necessary to improve efficiency and provide a high level of service to GLCU staff and the management team. 5. Ensure that all department functions are carried out in compliance with federal and state laws.

item.title: ENTRY LEVEL MARKETING & SALES- Hospitality/ Food & Beverage Experience Wanted- Training Provided
item.description: Details: The Monarch Team is hiring for an Entry Level full time Management Training position. We are looking for a candidate we can teach our sales and marketing systems to, but also someone that would feel comfortable stepping into a leadership role within the company. We are looking for candidates that posses good Communication, Interpersonal, and Leadership skills. We find candidates that come from the hospitality, customer service, and food and beverage industries are extremely successful in our Management Training Program because of the strong communication and interpersonal skills fostered in these industries. At The Monarch Team we want to teach sales and marketing fundamentals and then move individuals into management as soon as possible! It’s how we expand our company. This position is full time and involves responsibilities in: Entry level sales & marketing Entry level management training Sales and marketing presentations Face to face sales and marketing of new services for our clients Sales and marketing techniques Training sales and marketing representative The Monarch Team cross-trains all employees within leadership development which includes: Interviewing Sales and marketing training fundamentals Team building and mentoring Entry level marketing and sales consulting Benefits & Our Culture The management, sales & marketing team at Monarch offers an environment where our employee’s ideas are not only heard but implemented. We offer a team based and structured environment, however employees are expected to be self-disciplined in managing their own time and work schedule. · Fun, team building environment · Travel Opportunities · Leadership workshops & development · Financial management, business management, time management · Philanthropy events – a chance to give back to the community · Recognition for top performers · Advancement to management based on performance Philanthropy is an important part of our culture Our Management and Sales & Marketing team and employees are involved in helping organizations Nationally as well as in the Las Vegas area.

item.title: Propane / Gas Plumbing Service Technician - Peace Dale, RI
item.description: Details: Propane / Natural Gas / HVAC - Appliance / Gas Plumbing / Service Technician Installer Job Responsibilities As a Service Technician, you will be responsible for the safe installation of items such as propane storage tanks, gas piping and gas appliances. You will drive a flatbed truck to deliver, install and remove large propane tanks. During daily interaction with customers, you will provide exceptional customer service by supplying service information and answering inquires. Other responsibilities of the Installer role include: Operating crane truck dolly to maneuver tanks Installing, maintaining and servicing commercial and residential propane systems. Installing, repairing and maintaining propane appliances for retail customers Providing emergency response and system installation and testing Inspecting vehicle and notifying supervisor of needed equipment, supplies or routine maintenance Preparing and maintaining records in accordance with regulations and company procedures Operating truck in accordance to established safety procedures

item.title: Director of Social Services (Raleigh, NC)
item.description: Details: As one of the nation's fastest growing Christian foster care ministries, The Bair Foundation is currently seeking a Director of Social Services in Raleigh, NC. Core Responsibilities: 1. Supervise and support social service workers and staff to assure that each child receives services in accordance with all laws, regulations and internal policies. 2. Facilitate the provision of safe, secure and nurturing living experiences in accordance with The Bair Foundation mission. 3. Assures the implementation of all applicable state regulations and organizational policies and procedures within the office. 4. Supervises treatment, planning and progress of clients. 5. Assures resolution of critical incidents for foster care/family preservation services. 6. Makes visits to foster homes annually and those homes that have more than three foster children a minimum of twice per year. 7. Develops budget for services to assure office is operating without financial loss. 8. Maintains communication with referral agencies regarding current children by monthly visitations for agencies with more than five children in care. 9.Must become proficient with The Bair Foundation's treatment model and its application. 10. Supervises the Intake Staff ensuring placement goals are met. Master's degree in a Social Services or related field and five years of experience working with children placed outside the home. Two years of prior supervisory experience preferred. Must have a LPC,LCSW,PLCSW,LMFT or be license eligible.

item.title: Hiring Sports Minded Individual/ Entry Level/ Sales & Marketing
item.description: Details: Competitive? Great Work Ethic? Leadership Qualities? The Monarch Team is expanding to at least three more national offices by the end of 2015 - each ran by a manager who started in the entry level position and progressed through our management development program. We find that candidates with sports backgrounds have valuable skill sets due to their work ethic, competitive drive, and ability to win in all types of situations. We are a privately owned, top-ranked MARKETING FIRM looking for outgoing individuals to fill entry level sales & marketing positions! We owe much of our success at The Monarch Team to our progressive approach to people. We strive to create unlimited opportunities for individuals to achieve their personal, professional and financial goals. We do this by encouraging competition , making it easy for individuals engaged in sales and marketing to share effective techniques and communicate ideas openly, and by recognizing accomplishments both large and small. The position we are hiring for is entry level , which allows for rapid advancement into a branch management role, and involves interaction with our customers and clients on a day to day basis. Those selected will gain experience in: Business Management Sales and Marketing Techniques Team Leadership Public relations Advertising Public speaking

item.title: Restaurant Manager - Chico-Redding - Northern California
item.description: Details: Are you Craving a Career? Ready for Growth? COME SEE WHY PANDA MIGHT BE THE RIGHT PLACE! 22,000 Panda Associates living one common mission: “Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives.” Known as the ʺPanda Way,ʺ our company culture places special emphasis on encouraging our Associates to focus on a healthy lifestyle, continuous learning, developing others and acknowledging others. We believe that this, coupled with our five fundamental values – proactive, respect/win-win, growth, great operations and giving – provides our Associates with an environment where they can both inspire and be inspired. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn concept, our full service restaurants; Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food served in a fast casual environment; and Hibachi-San, our Japanese grill mall-based restaurants. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. With annual sales of more than $1.5 billion, we continue to add more than 100 new units annually. Panda offers excellent benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have opportunities available in our restaurants nationwide as well as within our corporate office located in the Los Angeles area. Join our growing team with more than 1,500 locations across North America. Restaurant Management Team responsibilities: Lead all or some People aspects of a Panda Express restaurant including hiring, training, coaching, and development Ensure the safety of our Guests and Associates through training and execution of food safety and restaurant safety standards and guidelines Lead all or some Guest components of a Panda Express restaurant including excellent food quality, guest service, associate friendliness, and restaurant cleanliness through your team using proven systems and routines Lead all or some financial areas of a Panda Express restaurant including sales growth, cost management, and profit growth Applies thorough knowledge of all policies, procedures and practices utilized within unit managed Understands ways in which unit relates to and impacts PRG Demonstrates knowledge of PRG operations and objectives Seeks information regarding trends affecting food service industry We offer our Full-Time Management Team: Progressive Compensation Package and Excellent Bonus Opportunity 5 or more Weeks of Comprehensive Training to prepare you for success On-Going Career & Leadership Development Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 401 K with Company Match Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Associate Discounts (Panda Express, Hibachi San, Panda Inn plus Theme Parks) and free meals when you work Lucrative Associate Referral Bonus Pre-Tax Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account Qualifications College degree or equivalent experience preferred High school or GED required Additional expectations of our Management Team are: Excellent leaders with great people skills Proactive – Sees life as choices and chooses to make a positive impact. People Oriented – enjoys working with our guests and associates, possess good communication and interpersonal skills. Growth Oriented – knows that learning and growth are keys to personal and professional success and is willing and able to share learning with others. Results Oriented – focuses on getting results without compromising guest, people, and financial areas. ADA Statement: While performing duties, counter areas are often hot with steam from steam table and food vapors. Work space is restricted and employees are expected to remain standing for long periods of time. Employees must prepare hot and cold foods, use Chinese cook knife and other kitchen equipment and work quickly without losing accuracy. Employees may be required to lift up to 50 lbs., stand up to four hours and reach across counter tops measured at 36 inches to serve customers. Kitchens are hot and noise levels are usually high; storage space is limited and shelving is high. Panda Restaurant Group, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Sprint Store by iMobile- Store Manager
item.description: Details: iMobile is currently looking for a proven and motivated Store Manager to maximize sales and profits for their store in Rockaway, NJ! We are looking for a results driven and career minded Retail Store Manager to lead and direct all activities required to achieve all store goals. If you have superior leadership skills, operational excellence and can increase sales and profitability while managing a dynamic sales team, this could be the position for you! About us: iMobile is a Sprint Preferred Retailer committed to providing superior customer service. iMobile has store locations across NY, NJ, CT, MA, ME, NH, RI, MD, IA, OH, IL, IN, PA, CA and CO. Employing and empowering over 800 employees' iMobile is currently expanding and looking for a proven and motivated Sales Rep to maximize sales and profits. As the retail wireless industry changes, iMobile has managed to stay ahead of the curve. Originally founded in 1983 and now known as iMobile, the leader in wireless telecommunications. iMobile prides itself on customer service, and satisfaction, striving to constantly provide the best experience to our customers in our retail locations. With hundreds of awards to our name, iMobile continues to grow beyond expectations and beat industry standards. iMobile's future looks bright, with over 100 stores and growing our continued expansion is a result of a strong foundation and empowered employees. DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES: -Responsible for day to day operations -Direct supervision of retail store employees including, job descriptions, interviewing, training, scheduling, performance reviews -Hold team accountable for production and quality -Coordinate sales promos and merchandising -Fully knowledgeable on all retail systems and procedures -Conduct ongoing recruiting and hiring of retail store team members -Utilize customer feedback to reinforce and improve the quality of service and customer satisfaction -Manage staffing levels and create schedules that support customer service and daily operations within budget -Recognize and respond to performance issues, with honest and direct communication, enforcing disciplinary guidelines -Deliver consistently balanced results, drives for financial performance both "top & bottom line" -Ensure the accuracy, completion and reconciliation of all financial transactions and operation of point-of-sale terminals -Maintain cash control and reviews all sales discrepancies -Monitor inventory in/out on a daily basis -Compute weekly sales reports for management -Flexible times of availability needed: able to work 40 hours or more per week, must work a majority of Saturdays and busier customer traffic times, weekends, holiday, etc when needed

item.description: Details: ENTRY LEVEL: Event Management, Event/Promotions Planning As featured in the Wall Street Journal EXPLOSIVE ADVERTISING INC is now hiring -MANAGEMENT TRAINING- Marketing/Advertising/Sales/Customer Service The Wall Street Journal http://online.wsj.com/article/PR-CO-20130506-903988.html#articleTabs=article Explosive Advertising INC is proud to announce that we will be opening TWO NEW OFFICES due to our continued success, giving us a Grand Total of 24 offices opened in the past Five years! Due to recent expansion and growth we are hiring for 10 immediate positions. These positions are entry level with the opportunity for rapid growth and advancement. We provide entry level one on one training for qualified candidates. We believe in providing our employees with the skills necessary to succeed professionally and personally. ENTRY LEVEL: Event Management, Event/Promotions Planning We are looking for future leaders to grow into a management role with our company while focusing on the following: Development of Marketing Campaigns and Strategies Customer Service and Client Acquisition Implementation of Product LaunchesRigorous Leadership training In-store Promotional Advertising We will provide Full Paid Training in: Customer Relations Brand Name Recognition New Client Acquisition Management Training through Direct Marketing. Business Development Leadership Advertising, marketing, sales and public relations

item.title: Foster Parent Recruiter (Richmond, VA)
item.description: Details: As one of the nation's fastest growing foster care ministries, The Bair Foundation is currently seeking a Foster Parent Recruiter in Richmond, VA. Core Responsibilities: 1. Directs the recruitment of foster families according to state regulations and agency policies and procedures. 2. Facilitates the safe, secure and nurturing living experience in accordance with the agency mission. 3. Makes determinations regarding the approval or rejection of foster home applicants. 4. Schedules and conducts preliminary home study of prospective foster parents. 5. Approves the scheduling and conducts lesson modules for Group Study Process for prospective foster parents. 6. Assures that foster home records are in compliance with state regulations. 7. Train and certify incoming foster parents in order to meet office growth goals. Required to certify a minimum of 10 foster families per year. Bachelor's Degree in social work or a related field, along with 2 years experience working with at risk youth. Prior marketing experience a plus!

item.title: Senior System Engineer
item.description: Details: Job is located in Greenwood Village, CO. Summary of Responsibilities: This individual will hold the primary responsibilities for project planning, implementation, documentation, and maintenance of the client organization’s infrastructure systems. Essential Functions: Tasks and Duties Create plans for future and current projects based on the intake of initiatives and organizational goals of the client partners Ongoing evaluation of infrastructure utilization and life-cycling of legacy hardware Facilitate growth of datacenter infrastructure and planning of maintenance windows Planning and documenting disaster recovery and business continuity activities as they pertain to current company goals and initiatives Upholding of documentation standards and requirements Implementation and planning of a variety of server, network, and storage platforms Design, upgrade, and maintain virtualized infrastructure, storage systems, and networking systems Design of monitoring systems to maintain uptime and availability of key systems Provide resolution and preventative action for serious outages Design systems for data backups and disaster recovery operations Support Functions: Provide prompt resolution to escalated issues and outages Creation and maintenance of monitoring standards both proactive and reactive Leverage on call rotation schedule to ensure 24X7 availability of IT resources and escalation Provide training to System Administrator staff to ensure redundancy exists and knowledge of systems are transparent

item.title: Product Manager, Aftermarket Product Line
item.description: Details: Filtran LLC, located in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a globalleader in filtration solutions and a trusted name around the world for qualityautomatic transmission filters. We are atop automotive supplier to both the Original Equipment and the Aftermarket; globallyproviding a full product line. Thisposition is responsible for selling and promoting to existing and prospectivecustomers in the rebuilder (bulk) market as well as the retail/service (kit)market. This position also lendstechnical expertise regarding current and/or future transmission filterapplications. The Product Manager manages the Company’s aftermarketproduct line, which includes: evaluating the viability of current and futureproduct offerings, analysis of each offering’s profitability,expanding/contracting the number and type of available products, anddetermining the appropriate marketing efforts. The Product Manager coordinates multiple aspects ofdevelopment, implementation, management and evaluation of the Company’s productline offering and communicates the availability of new applications along withupdates and revisions to existing applications to the customer base. The ideal candidate for this position must beable to develop a keen understanding of the automotive aftermarket, itschannels of distribution, and sensitivity to ever changing competitivesituations. Selection of customers mustbe done in a manner that provides incremental sales growth without jeopardizingor disrupting the established customer base and market channels. PrimaryAccountabilities and Supporting Activities Primary contact to Filtran’sAftermarket customers. Needs to build and maintain strategic customerrelationships to create value for our customers, maximize sales penetration,and obtain optimum market share. Developand conduct product and capability presentations as needed. Work with the VP of Sales &Marketing to develop and implementglobal Aftermarket sales strategy, which includes price development andmarketing plans. Act as the “tech line" for allcurrent customers, offering technical assistance and responding to allcustomers’ technical needs (mostly application driven). Identify and evaluate marketopportunities and follow automotive sales and trends in order to gain insight intothe transmission population and average age to identify how Filtran canincrease market share. Understand and continually analyze Filtran’s productoffering versus the competitions product offering. Monitors the consumer market, productdevelopment, and product mix and warranty flexibility in order to staycompetitive. Communicate and educate theFiltran organization on competitive product availability and producttrends. In order to assure that Filtranis developing the right products in a timely manner. Develop and add new applicationsthat will enhance the existing product line in order to attract prospectivecustomers and targeted market segments, as well as expand the product line ofthe existing customer base. Act as the program manager for newaftermarket customer launches and/or changes to legacy offerings. Manage the program from conception throughlaunch by forming the launch team, communicating requirements and due dates,ensuring completion and accuracy of action items, updating BOM’s, and thesuccessful execution of the project plan. Identify existing and changingautomotive repair and service trends and develop strategy to address andcommunicate with recommendations to senior management. Support customers who have afilter that has been returned as an alleged field failure. Track the evaluation and ensure resolution. Maintain and update the onlineFiltran filter and kit catalog. Significant travel is required toactively address market opportunities, interface with customers, technicians,rebuilders, and end users through trade shows, expos and customer visits. The above descriptioncovers the principle functions of the job. It is not intended to be a completelisting of all the miscellaneous incidental or substantially similar duties,which may be assigned during normal or emergency operations.

item.title: Panda Express - Restaurant Manager - Monterey-Central Coast - Bay Area
item.description: Details: 22,000 Panda Associates living one common mission: “Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives.” Known as the ʺPanda Way,ʺ our company culture places special emphasis on encouraging our Associates to focus on a healthy lifestyle, continuous learning, developing others and acknowledging others. We believe that this, coupled with our five fundamental values – proactive, respect/win-win, growth, great operations and giving – provides our Associates with an environment where they can both inspire and be inspired. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn concept, our full service restaurants; Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food served in a fast casual environment; and Hibachi-San, our Japanese grill mall-based restaurants. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. With annual sales of more than $1.5 billion, we continue to add more than 100 new units annually. Panda offers excellent benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have opportunities available in our restaurants nationwide as well as within our corporate office located in the Los Angeles area. Join our growing team with more than 1,500 locations across North America. Job Description Are you Craving a Career? Ready for Growth? COME SEE WHY PANDA MIGHT BE THE RIGHT PLACE! At Panda, we all share a common mission: "Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives." We invest in our people because great people run great operations that will exceed our guests' expectations. Talk to any of our associates and you will experience a culture dedicated to its mission and our five fundamental values- Proactive, Respect/Win-Win, Growth, Great Operations, and Giving. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn fine dining restaurants, Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food concept served in a fast casual environment, and Hibachi San, our Japanese grill concept. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. Panda offers competitive benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have restaurant positions available nationwide and support center positions in Rosemead, CA. Come join the nation's largest and fastest growing Asian restaurant company. Our continued growth in this location has created new career opportunities for Management, Crew Members, and Kitchen Team Members!!! Come join us. Restaurant Management Team responsibilities: Lead all or some People aspects of a Panda Express restaurant including hiring, training, coaching, and development Ensure the safety of our Guests and Associates through training and execution of food safety and restaurant safety standards and guidelines Lead all or some Guest components of a Panda Express restaurant including excellent food quality, guest service, associate friendliness, and restaurant cleanliness through your team using proven systems and routines Lead all or some financial areas of a Panda Express restaurant including sales growth, cost management, and profit growth Applies thorough knowledge of all policies, procedures and practices utilized within unit managed Understands ways in which unit relates to and impacts PRG Demonstrates knowledge of PRG operations and objectives Seeks information regarding trends affecting food service industry We offer our Full-Time Management Team: Progressive Compensation Package and Excellent Bonus Opportunity 5 or more Weeks of Comprehensive Training to prepare you for success On-Going Career & Leadership Development Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 401 K with Company Match Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Associate Discounts (Panda Express, Hibachi San, Panda Inn plus Theme Parks) and free meals when you work Lucrative Associate Referral Bonus Pre-Tax Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account Qualifications Qualifications: College degree or equivalent experience preferred High school or GED required Additional expectations of our Management Team are: Excellent leaders with great people skills Proactive – Sees life as choices and chooses to make a positive impact. People Oriented – enjoys working with our guests and associates, possess good communication and interpersonal skills. Growth Oriented – knows that learning and growth are keys to personal and professional success and is willing and able to share learning with others. Results Oriented – focuses on getting results without compromising guest, people, and financial areas. ADA Statement: While performing duties, counter areas are often hot with steam from steam table and food vapors. Work space is restricted and employees are expected to remain standing for long periods of time. Employees must prepare hot and cold foods, use Chinese cook knife and other kitchen equipment and work quickly without losing accuracy. Employees may be required to lift up to 50 lbs., stand up to four hours and reach across counter tops measured at 36 inches to serve customers. Kitchens are hot and noise levels are usually high; storage space is limited and shelving is high. Panda Restaurant Group, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Panda Restaurant Group, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Quality Assurance
item.description: Details: Job Title: Quality Assurance Specialist-Medical Device Manufacturing Company Department: Quality Reports to: Quality Assurance Manager Compensation: $14-$16 hr Basic Function: Assists the Quality Assurance and personnel on the implementation of the Quality Assurance Assists to Produce Quality Products, on time and within budget Essential Functions and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Able to conduct lab testing such as ph levels and contamination levels Assists in the implementation and reviewing all customer complaints Assists in the implementation and reviewing all corrective action Assists in the implementation of Return Goods Authorization Assists in the investigation and final report of Failure Analysis Review and maintain training records Assists and maintain quality charts Review and maintain vendor files and certificates Assists management representative during external agency audits such as FDA or ISO Assists Microbiologists in the preparation and schedule of samples and lab communication Release documentation change requests and maintain device master records Qualifications To perform this job successfully an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability requires Thorough understanding of the FDA's QSR, ISO 13485 and applicable ISO standards Must be able to pass E-verify (have all work documents in order) Physical Demands Must be physically able to sit or stand for extended periods of time. Must have the ability to walk up and down stairs and walk extended distances as needed

item.title: Finance Manager / F&I / Honda
item.description: Details: Honda Of Annapolis is in search of Finance and Insurance Manager. This is a great opportunity for a seasoned finance veteran or a sales manager looking to step away from the desk. This could be a once in a lifetime opportunity to elevate your career. You would be required to handle 50-80 deals per month. F&I Manager duties include but are not limited to: Familiar with menu selling Maintain an efficient work flow of all finance office processes Maintaining Highest CSI scores Maximize all insurance product profits and penetration Assist the sales team with closing deals Team player Professional, punctual and dependable Possess an overwhelming desire to succeed If it sounds like you, here are just a few things that we offer- Great Commission Structure With Draw Busy store with plenty of traffic Excellent Medical, Dental, Life & Disability Benefits 401(k) With Company Match Paid Vacations Five Day Work Week Your Earning Potential Is Unlimited Ongoing Product Knowledge & Training High Customer Satisfaction For Both Sales & Service A Professional & Respectful Work Environment

item.title: Electrical Engineer
item.description: Details: Position: Electrical Engineer COMPANY: TETER Architects & Engineers is an award-winning architectural and engineering firm with a staff of approximately 85 professionals located in four Central California offices. We have a wide range of work in progress that includes K-12 Education, Higher ED, Commercial, Medical/ Hospital, Student Housing, Industrial and Federal projects (VA, NavFac, Army Corps). TETER provides a collaborative work environment and the opportunity to work on challenging, but rewarding projects. Staff is encouraged to be engaged at all levels of project development and is exposed to client management and contract/fee management responsibilities. We encourage and facilitate staff growth and challenge our professionals to excel in all aspects of their profession. REQUIREMENTS: Applicant shall have seven to ten years of experience in electrical design of building systems for industrial, commercial, institutional and public projects as well as a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Architectural Engineering. California Professional Electrical Engineers licensed required. Prefer additional experience in Project Management, Low Voltage Signal Systems Design, Data Distribution Systems Design and Power Distribution Analysis. Requires experience in consulting environment, ability to successfully assume full project responsibilities, including client service and have a demonstrated aptitude in using computer aided-drafting software, AutoCad or Revit for drawing production. POSITION DESCRIPTION: We are seeking a motivated, energetic job captain to join our growing team in our Fresno office. The ideal candidate will be a team player, flexible, and eager to grow in his or her career. Successful candidates will be those who can strike the balance between self-motivation and accepting direction and feedback from project managers and partners. At TETER , you will work as a lead project electrical engineer, and will be responsible for developing electrical drawings and specifications. Candidate will also be responsible for scoping projects, construction administration, and developing/mentoring Electrical Engineers-in-Training. COMPENSATION: Commensurate with experience, competitive. Health and dental plan take effect the 1st of the month following the date of employment. Retirement plan (401k) eligibility per company policy. Annual bonuses, when conditions allow, are provided based upon performance during the prior year. LOCATION: Fresno is ideally located about an hour away from Sequoia and Yosemite National Parks and about three hours away from Northern, Central, and Southern California beaches. The Central Valley offers affordable living, diverse cultures, and amiable climate with sunshine 83% of the year. Interested candidates should submit a cover letter, current resume, and samples of relevant professional work in a single pdf (no larger than 7mb) to . For a full position description, please click here.

item.title: SALES / MARKETING / ADVERTISING-Assistant Managers Needed ASAP
item.description: Details: Junior Executives - Sales, Marketing & Advertising New Age Marketing, Inc. is looking for career-minded recent graduates to fill our Junior Executive position who are in search of a professional team based environment with rapid advancement. NAM is an aggressive sales, marketing and business development firm based in the Charleston, WV area. We have recently made plans to expand our sales and marketing team on a local level due to campaign expansion. We will be opening 2 new offices within the next year. That means new career opportunities for qualified candidates. We are looking to hire 10 additional Junior Executive for the West Virginia market immediately. Candidates must possess integrity, character and exemplary ambition for success. The sales, marketing and Junior Executive position is considered an entry-level marketing and sales position meaning thorough training is provided. It has been a wonderful start for many of our executives right out of college! We have a strict promote only from within policy, which provides Junior Executives, and our sales and marketing reps with ample room for advancement and experience in marketing, advertising, and sales. Benefits include: Rapid advancement opportunity Paid Training and Travel Work in an exciting and friendly environment Travel opportunities (optional) Relocation options (optional

item.title: Boscov's Restaurant Servers
item.description: Details: Use your Restaurant Wait Staff background to launch an exciting career in retail with one of the nation’s leading retailers! Boscov's is a chain of full service department stores serving the total family needs of our customers. For nearly 100 years, Boscov's has been known for its great values and famous brands, and for offering a broad selection of quality merchandise in its stores and online. We are looking for Servers to join our growing restaurant team. As part of a fast-paced, dynamic team, you will develop relationships with our customers and ensure that each customer’s needs are met in a quick and efficient manner. Whether you have previous restaurant experience OR customer service experience, this is a great opportunity to pursue a rewarding career with a company known for quality and big savings. Apply today! Job Responsibilities As a Restaurant Server, you will build customer confidence, provide accurate information, and ensure our customers have an enjoyable dining experience. You will be responsible for establishing professional, yet personalized rapport with each customer in order to provide the best customer experience.

item.title: Propane / Gas Plumbing Service Technician - Norwalk CT
item.description: Details: Propane / Natural Gas / HVAC - Appliance / Gas Plumbing / Service Technician Installer Job Responsibilities As a Service Technician, you will be responsible for the safe installation of items such as propane storage tanks, gas piping and gas appliances. You will drive a flatbed truck to deliver, install and remove large propane tanks. During daily interaction with customers, you will provide exceptional customer service by supplying service information and answering inquires. Other responsibilities of the Installer role include: Operating crane truck dolly to maneuver tanks Installing, maintaining and servicing commercial and residential propane systems. Installing, repairing and maintaining propane appliances for retail customers Providing emergency response and system installation and testing Inspecting vehicle and notifying supervisor of needed equipment, supplies or routine maintenance Preparing and maintaining records in accordance with regulations and company procedures Operating truck in accordance to established safety procedures

item.title: Program Assistant (Columbia, SC)
item.description: Details: As one of the nation's fastest growing Christian foster care ministries, The Bair Foundation is currently seeking a Program Assistant to support the Intake Coordinator and office staff in our Columbia, SC office. Core Responsibilities: 1.Assist the office employees with state requirements of clients served. This could include but is not limited to document searches, preparation and distribution of formal documentation, and fielding service calls for children and families. 2.Assists the Intake Coordinator with taking referral calls and inputting referral documentation into BairTrax. 3.Make foster child / resource parent matches based on therapeutic need of children and skill sets of resource parents. 4.Assists the Intake Coordinator with potential resource family communication, scheduling trainings, follow up on documentation throughout the certification process. 5.Complete home study interviews and preparing the home study certification. Complete re-certification assessments in homes where no foster children are currently placed. 6.Assist with resource parent orientations and trainings as needed. 7.Screens incoming calls to direct them appropriately and/or give information to the callers. 8.Works within the BairTrax database to update information received from referral agencies and resource parents. 9.Orders office supplies and keeps office equipment in good working order. 10.Prepares formal documentation for children in care and distributes them to the team members. 11.Relieves Intake Coordinator of administrative details associated with various projects and activities. 12.Meet with new employees for basic orientation trainings and gather the pre/post hire documentation for HR submission.A Bachelor's Degree in social work or a related field is required along with a minimum of two years of experience working with at risk youth. Prior experience working with Microsoft Office and experience using databases required.

item.title: Desktop Support Technician - Los Angeles, CA
item.description: Details: We are looking to immediately hire Desktop Support Technicians. We need technicians who can Install, Troubleshoot, and Repair Desktops and Peripherals. This job will require reliable transportation and travel in the area. Most issues will be hardware related. Any certifications are a plus, but not required. Printer experience is a plus.

item.title: Senior Business Analyst
item.description: Details: Qualifications: 1) 5+ years' experience as Sr Business Analyst 2) Experience working with User Stories (proven experience developing from scratch and editing existing ones) 3) Experience working within an Agile SDLC environment (true working experience, not just a knowledge of Agile principles) Candidates must have excellent communication, team building and relationship skills. Being a team-player on this team/role is key critical to this manager. * 5+ years of business analysis for rapid development projects is required, experience in Big 5 consulting firms or top tier systems integration firms preferred. * Experience on full life-cycle mobile application or salesforce.com projects desired * Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and SMEs * Ability to articulate design concepts and solutions verbally and in written documentation * Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio. Proficiency in Enterprise Architect, Blueprint Requirements Center, and MS Access, SQL are a plus * Experience working with a structured methodology such as RUP or "agile" software development process * Ability to work independently with minimal direction, experience managing small teams preferred * Strong categorization/information organization skills * Must be able to work well in fast-paced, dynamic environments * Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Responsibilities: * Elicit and document requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis. * Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from underlying needs. * Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: use cases, user stories, mockups, business rules, workflows. * Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously * Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans * Serve as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external customers) and the software development team * Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs. * Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams. About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Sourcing Specialist
item.description: Details: Reputable Software company is looking for a techincal recruiter/sourcing specialist for their Global Services Division. The types of skill sets they recruit for are people who come in after the sale of the software (project discoveries, custom work flows, hybrid backgrounds, understanding technology and software). They will be project Managers, Implementation Engineers, Business Consultants. Typical Day: 1. Very busy 2. Self-driven 3. Put in sourcing time 4. Review applications 5. Speaking with hiring managers to have kick off meetings/checking in with hiring managers 6. Phone interviews Company uses OnBase as their ATS, but you do not need to have experience with this. Flexible hours; cubicles, they work at least 5 hours of OT per week. Can be remote. If you are remote, the company will provide a laptop and phone. On site-Business casual They have an average req load of 20. Right now this division is 65 people behind for the year. If you are interested please apply to this posting and follow up with Tiffany at 216.573.5519. About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. Established in 1983, Aerotek is an operating company of Allegis Group, the largest provider of staffing services in the U.S. Aerotek operates a network of more than 200 non-franchised offices throughout the U.S., Canada and Europe. For more information, visit aerotek.com .

item.title: PT Therapist (Wilmington, NC)
item.description: Details: As one of the fastest growing Christian foster care ministries, The Bair Foundation is seeking a part-time/occasional intensive alternative family treatment Therapist in our Wilmington, NC office. The IAFT Therapist provides direct therapeutic interventions as part of a multi-disciplinary team intended to stabilize the living arrangement and promote reunification for identified youth through the age of 20. These services are provided in multiple locations, including therapeutic foster homes, home and community of the person serviced. This position provides therapeutic services in accordance with The Bair Foundation's mission and values the provision of a safe, secure and nurturing living experience for children and families. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: 1. Provides weekly individual and family therapy, including the family of origin and foster family, in a community-based or home-based setting. 2. Provides crisis intervention services. 3. Attends weekly treatment team meetings for individuals served. 4. Attends weekly staff meetings and individual supervision. 5. Submits weekly treatment reports to IAFT supervisor. 6. Provides referral matching and completes prior to admission authorization paperwork, including PCP, ITR, EPSDT and coordinates CCA completion. 7. Provides and/or assists in oversight, monitoring and development of the person-centered plan. 8. Participates in development and implementation of person-centered plan. 9. Provides supportive counseling and psycho educational support to the child and family to improve stability and coping mechanisms in accordance with evidence-based interventions. 10. Works with caregivers in the implementation of home-based behavioral supports. Masters degree in appropriate human services field and 2 years of post-graduate, supervised, habilitative or rehabilitative experience with children required. Must hold an active, unrestricted license or provisional license as an LCSW, LPC, LMFT, LCAS, P-LCSW or LPC-A.

item.title: Propane Service Technician - Springfield OR
item.description: Details: Propane / Natural Gas / HVAC - Appliance / Gas Plumbing / Service Technician Installer Job Responsibilities As a Service Technician, you will be responsible for the safe installation of items such as propane storage tanks, gas piping and gas appliances. You will drive a flatbed truck to deliver, install and remove large propane tanks. During daily interaction with customers, you will provide exceptional customer service by supplying service information and answering inquires. Other responsibilities of the Installer role include: Operating crane truck dolly to maneuver tanks Installing, maintaining and servicing commercial and residential propane systems. Installing, repairing and maintaining propane appliances for retail customers Providing emergency response and system installation and testing Inspecting vehicle and notifying supervisor of needed equipment, supplies or routine maintenance Preparing and maintaining records in accordance with regulations and company procedures Operating truck in accordance to established safety procedures

item.title: Recruiter leading into Sales - Ft. Lauderdale
item.description: Details: ABOUT AEROTEK! Since 1983 Aerotek has been providing the highest quality technical professionals to a wide range of industries and clients, including 95% of the Fortune 500. Aerotek is a part of Allegis Group, the largest recruiting agency in the United States, and fourth largest recruiting agency in the world. We serve a wide range of technical and industrial staffing markets in the U.S. and Canada. Aerotek has a long history of customized recruiting and placement solutions that continually place the best candidates at all levels of skill and expertise.Today there are more than 220 Allegis Group offices in the U.S. alone. Our team includes more than 5,200 internal employees and 70,000 contract employees working with clients around the world. Interested in sales and recruiting jobs with Aerotek? Do you have previous experience in retail sales, customer service or mortgage sales? Or have you worked in the restaurant or hospitality industries? If you have, or if you are just looking to start a lucrative and rewarding career in recruiting or customer service, apply today. JOIN OUR TEAM! We're looking for people like you - talented, motivated people who care about what they do, who never stop trying to achieve, and who want to build an exciting, stimulating career in a sales-oriented company. Our Recruiters work with our clients, Aerotek Sales Managers, Customer Service Associates and others to identify, screen, interview, present and hire qualified candidates for contract and permanent positions. Watch real testimonials from Aerotek Recruiters about their careers Aerotek or learn more about becoming an Aerotek Recruiter or Customer Service Associate today by visiting our web site: www.aerotekcareers.com Qualified candidates for the Recruiter position will: Develop recruiting strategies designed to identify qualified candidates through various recruiting tools Evaluate candidates' strengths compared with clients' requirements by: evaluating, screening and interviewing the candidate Negotiate wage rates and other terms and conditions of employment with candidates Manage contract employees while on assignment. Assess and investigate contractor related problems, and administer performance counseling, coaching and disciplinary measures when necessary Work with Account Managers to identify top accounts, target skill sets, key market segments, and to assess clients' staffing requirements Communicate effectively with others in order to create a productive and diverse environment Communicate with peers by sharing recruiting "best practices" and providing accurate, thorough documentation on contract employees in applicant tracking systems or other documentation tools Maintain relationships with industry contracts to provide customer service, gain industry knowledge, and get referrals and sales leads Qualified candidates for the Recruiter position must: Have a Bachelor's degree or related sales or recruiting experience Be available to work before/after typical office hours as work may demand Possess strong written and oral English communication skills Be familiar with Microsoft Word and MS Outlook (or similar email application) Have work experience in a service-oriented business Have a desire to learn and advance in a fast paced sales environment, and be capable of regularly using good judgment and discretion to accomplish goals and work requirements Be currently authorized to work in the United States for any employer Be interested in a career path leading into sales ***Starting compensation - $34,000/ annually plus uncapped commission*** The chosen candidate will receive a competitive base salary, uncapped commission, and an exceptional benefits package including a comprehensive medical/dental/vision plan, a 401(k) savings plan, and vacation pay. item.title: Certified Nursing Assistant
item.description: Details: The Haven in the Village at Chanticleer is an assisted living community, by Five Star Senior Living, serving Greenville and the surrounding areas is accepting applications for Certified Nursing Assistants. Candidates must be service oriented, demonstrate compassion and have a servant’s heart for caring for others. The Haven specializes in the care of individuals with dementia and other memory-related conditions. It is estimated that every 67 seconds someone in the United States develops Alzheimer's. Our mission is to provide quality care in a nurturing, caring and active environment while offering support to families. Supervise / assist Residents with personal care needs, medication administration, assist with activities and dietary services. Apply through Career Builder or in person during regular office hours, M-F, 9am – 5pm

item.title: Junior Account Manager - Marketing. Advertising. PR. Sales.
item.description: Details: Junior Account Manager - Marketing. Advertising. Retail. PR The role of the Junior Account Manager (JAM) is to help develop and execute the strategic sales and marketing plans for the key accounts. The key account sales and marketing plans will support, and be derived from, the Business Plan outlined by the Director of Sales and Marketing. The (JAM) will be responsible for managing all areas of the business relationship with the key accounts and will work closely with the various business departments in an effort to maintain and further develop the relationship with the key accounts. The (JAM) will manage the sales function to achieve strategic sales targets while working closely with the Marketing Department to provide integrated programs that support the sales effort. The (JAM) is the main contact with all key accounts and is the liaison between the various business departments and the key accounts. The Junior Account Manager reports directly to the Director of Sales and Marketing. Responsibilities • Maintain and build relationships with the key accounts • Develop and execute a sales and marketing plan for key accounts that meets or exceeds sales and margin targets • Grow existing product offerings with key accounts while introducing new product opportunities • Work closely with the various departments in the Marketing industry Nation Wide to ensure the accurate execution of sales orders and account activity • Provide regular interface with customers to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction • Provide direction to the marketing department on key marketing opportunities with the key accounts to support the sales effort • Provide regular sales reports to the Director of Sales and Marketing that accurately capture all sales activity • Seek out and communicate meaningful insights from key accounts and the market • Direct Customer Service and Sales Associate

item.title: Entry Level: Public Relations, Event Promotions, BtoB Sales and Marketing
item.description: Details: Entry Level: Public Relations, Event Promotions and Marketing DMG Company has an immediate need for a Public Relations and Marketing Communications Assistant to join a rapidly growing team. This rapidly-growing promotional marketing company, applies a customer-friendly, direct, results-driven approach to marketing research and sales. As a result of proven success and expertise, new clientele is continuously added as we dramatically increase clients' product exposure, sales and brand recognition. There is a HIGH DEMAND for customer service oriented, and cost-effective services. This leading event marketing firm provides advertising, marketing, and public relations campaigns for burgeoning companies and break out products. The Entry Level Public Relations and Communications Assistant will work closely on performance driven campaigns with high profile clients who consistently look for innovative strategic to drive their company and respective brands forward and increase their bottom line. Public Relations Teams Include: Advertising & Brand Exposure Marketing & Account Satisfaction Public and Media Based Strategies Project Management & Team Leadership An Entry Level Account Manager receives complete and individualized hands-on training in each division of our company. A proven mentorship program with senior management takes the time to develop and train the individual to handle any task and take initiative on any campaign. Trained, highly motivated, proactive representatives are invaluable. The right Entry Level Public Relations Assistant can expect to have opportunities for growth within the first few months that reflect their unmatched work ethic and dedication. Responsibilities: Managing and executing projects as assigned by the Marketing Manager Working with the Marketing Manager and key accounts to integrate PR campaigns with customer promotions Coordinating in-store service events and maintaining successful operation Building relationships with customers and communicating promotional services Working with the Marketing Manager to develop and refine measurement strategies for PR campaigns Development of promotional marketing materials and visual merchandizing Developing and maintaining relationships with suppliers and retail event personnel Keeping accurate and timely record of event traffic, production, and inventory Identifying new opportunities and efficiency innovations Position will be considered for senior campaign management roles based on performance

item.title: Sales- Junior Account Manager- Sales & Management
item.description: Details: As a Junior Account Manager you will serve as a direct link between our clients and their target customers. Your primary responsibilities expand in a sales capacity that secures new business and provides ongoing support to existing customers. Job Duties Operate as a liaison between our corporate clients and a select market Meeting new and existing customers about service promotions Meeting all sales objectives Handling the administrative aspects of all sales Completing sales contracts and filing the completed orders Maintain strong knowledge of all products, pricing and competitive sales offers Provide critical market feedback to the Market Director. We offer Base pay, commission and bonus structure A fun, fast paced and competitive work environment Rapid merit based promotion and exciting career opportunity Comprehensive on-going sales and management training

item.description: Details: JOB REQUIREMENTS, SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS: - Class A License required. - Double Trailer endorsement. - Evidence of one year of verifiable driving experience in the type of CMV the driver will be operating; or meeting entry level driver training requirements which shall consist of successful completion of an approved driver training course, which shall include a written examination. - Must be willing to take and pass a medical examination, drug/alcohol screening, and except where prohibited by law, the random and post-accident controlled substance and alcohol screenings. PRIMARY FUNCTIONS AND SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITIES: - Uniform provided. - Trailer and gas provided. - Mostly drop and hook. - 5-10 opening per HUB. - F/T opportunity and ability to convert within 90 days. AVAILABLE SHIFTS & PAY RANGE: - Generous pay rates. - Weekly pay based on hours worked. - 2nd and 3rd shifts preferred. - 8-10 hours per day. - 400-600 miles per day. - Return to same HUB every day.

item.title: Executive Assistant
item.description: Details: Job Title: Executive Assistant Duration : 6+ months - (Possibility of extension) Description: Responsible for providing administrative support to Unit President & up to 9 people in the Pharmaceutical Science and Technology Business Unit, along with Sr. Directors and Managers in Product Research. Manage travel itineraries and expense reporting for domestic and international travel (Japan, UK, India, US, etc). Ensure executives are well prepared for trips with organized itinerary and necessary documentation for meetings. Duties include managing calendar and international travel itineraries, managing and processing expense reports, coordinating meetings (including international meetings), arranging teleconferences and Webex calls, prioritizing mail, filing, handling confidential information, invoicing, meeting minutes, compliance, agendas for meetings and assisting with budget tracking for the department. Populate and maintain primary care calendar with corporate and employee meetings, conferences, as well as special events. Prepare expense reports in increasing complexity and volume using CONCUR. Set up luncheons, order food, supplies, etc. Some duties include handling personal inquiries for employees of ex-patriatates such as VISA/ passport renewal, acquiring Social Security cards upon arriving in the US, etc. Some publication coordination and documentation filing may be included as well

item.description: Details: Entry Level Management - Train to Manager / Supervisor role in Growing Agency (New Jersey branch) 3E Acquisitions Management is a marketing and sales firm with big goals. We’re looking for grads and entry level professionals who are hungry for career growth into management and to be a part of our expansion in the Clifton / Hackensack market. It is our belief that great managers and team leaders know the business they work in from the ground up. This is why we are looking for entry level team members to come train on our system for acquiring and retaining quality customers for our clients; so that as we grow our management team always knows where their people are coming from, and how to find success in their entry level roles. Axis Consultants, Inc. a premiere, privately owned and operated sales and marketing firm based in Jacksonville, FL. We will provide full hands-on training to the right candidates. Our Company Offers: • Outstanding Growth Opportunities • Hands On Training • Compensation on pay for performance basis + Weekly Salary • Travel Opportunities We are currently seeking candidates that possess: Written & Verbal Communication Skills Interpersonal Skills Work Ethic Integrity Ambition Determination Leadership Ability A four degree is preferred but not mandatory. item.title: HOSPITALITY / RETAIL / RESTAURANT – NO NIGHTS OR WEEKENDS
item.description: Details: Ready to hang up the apron and put on a business suit? Do you feel the skills you've gained in restaurant and retail jobs can be transferred to a new, exciting career? Dynamic Edge Consulting is now hiring to fill FULL TIME entry level account executive positions! Dynamic Edge Consulting Inc . is an outsourced sales and marketing firm that works with Fortune 500 companies in a variety of industries. Whether we’re working together to accomplish a team oriented goal in the office, or reviewing a detailed presentation with one of our clients, our overall approach is built around relationships. While advancing through our training program, our people develop an appreciation for discipline, follow through, and have every opportunity to work with the most energetic “go-getters" in Southern California. Visit Our Website Dynamic Edge Consulting Inc, Inc . is currently hiring entry level individuals with a restaurant, retail or hospitality background for the Account Manager position. We have found that candidates working in the retail, restaurant, hospitality and any type of customer service position are very easy to train into our account manager position. We specialize in areas of customer renewal, customer retention and customer acquisition and this all requires being great at working with people. Our sales and marketing firm is the leader in the marketing industry and in tailoring customer service & sales to their needs. Our clients want us to deliver a more face to face customer service experience by really taking care of their existing customer base and providing a more personal care with their new customers. This job involves face to face sales of services to new business prospects. Since we represent the some of the largest companies in the world, making sure that we provide the best customer satisfaction and improve customer relations is a top priority for our marketing company. DEC Inc. Homepage

item.title: Fuel Tanker Driver - Temecula CA
item.description: Details: Fuel Delivery Driver - Propane Gas Delivery - Petroleum & Fuel Oil Delivery Driver This position requires an individual to safely drive a propane delivery vehicle to customer locations. This position also requires someone with a positive and enthusiastic attitude toward Safety, Sales, Customer Service and Employee Team-Work. Duties & Responsibilities: • Responsible for achieving delivery objectives set forth by the local plant manager. • Operate company vehicle in a safe, efficient and courteous manner. • Inspect vehicle daily and report any problems in accordance with company policy and DOT regulations. Requirements: • Commercial Drivers License (CDL-A) with a HazMat endorsement and Tanker endorsement. • Ability to pass pre-employment DOT physical, drug test and Homeland Security Background Check. • Good interpersonal skills and willingness to take direction from plant manager. • A High School Diploma or equivalent. Fuel Delivery Driver - Propane Gas Delivery - Petroleum & Fuel Oil Delivery Driver

item.title: Diesel Maintenance Technician-Service Technician-Mechanic
item.description: Details: Job Description Dickinson Fleet, one of the most dynamic medium to heavy-duty truck service providers in the U.S., is looking for an experienced and quality-minded Mobile Diesel Maintenance Technician. In your role as a Mobile Diesel Maintenance Technician, you will troubleshoot and repair diesel engines at our customer locations. The Mobile Diesel Maintenance Technician position will involve: Diagnosing failures of vehicles and disassembling, repairing and reassembling parts as necessary Inspecting, testing and listening to defective equipment to diagnose malfunctions, using test instruments such as handheld computers, motor analyzers, chassis charts and pressure gauges Performing routine maintenance such as changing oil, checking batteries and lubricating equipment and machinery Inspecting brake systems, steering mechanisms, wheel bearings and other vital parts to ensure that they are in proper operating condition Mobile Diesel Maintenance Technician – Service Technician – Mechanic Job Responsibilities As a Mobile Diesel Maintenance Technician, you will be responsible for preventive maintenance, Federal DOT inspections, troubleshooting and repairing diesel engines, alignments, suspension, hydraulics, transmissions and electrical systems. Must be qualified to perform DOT inspections Your specific duties as a Diesel Maintenance Technician will include: Adjusting and relining brakes, aligning wheels, tightening bolts and screws, and reassembling equipment Inspecting, repairing, and maintaining automotive and mechanical equipment and machinery such as pumps and compressors Raising trucks, buses and heavy parts or equipment using hydraulic jacks or hoists Attaching test instruments to equipment, and reading dials and gauges to diagnose malfunctions Filling out and submitting all required documents in an accurate and timely manner on a company provided iPad

item.title: Welder
item.description: Details: Mig Structural welders 3 to 5 years. They will be working on converting pickup trucks to boom trucks. They must have experience Fabricating and Welding. They must be able to read blue prints, welding symbols. The candidate must be able to take a blueprint and kitted material and be able to correctly assemble the product. People that can not fabricate or have only done production welding will NOT qualify. Mandatory Skills- Fabrication, Cutting torch, Blue Prints, Welding Symbols, Be able to convert Fractions to Decimals Candidates will have to pass a blue print and math test before the move to the welding test. If they pass both tests they will be placed in a training cell and work side by side with a trainer on product for up to two weeks. All positions will train on first and then move to a second shift. Blueprints, math skills, MIG welding About Aerotek: Aerotek, headquartered in Hanover, Md., is a leading provider of technical, professional and industrial staffing services. item.title: Jr. Account Executive - Training Provided
item.description: Details: Are you looking for an opportunity to advance in a fast-paced and growing industry? Dynamic Edge Consulting is now hiring for the Jr. Account Executive position. We Are: Our organization began with a simple initiative: be the best at what we do. We share our pinnacle values with everyone we hire into our organization: Competition, integrity, teamwork, communication, and culture. We believe our focus on these qualities make us different from the many competitors out in the market, and has allowed us to stand out and continue our tradition of growth. item.title: Senior Cost Analyst
item.description: Details: Stephen James Associates is looking for a qualified candidate to fulfill a contract assignment for one of the fastest growing pharmaceutical organizations in the area. Job Duties: Generate monthly and ad hoc reports in SAP. Research charges to cost centers in preparation for variances analysis reviews with the business. Coordinate monthly closing process on behalf of Technical Operations Finance and ensure monthly tasks and journal entries are accurately and timely as recorded in the Blackline system. Proactively communicate potential issues and status to the broader constituents of the Finance and Accounting groups. Generate financial reports in SAP BPC for distribution to local management with commentary and analysis. Provide support and assist in a broad range of FP&A related activities. Provide analysis and reconciliation of prepaid and accrued expenses related to ARIMF cost centers Provide monthly reporting and analysis of capital spending. Support ARIMF capital review committee. Utilizing SAP, support the reporting of ARIMF inventory and production costs. Including variance analysis of production batches (ie yield, capacity, RM usage, etc). Qualifications: Must Have SAP BPC experience. 8+ years experience in Manufacturing Accounting and Finance environment. SAP (FICO, MM related to inventory & costing) Knowledge of US GAAP Business process & systems capability Proficient in Microsoft Office applications. Internal controls knowledge Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics. MBA is a plus About Stephen James Associates: Stephen James Associates specializes in the recruitment of staff through managerial level talent in the areas of accounting and finance.
