item.title: Physical Therapist (Home Health Care)
item.description: Details: Physical Therapist (Home Health Care) Every day, you give your all to your patients; you deserve to work for a company that gives you more. Known for quality care, CareSouth is the trusted source for home health care services. Right now, we are seeking a skilled Physical Therapist to ensure that patient care / therapy is coordinated, managed, and delivered appropriately in a cost-effective and financially responsible manner. We offer workable schedules, competitive pay, excellent benefits, and advanced technology such as user-friendly smartphones and tablets. Every day, we make a difference in the lives of patients, and as a member of our team, so will you. Apply today! Physical Therapist (Home Health Care) Job Responsibilities As a Physical Therapist, you will provide physical therapy services to patients according to a written physician's plan of care. This involves assessing and evaluating therapeutic/rehabilitative/functional status and the home environment, as well as participating in the development of the total plan of care. You will be responsible for following all privacy policies of CareSouth and maintaining the confidentiality of protected healthcare information (PHI). Physical Therapist responsibilities include: •Directing physical therapy treatment •Instructing other personnel and/or family/caregiver members on certain phases of physical therapy in which they may work with a patient •Participating in case conferences to inform the patient / family about the goals of the physical therapy program •Training patient in the use of prosthetic device if needed •Identifying patient and family/caregiver needs for other home health services and referring as necessary •Preparing and submitting clinical and progress summaries based on the attainment of goals •Participating in discharge planning for patient •Preparing and submitting a clinical progress summary based on the attainment of goals as directed by Organization policy •Providing physical therapy consultation to home families/caregivers when indicated •Providing in-service education programs for nursing organization personnel as needed •Participating in peer consultation process •Supervising Physical Therapy Assistants according to organization policy and state regulations •Instructing, supervising, and evaluating home health aide care when therapy is the only skilled service Physical Therapist (Home Health Care)

item.title: LPN LVN
item.description: Details: Want more out of your nursing career? Join the nursing team at CareSouth! Known for quality care, we are the trusted source for home health care services. Right now, we are seeking a skilled Licensed Practical Nurse or Licensed Vocational Nurse to provide direct patient care under the supervision of an RN. We offer workable schedules, competitive pay, excellent benefits, and advanced technology such as user-friendly smartphones and tablets. Every day, we a make a difference in the lives of patients, and as a member of our team, so will you. Apply today! Home Health Nurse (LPN / LVN) Job Responsibilities As a Home Health Nurse, you will follow the plan of care, provide treatments, and work collaboratively with the members of the team to help create positive patient care outcomes. You will be responsible for following all privacy policies of CareSouth and maintaining the confidentiality of protected healthcare information (PHI). Nurse responsibilities include: •Providing direct patient care as defined in the agency state of operation’s Nurse Practice Act •Implementing plan of care initiated by the RN •Providing accurate and timely documentation consistent with the plan of care •Assessing and providing patient and family/caregiver education and information pertinent to diagnosis and plan of care •Participating in coordination of home health services, appropriately reporting the identified needs for other disciplines (HHA, OT, PT, MSW, ST, and Dietician) to the RN and/or Clinical Manager •Using equipment and supplies effectively and efficiently •Providing weekend and holiday coverage as assigned •Participating in orientation, in-services, and staff meetings as scheduled •Participating in personal and professional growth and development

item.title: Occupational Therapist (Home Health Care)
item.description: Details: Occupational Therapist (Home Health Care) Job Description Every day, you give your all to your patients; you deserve to work for a company that gives you more. Known for quality care, CareSouth is the trusted source for home health care services. Right now, we are seeking a skilled Occupational Therapist to ensure that patient care / therapy is coordinated, managed, and delivered appropriately in a cost-effective and financially responsible manner. We offer workable schedules, competitive pay, excellent benefits, and advanced technology such as user-friendly smartphones and tablets. Every day, we make a difference in the lives of patients, and as a member of our team, so will you. Apply today! Occupational Therapist (Home Health Care) Job Responsibilities As an Occupational Therapist, you will evaluate patient’s functional status and the home environment for hazards or barriers to more independent living. You will then develop a treatment program and establish goals for improved function, identifying equipment needs as well as collaborating with other healthcare providers to create a positive patient outcome. Occupational Therapist responsibilities include: •Performing work capacity evaluation and referring to specialized vocational training if needed •Communicating plan of care to referring physician and other Organization professionals •Teaching new skills or retraining patient in once familiar daily activities that have been lost due to illness or injury •Fabricating splints and instructing patient in the use of various types of adaptive equipment to improve function •Training patient in the use of prosthetic and/or orthotic devices •Maintaining appropriate clinical records and clinical notes, and reporting to the physician any changes in the patient’s condition •Maintaining contact/communication with other personnel involved in the patient’s care to promote coordinated, efficient care •Attending and contributing to in-services, case conferences, and other meetings •Identifying patient and family/caregiver needs for other home health services and referring as appropriate •Instructing patient’s family/caregiver and other Organization health care personnel in patient’s treatment regime •Supervising Certified Occupational Therapy Assistants •Instructing, supervising, and evaluating home health aide care every two (2) weeks when therapy is the only skilled service •Participating in discharge planning for patient •Following all privacy policies of CareSouth and maintain the confidentiality of protected healthcare information (PHI)

item.title: Home Health Aide (Certified Nursing Assistant)
item.description: Details: Home Health Aide (CNA Certified Nursing Assistant) Experience how much MORE you can get out of your career when you partner with CareSouth! Known for quality care, we are the trusted source for home health care services. Right now, we are seeking a Home Health Aide (CNA) to deliver skilled and compassionate care to our patients. We offer workable schedules, competitive pay, excellent benefits, and advanced technology such as user-friendly smartphones and tablets. Every day, we make a difference in the lives of patients, and as a member of our team, so will you. Apply today! Home Health Aide (CNA Certified Nursing Assistant) Job Responsibilities As a Home Health Aide (CNA), you will perform home care visits and work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse or Therapist. This involves performing various personal care services as necessary to meet the patient’s needs. You will be responsible for observing, reporting, and documenting observations and patient care performed during the home care visit. Home Health Aide responsibilities: •Providing personal care, including baths, personal hygiene, changing bed linen, dressing/undressing, toileting activities, and light housekeeping •Preparing light meals and assisting in feeding patient if necessary •Taking and recording oral, rectal, and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration, and blood pressure when ordered •Assisting in ambulation and exercise according to the plan of care •Performing range of motion and other simple procedures as an extensional therapy service as ordered •Assisting patient in the self-administration of medication •Assisting with patient’s laundry if needed •Meeting safety needs of patients and using equipment safely and properly (foot stools, side rails, etc.) •Reporting patient’s condition and significant changes to the assigned nurse •Adhering to the Organization's documentation and care procedures and standards of personal and professional conduct •Following all privacy policies of CareSouth, Infection Control protocols, and maintaining the confidentiality of protected healthcare information (PHI)

item.title: Physical Therapy Assistant (Home Health Care
item.description: Details: Physical Therapy Assistant (Home Health Care) Help us provide patients with the best physical therapy experience possible! Physical Therapy Assistant (Home Health Care) Job Responsibilities As a Physical Therapy Assistant, you will provide physical therapy services under the direction of the Physical Therapist and according to the physician's plan of care. You will be responsible for following all privacy policies of CareSouth and maintaining the confidentiality of protected healthcare information (PHI). Physical Therapy Assistant responsibilities include: •Treating patients to relieve pain, develop or restore function, and maintain maximum performance •Directing and aiding patients in active and passive therapeutic exercises, muscle reeducation, gait and functional training, transfer activities, and prosthetic training •Utilizing physical agents, including, but not limited to, heat, cold, water, light, electricity, ultrasound, and massage •Observing and reporting to the Physical Therapist and the Organization personnel the patient’s reaction to treatment and any changes in patient’s condition •Instructing patients in care and use of wheelchairs, braces, crutches, canes, and prosthetic or orthotic devices •Maintaining necessary records, including clinical notes and conference notes, which will be incorporated into the patient’s clinical record in prescribed time frames •Participating in Organization Home Care Team Members meetings and Organization In-service Education Program Physical Therapy Assistant (Home Health Care)

Home Health Nurse (RN Registered Nurse) Job Responsibilities As a Home Health Nurse (RN), you will build from the resources of the community to plan and direct services to meet the needs of individuals and families within their homes and communities. You will be responsible for completing an initial assessment of patient and family to determine home care needs, developing a plan of care, and implementing that plan of care. Home Health Nurse responsibilities: •Providing a complete physical assessment and history of current and previous illness(es) •Re-evaluating patient nursing needs and making necessary revisions as patient status and needs change •Using health assessment data to determine nursing diagnosis •Initiating appropriate preventive and rehabilitative nursing procedures •Administering medications and treatments as prescribed by the physician •Counseling the patient and family in meeting nursing and related needs •Providing health care instructions and education to the patient, as appropriate, per assessment and plan of care •Identifying discharge planning needs as part of the care plan development and implementing prior to discharge of the patient •Acting as Case Manager when assigned by Clinical Manager and assuming responsibility for coordinating patient care for assigned caseload •Providing weekend, holiday, and on call coverage as assigned •Instructing, supervising, and evaluating home health aide and LPN care provided •Participating in orientation, in-services, and staff meetings as scheduled •Following all privacy policies of CareSouth and maintain the confidentiality of protected healthcare information (PHI) Home Health Nurse (RN Registered Nurse)

item.title: Home Health Nurse (LPN / LVN)
item.description: Details: Job Description Want more out of your nursing career? Join the nursing team at CareSouth! Known for quality care, we are the trusted source for home health care services. Right now, we are seeking a skilled Licensed Practical Nurse or Licensed Vocational Nurse to provide direct patient care under the supervision of an RN. We offer workable schedules, competitive pay, excellent benefits, and advanced technology such as user-friendly smartphones and tablets. Every day, we a make a difference in the lives of patients, and as a member of our team, so will you. Apply today! Home Health Nurse (LPN / LVN) Job Responsibilities As a Home Health Nurse, you will follow the plan of care, provide treatments, and work collaboratively with the members of the team to help create positive patient care outcomes. You will be responsible for following all privacy policies of CareSouth and maintaining the confidentiality of protected healthcare information (PHI). Nurse responsibilities include: •Providing direct patient care as defined in the agency state of operation’s Nurse Practice Act •Implementing plan of care initiated by the RN •Providing accurate and timely documentation consistent with the plan of care •Assessing and providing patient and family/caregiver education and information pertinent to diagnosis and plan of care •Participating in coordination of home health services, appropriately reporting the identified needs for other disciplines (HHA, OT, PT, MSW, ST, and Dietician) to the RN and/or Clinical Manager •Using equipment and supplies effectively and efficiently •Providing weekend and holiday coverage as assigned •Participating in orientation, in-services, and staff meetings as scheduled •Participating in personal and professional growth and development

item.title: Panda Express - Restaurant Manager - Interview Day 10/30/2014 - Bay Area/Northern California
item.description: Details: Interview Day Information Come join us for an interview on Thursday, October 30, 2014 from 2:00PM-6:00PM At the Panda Express on El Camino Real & Ralston (Belmont Village) Address: 1050 El Camino Real #D Belmont, CA 94002 22,000 Panda Associates living one common mission: “Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives.” Known as the ʺPanda Way,ʺ our company culture places special emphasis on encouraging our Associates to focus on a healthy lifestyle, continuous learning, developing others and acknowledging others. We believe that this, coupled with our five fundamental values – proactive, respect/win-win, growth, great operations and giving – provides our Associates with an environment where they can both inspire and be inspired. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn concept, our full service restaurants; Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food served in a fast casual environment; and Hibachi-San, our Japanese grill mall-based restaurants. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. With annual sales of more than $1.5 billion, we continue to add more than 100 new units annually. Panda offers excellent benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have opportunities available in our restaurants nationwide as well as within our corporate office located in the Los Angeles area. Join our growing team with more than 1,600 locations across North America. Job Description Are you Craving a Career? Ready for Growth? COME SEE WHY PANDA MIGHT BE THE RIGHT PLACE! At Panda, we all share a common mission: "Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives." We invest in our people because great people run great operations that will exceed our guests' expectations. Talk to any of our associates and you will experience a culture dedicated to its mission and our five fundamental values- Proactive, Respect/Win-Win, Growth, Great Operations, and Giving. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn fine dining restaurants, Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food concept served in a fast casual environment, and Hibachi San, our Japanese grill concept. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. Panda offers competitive benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have restaurant positions available nationwide and support center positions in Rosemead, CA. Come join the nation's largest and fastest growing Asian restaurant company. Our continued growth in this location has created new career opportunities for Management, Crew Members, and Kitchen Team Members!!! Come join us! Restaurant Management Team responsibilities: Lead all or some People aspects of a Panda Express restaurant including hiring, training, coaching, and development Ensure the safety of our Guests and Associates through training and execution of food safety and restaurant safety standards and guidelines Lead all or some Guest components of a Panda Express restaurant including excellent food quality, guest service, associate friendliness, and restaurant cleanliness through your team using proven systems and routines Lead all or some financial areas of a Panda Express restaurant including sales growth, cost management, and profit growth Applies thorough knowledge of all policies, procedures and practices utilized within unit managed Understands ways in which unit relates to and impacts PRG Demonstrates knowledge of PRG operations and objectives Seeks information regarding trends affecting food service industry We offer our Full-Time Management Team: Progressive Compensation Package and Excellent Bonus Opportunity 5 or more Weeks of Comprehensive Training to prepare you for success On-Going Career & Leadership Development Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 401 K with Company Match Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Associate Discounts (Panda Express, Hibachi San, Panda Inn plus Theme Parks) and free meals when you work Lucrative Associate Referral Bonus Pre-Tax Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account Qualifications College degree or equivalent experience preferred High school or GED required Additional expectations of our Management Team are: Excellent leaders with great people skills Proactive – Sees life as choices and chooses to make a positive impact. People Oriented – enjoys working with our guests and associates, possess good communication and interpersonal skills. Growth Oriented – knows that learning and growth are keys to personal and professional success and is willing and able to share learning with others. Results Oriented – focuses on getting results without compromising guest, people, and financial areas. ADA Statement: While performing duties, counter areas are often hot with steam from steam table and food vapors. Work space is restricted and employees are expected to remain standing for long periods of time. Employees must prepare hot and cold foods, use Chinese cook knife and other kitchen equipment and work quickly without losing accuracy. Employees may be required to lift up to 50 lbs., stand up to four hours and reach across counter tops measured at 36 inches to serve customers. Kitchens are hot and noise levels are usually high; storage space is limited and shelving is high. Panda Restaurant Group, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Lead Developer
item.description: Details: King Arthur Flour Job Description - Lead Developer Reports to Director of Information Services General Summary Leading our Software Development Team, you will coordinate with our IT Team and other departments to continue the growth and improvements to our internally developed systems. The ideal applicant will thrive on applying industry best practices through teamwork and creative solutions to enhance the experience of our internal and external customers. Leading our Software Development Team will include managing projects, mentoring the individual team members, and forming strong relationships with our internal customers. This position will coordinate with our internal customers, including: our Web Development Director, for developing back end systems to support our ecommerce site; our Retail Store Director, for developing and supporting our Point of Sale system; as well as other internal customers with software development needs. Essential Job Functions Develop the vision and strategy for our Software Development team including the end-to-end software development process. Manage and coordinate the efforts of the Software Development Team to meet project timelines. Evaluate and develop the skillset of the Software Development team. Evaluate staffing needs and suggest new positions when appropriate. Participate in the process of scheduling and prioritizing new projects with our internal customers. Participate in ROI evaluation in determining best solution to proposed challenge or opportunity. Gather requirements and create scoping documentation for future projects. Create, track, and manage project plans for development projects; communicate project updates to appropriate audiences. Participate in regular communication and collaboration with our internal customers. Proactively suggest improvements and future functionality for internally developed systems. Ensure proper documentation exists associated with all aspects of King Arthur Flour developed systems. Manage and mentor the individual members of the Software Development team. Program and direct new functionality projects in accordance with approved priorities.

item.title: Entry Level Java Developer
item.description: Details: Top Three Skills: 1-2 years of software programming experience with java/j2ee development exposure/experience with Framework Integration (Hibernate is used for persisting data in their Application. They can have similar framework experience they just need to have the aptitude to learn) Experience with testing/documenting own code Job Description: This responsible for programming and performing analysis in Java and J2EE technologies, while utilizing IBM tools and products. There are three separate teams this person can be utilized on based on where their strengths lie. One team supports the policy administration systems to where they are more focused on restful services and systems integration through 3rd party. Another team is more focused on the frontend java which includes the web UI group. The third team is more focused more on the outputs and doing more data reporting and core java development. They will interview all candidates and put them in the appropriate group to where their individual strengths lie. This position is for a software engineer with experience and knowledge of Java and J2EE technologies. Maintain and enhance an enterprise J2EE application. item.title: Energy Management Technician, Full Time: North Hollywood, CA - Macy’s Laurel Plaza
item.description: Details: Overview: As an Energy Management Technician, you will be responsible to support Facility initiatives directly related to Energy Management Systems (EMS). An Energy Management Technician shall apply, monitor, analyze, test and debug EMS systems for adherence to Corporate Standards as related to HVAC, lighting, and other building systems. In addition, the EMS Technician shall suggest improvement strategies that will reduce energy usage and improve building conditions. Essential Functions:- Troubleshoot, maintain and calibrate EMS system hardware across multiple locations - Perform uploads/downloads of EMS hardware from remote and local networks - Write, debug and enhance EMS software operation in adherence with Corporate Guidelines - Provide 2nd level Time Scheduling backup as needed - Identify energy reduction opportunities across multiple locations - Perform Retro Commissioning (RCx) testing procedures on building equipment as directed - Communicate directly with Facility maintenance staff - Perform all duties in a safe manner and in accordance with established work standards Qualifications: - Minimum of a two year Associate of Applied Science Degree from an Accredited College or University in an Electrical, Mechanical, Computer Science or other related building trade; past work experience may be substituted for education requirements - General knowledge of Mechanical, Electrical and Lighting systems - Knowledge of IT, LAN/WAN requirements as related to EMS components - Advanced problem-solving, multi-tasking and time management with attention to detail - Strong teamwork and organizational skills - Effective written and verbal communication skills - Ability to effectively share technical information - Basic computer literacy - Must be able to respond when needed for emergencies within facilities - Must be available to perform work in evenings as required - Physically able to ascend or descend ladders in performing assigned tasks - Physically able to lift equipment or items weighing 50 pounds or more Possession of a valid state driver's license Macy's is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.title: Clinical Director ADHC East
item.description: Details: Position Description The Clinical Director provides clinical and administrative oversight to the Adult Day Health Care Program (ADHC) Case Management/Mental Health Unit. The Clinical Director will provide clinical supervision to the Case Managers, the Certified Alcohol and Substance Abuse Counselors, the Certified Therapeutic Recreational Specialist, the Psychotherapists and the Creative Art Therapies Coordinator component at the ADHC. The Clinical Director shares responsibility along with the Managing Director and Operations Director for the daily operations of the ADHC including: facilitation of three times/wk care planning meetings, monthly Triad/ CQI meeting; problem solving, crisis intervention and program planning. The Clinical Director shares accountability for census, utilization and client engagement and participation in services. Additional responsibilities will include provision of mental health supportive counseling to program members demonstrating difficulty in coping, poor frustration tolerance, management of anger and personality disorders, etc.

item.title: Panda Express - Restaurant Manager Interview Day 10/28/2014 - Bay Area/Northern California
item.description: Details: Interview Day Information Come join us for an interview on Tuesday, October 28, 2014 from 2:00PM-6:00PM At the Panda Express on El Camino Real & California Address: 2310 El Camino Real Palo Alto, CA 94306 22,000 Panda Associates living one common mission: “Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives.” Known as the ʺPanda Way,ʺ our company culture places special emphasis on encouraging our Associates to focus on a healthy lifestyle, continuous learning, developing others and acknowledging others. We believe that this, coupled with our five fundamental values – proactive, respect/win-win, growth, great operations and giving – provides our Associates with an environment where they can both inspire and be inspired. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn concept, our full service restaurants; Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food served in a fast casual environment; and Hibachi-San, our Japanese grill mall-based restaurants. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. With annual sales of more than $1.5 billion, we continue to add more than 100 new units annually. Panda offers excellent benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have opportunities available in our restaurants nationwide as well as within our corporate office located in the Los Angeles area. Join our growing team with more than 1,600 locations across North America. Job Description Are you Craving a Career? Ready for Growth? COME SEE WHY PANDA MIGHT BE THE RIGHT PLACE! At Panda, we all share a common mission: "Deliver exceptional Asian dining experiences by building an organization where people are inspired to better their lives." We invest in our people because great people run great operations that will exceed our guests' expectations. Talk to any of our associates and you will experience a culture dedicated to its mission and our five fundamental values- Proactive, Respect/Win-Win, Growth, Great Operations, and Giving. Panda Restaurant Group includes the original Panda Inn fine dining restaurants, Panda Express, our Gourmet Chinese food concept served in a fast casual environment, and Hibachi San, our Japanese grill concept. The family owned and operated company is still run by founders Andrew and Peggy Cherng. Panda offers competitive benefits and rewarding opportunities, from entry-level positions to management. We have restaurant positions available nationwide and support center positions in Rosemead, CA. Come join the nation's largest and fastest growing Asian restaurant company. Our continued growth in this location has created new career opportunities for Management, Crew Members, and Kitchen Team Members!!! Come join us. Restaurant Management Team responsibilities: Lead all or some People aspects of a Panda Express restaurant including hiring, training, coaching, and development Ensure the safety of our Guests and Associates through training and execution of food safety and restaurant safety standards and guidelines Lead all or some Guest components of a Panda Express restaurant including excellent food quality, guest service, associate friendliness, and restaurant cleanliness through your team using proven systems and routines Lead all or some financial areas of a Panda Express restaurant including sales growth, cost management, and profit growth Applies thorough knowledge of all policies, procedures and practices utilized within unit managed Understands ways in which unit relates to and impacts PRG Demonstrates knowledge of PRG operations and objectives Seeks information regarding trends affecting food service industry We offer our Full-Time Management Team: Progressive Compensation Package and Excellent Bonus Opportunity 5 or more Weeks of Comprehensive Training to prepare you for success On-Going Career & Leadership Development Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 401 K with Company Match Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Associate Discounts (Panda Express, Hibachi San, Panda Inn plus Theme Parks) and free meals when you work Lucrative Associate Referral Bonus Pre-Tax Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account Qualifications Qualifications: College degree or equivalent experience preferred High school or GED required Additional expectations of our Management Team are: Excellent leaders with great people skills Proactive – Sees life as choices and chooses to make a positive impact. People Oriented – enjoys working with our guests and associates, possess good communication and interpersonal skills. Growth Oriented – knows that learning and growth are keys to personal and professional success and is willing and able to share learning with others. Results Oriented – focuses on getting results without compromising guest, people, and financial areas. ADA Statement: While performing duties, counter areas are often hot with steam from steam table and food vapors. Work space is restricted and employees are expected to remain standing for long periods of time. Employees must prepare hot and cold foods, use Chinese cook knife and other kitchen equipment and work quickly without losing accuracy. Employees may be required to lift up to 50 lbs., stand up to four hours and reach across counter tops measured at 36 inches to serve customers. Kitchens are hot and noise levels are usually high; storage space is limited and shelving is high. Panda Restaurant Group, Inc is an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: UI developer
item.description: Details: Top Three Skills: 1-3 years plus experience with UI development (this person needs to know how develop from scratch, not copy and paste pages) and be able to test own code (ie deal with issues from design or fix problem with outside systems, debugging) 2. experience with javascript (understanding of JS libraries, backbone JS and nodes JS is what candidates need to explain), HTML 5, CSS 3 and jquery (which is an underscore of JS-they do all communications back and forth between all their systems and also need to be familiar with backlog) 3. experience documenting design style guides for their applications, document what elements to use and where, document program flows and page architecture documents. Job Description: This person will be coding from scratch JavaScript/ html 5, css 3 (which is a newer framework) and jquery. Specific to JavaScript they need to have understanding of backbone JS (which is used for backbone application) , nodes JS, and needs to understand JS libraries. Jquery- which is underscore JS would be a nice to have (they just have a template language)) to do all communications back and forth btw systems) and they need to be familiar with backlog. This shop has all Cutting edge knowledge, but understanding the newer standards are crucial to being successful to this environment. They need to be able to Physically code these languages from scratch and code correctly. Someone who can actually write by not having a dragon editor is who we are targeting. PHP and ruby of rail would be pluses. On a new project this person will be coding 80-90% of the day/week. The other 10-20% will be dealing with issues with design or fix problem with outside systems. They will also be responsible for documentation. This includes design style guide for their applications, what elements to use and where, program flows, page architecture documents and bug tracking. item.title: Senior Manager of Vessel Completion Yard - Job is Located in Mobile, Alabama Only
item.description: Details: *** Job is Located in Mobile, Alabama ONLY*** REPORTS TO: Director of Final Assembly SUPERVISES: Mid-level and lower level managers; Manufacturing Personnel in Vessel Completion Yard (VCY). AUTHORITIES / RESPONSIBILITIES: The purpose of the Sr. Manager of Vessel Completion Yard (VCY) position is to manage production completion and work in cooperation with the Projects team and Test & Activation to ensure that the ship is ready for turnover to the customer, inclusive of but not limited to the following responsibilities: Coordinate handover of all remaining production related tasks & trials support with production trade managers and T&A prior to vessel movement to the VCY. Development of strategic completion plans for the vessel(s) in conjunction with Project team(s). These plans include discrete task completion schedule, manpower / resource identification, PDA work, subcontractor coordination etc… Develop and maintain detailed work plans to the daily task level through the assigned vessel production management and supervisory staff. Manage and control production cost, schedule performance, quality metrics, safety, vessel and facility cleanliness for all work performed at the VCY Manage any subcontracted work and workforce associated with vessel completion, including workscope development, period of execution, cost management and schedule conformance. Coordinate production support associated with Test and Activation completion activities. Provide craft oversight ensuring appropriate documentation is maintained IAW procedures for all completion efforts and that appropriate regulatory agencies (ABS, SUPSHIP) are integral to the completion sign off process Ensures all process and procedures are adhered to and documentation maintained for compartment completion, quality conformance, inspection signoffs, system re-entry process and LOTO process Ensures vessel readiness for dock, builders and acceptance trials and final INSURV acceptance. Responsible for all production activities at the facility leading up to and in support of these events, including safety, testing and manning resources Manage completion of all trial cards that are generated from Builders Trials Coordinates all Post Delivery Availability (PDA) work with Warranty department and develops necessary resource plans and implementation schedule for all crafts affected and coordinates regression testing with T & A Manage services (crane, tugboat, services, etc.) in support of vessel departure and arrival at dock Develop and implement LEAN strategies for all manufacturing trades. Manage and control overhead operating budget for the VCY Provide a framework of leadership which enables the achievement of the manufacturing strategies and objectives. Create an atmosphere of teamwork with all the Support groups that interact with VCY.

item.title: Technical Recruiter Trainee
item.description: Details: If you are looking for a career with no salary caps, the life of a recruiter is for you. You can control your income simply by controlling how much work you put in. IT Accel, Inc. is a technology staffing firm that is headquartered in New York, New York, and has offices in Los Angeles, California and Columbus, Ohio. These strategic locations guarantee full coverage of the United States. If you are hard-working, highly organized, enthusiastic, driven to learn, and have excellent communication skills - you can control your own destiny by joining us as a Technical Recruiter Trainee. As a trainee, you will work with our Account Managers to execute full cycle recruiting through sourcing candidates. This process includes initial contact, managing and coordinating the initial interview process, and conducting reference checks. This is a telephone and in-person business. If you have a fear of talking on the phone to people and asking questions, this is not the right role for you. If you do not like to go out and meet new people, this is not the right role for you. If you do not have an interest in learning new technologies and talking about them on a daily basis, this is not the role for you. HOWEVER: If you are a college graduate who is energetic, outgoing, driven, sales-minded, enthusiastic, hard-working, computer savvy and comfortable dealing with people at all levels, IT Accel wants to talk to YOU! We offer a base salary, benefits and the means to begin earning commissions immediately. Again, there is no limit to the commissions you can earn. While other careers cap out, this is an industry with no cap.

They cannot include nor are they intended to include all duties performed by all positions occupying a class. Salary Range: FLSA Status: Hourly Date Approved: September 11, 2012 SUMMARY : Responsible for quality assurance of construction or weatherizing work performed by the Installers. Will be in direct contact with low-income, disadvantaged and elderly families during the inspection of construction and weatherization work performed by Weatherization Installers SUPERVISION RECEIVED : Receives supervision from Weatherization Coordinator. SUPERVISION EXERCISED : None DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES : Disclaimer - This list is meant to be representative, not exhaustive. Some incumbents may not perform all the duties listed or may perform related duties as assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. A. Essential Job Specific Duties: 1. Conduct on-site inspections of homes weatherized by the Agency to insure that the quality of work performed is consistent with Federal, State, and Utility regulations. 2. Investigate and resolve client complaints in a timely manner; performing necessary follow-up inspections to ensure contractual compliance. 3. Act as liaison between Federal, State, Utility funding sources and vendors. 4. Must accompany State Inspector during semi-annual field inspections. 5. Perform other duties as required. B. Other Job Specific Duties: 1. Attends all meetings, trainings, and conferences as assigned. 2. Maintains safe and functional work environment. 3. Work alternative hours as required, including nights and weekends. 4. Is proactive in the program effort to recruit and enroll families that qualify for CAPK programs. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS : The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to satisfactorily perform the essential duties and responsibilities. Knowledge of: Agency policies and procedures Applicable federal, state, and local laws, codes, and regulations Departmental policies and procedures Modern office practices, methods, procedures and equipment including computers Word processing, spreadsheet, database, and other related software applications Knowledge of principles and methods of home weatherization. Knowledge of the problems and needs of the low-income, disadvantaged, and elderly. Ability to: Ability to deal with conceptual matters Ability to plan, organize, allocate, and control substantial resources. Ability to communicate effectively Good interpersonal skills. Effectively present program to the general public. Bilingual language fluency (Spanish/English) desirable Ability to maintain effective working relationships with staff, public and private agencies. Ability gather and analyze data. Ability to understand and apply written regulations and instructions; communicate effectively. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE : The following requirements generally demonstrate possession of the minimum requisite knowledge and ability necessary to perform the duties of the position. 1. A.A./A.S. degree in Business Administration or related field preferred (Qualifying experience may be substituted for the required education on a year for year basis). 2. Three (3) to Five (5) years of progressively responsible administrative or management experience in home weatherization, construction, and/or home repair. OTHER REQUIREMENTS 1. Must have use of an automobile with adequate insurance coverage and a valid California Drivers License with an acceptable driving record substantiated by a copy of DMV records. 2. Travel is required in this position to various homes and worksites located throughout Kern County. The Agency provides an agency vehicle or mileage reimbursement to approved drivers. 3. At times, may require bending, stooping, twisting, reaching above and below shoulder level, crawling, kneeling, climbing, overhead reaching, lifting, and prolonged standing, sitting and driving. 4. During inspections, position may require working in dark cramped quarters and in conditions where you may be exposed to dust, sawdust, pollens, fiberglass and cellulose insulation. WORK ENVIRONMENT : The work environment characteristics described are representative of those an employee encounters in performing the essential functions of this job. Since most of their work is performed at client’s home should the characteristics for the work environment describe the office or the client home? • Work is primarily performed indoors. • Noise level is quiet to moderately quiet. • Hazards are minimal.

item.title: Bilingual Social Worker
item.description: Details: Under the supervision of the Director of Clinical Services and in accordance with established policies and procedures, the Social Worker provides client assessments, including diagnosing, g substance use counseling, mental health counseling, HIV education and entitlement advocacy services to clients of the Adult Day Health Care Program. The Social Worker will also facilitate mental health and harm reduction groups. This position functions in a primarily electronic environment and requires proficiency in ‘Windows" based technology. Essential Job Functions The following duties are mandatory requirements of the job: Establishing treatment goals and objectives with clients, as part of the interdisciplinary care planning process. Facilitate groups. Providing crisis intervention services as necessary, refer clients for psychiatric assessment. Coordinating the provision of multidisciplinary services as outlined in interdisciplinary care plan with particular influence upon housing and entitlement services. Identifying clients receiving services from other community providers and coordinate care. Assumes role of primary social worker; coordinating joint services and treatment planning, assessment, reassessment and joint case conferencing with other service providers to clarify and define each provider’s goals and objectives. Insure the integrity and confidentiality of all patient information in the EHR by not sharing personal user name or password with other staff, and by exiting the application or locking the system when away from the computer. All other duties as assigned by the Director of Clinical Services

item.title: General Accounting -
item.description: Details: Accountant Job Responsibilities: Provides financial information to management by researching and analyzing accounting data; preparing reports. Accountant Job Duties: •Prepares asset, liability, and capital account entries by compiling and analyzing account information. •Documents financial transactions by entering account information. •Recommends financial actions by analyzing accounting options. •Summarizes current financial status by collecting information; preparing balance sheet, profit and loss statement, and other reports. •Substantiates financial transactions by auditing documents. •Maintains accounting controls by preparing and recommending policies and procedures. •Guides accounting clerical staff by coordinating activities and answering questions. •Reconciles financial discrepancies by collecting and analyzing account information. •Secures financial information by completing data base backups. •Maintains financial security by following internal controls. •Prepares payments by verifying documentation, and requesting disbursements. •Answers accounting procedure questions by researching and interpreting accounting policy and regulations. •Complies with federal, state, and local financial legal requirements by studying existing and new legislation, enforcing adherence to requirements, and advising management on needed actions. •Prepares special financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing account information and trends. •Maintains customer confidence and protects operations by keeping financial information confidential. •Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies. •Accomplishes the result by performing the duty. •Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. We are an equal employment opportunity employer and will consider all qualified candidates without regard to disability or protected veteran status.

item.description: Details: This is an ideal position for entry level candidates or someone coming from an education or social services background who loved helping others, but hated feeling like they were tied up in red tape. Our services allow them to recruit support for their cause in several areas including: www.care.org www.childfund.org www.nature.org Women's Rights World Hunger Human Trafficking Child Sponsorship Disaster Relief Marketing and fundraising on behalf of a charity is humbling and rewarding work especially in light of recent strife across the globe. At Capital we believe it’s our job to try. INTERESTED CANDIDATES PLEASE SEND RESUME AND CONTACT INFORMATION TO: Hiring only at entry level with organic growth/promotion only, has allowed us to provide an excellent work atmosphere with an extremely diverse team. Our leadership is comprised entirely of people that started entry level and includes: a Fordham collegiate athlete who started right after graduating, a Nepali entrepreneur, who has seen poverty in his own country, a future doctor from Liberia, who wants to return home to provide free medical care and a manager that speaks seven languages and has traveled to every country in Europe. Whether you are entry level, looking to change careers and grow with a company, or you just want to love what you do and be around cool people, we are willing to train and develop someone that embodies the following 5 things: Integrity Passion Work Ethic Student Mentality Positive Attitude www.capitalacquisitionsinc.com

item.title: Senior Systems Engineer
item.description: Details: PATLive is seeking an experienced Senior Systems Engineer to help us manage the infrastructure that supports over 200,000 daily callers across our suite of SaaS communication offerings. In this role, you will be part of a team that monitors and manages services used by both private and public sector clients, so system availability and performance are of utmost importance. While we recognize that we probably won’t find someone with all of the following qualifications, our ideal candidate would have: 7+ years System Engineer experience with mission critical systems in medium to large-scale deployments Experience managing modern distributed systems and web application scaling, including virtualization (VMWare, Citrix), clustering, and fail-over solutions in a high-traffic environment Excellent Windows and Unix (preferably CentOS) System Administration knowledge Excellent TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, NFS and networking knowledge and experience Excellent Exchange, LDAP, IIS and Apache experience Strong working knowledge of Database Administration – SQL Server, Mysql, MongoDB, Riak, CouchDB Working knowledge of enterprise storage technologies (SAN, NFS, ICSI, RAID) Expertise in network and OS security fundamentals Ability to identify and resolve performance bottlenecks in highly complex systems and drive performance optimizations Strong desire to learn new things Excellent verbal and written communication skills PATLive is a communications company that specializes in hosted telephony products and custom IVR services. With a 25 year track record of success and a team of over 100 talented employees, we’re a fun place to work with a culture that you won’t find at other companies (really, people consistently comment that PATLive is the best company they’ve ever worked for). Located in Florida’s capital city, Tallahassee, our hometown is known for its moderate climate, a not too big but not too small feel, beautiful canopy roads, college sports (FSU!), and close proximity to some of the world's most beautiful beaches.

item.title: Auto Repair & Tire Sale - Store Manager -
item.description: Details: Mavis Discount Tires, the nation's 5th largest independent tire dealer is growing, and has immediate openings for experienced Managers at various locations. Candidates with strong selling, customer relations and leadership skills are preferred. Experience in a fast paced chain restaurant or the retail sector is a plus. This position is oriented strongly toward selling tires and automotive repair services, managing the store team and working with customers on a routine basis. Candidates with knowledge of under-car repairs, tires and exhaust systems are preferred but not required for consideration. The person selected will be responsible for the day to day operation of the store assigned including managing, training and development of subordinates, inventory control, safety of personnel, attaining sales goals, compliance with Company processes and controls, scheduling personnel, monitoring performance, merchandising, taking phone calls and representing Mavis Tire in a professional manner, etc. Must be able to work a schedule that includes extended work days and weekend work. Mavis offers a competitive base salary plus weekly paid bonus program based on store performance. The Company provides paid vacations, sick pay and holiday pay plus offers health and dental insurance. A 401-k with Company match is offered plus Company paid uniforms are provided. Mavis Tire is an EEO employer.

item.title: Marketing / Sales Management / Entry Level / Paid Training Available
item.description: Details: Sales Management, and Marketing Representative Expanding at a tremendous rate, Happy Valley Marketing Solutions specializes in marketing and ad campaigns for some of the biggest names in Fortune 500. We are looking for enthusiastic, career minded, self-motivated individuals for the Sales, Management, and Marketing Representative position to work in a professional inside sales environment. Extensive management opportunities are available. Prior sales and marketing experience is welcome, but not necessary. If you are looking for a career with a top company, that still lets you be your own boss, do not pass this one by. **We do not participate in any of the following:** -NO door to door sales -NO business to business sales -NO telemarketing/telesales Happy Valley Marketing Solutions Offers: +Comprehensive and ongoing sales training +A guaranteed hourly pay PLUS Substantial first-year and residual commissions +Our Management Training Program which trains employees how to start and operate their own business +A positive environment with fellow business professionals that want your success +Superior sales support materials - Exciting incentives, awards, bonuses, and exotic trips (This year is CANCUN!!) Ask Yourself The Following Questions: 1) Where will I be in five years if I remain in my current job position? 2) Will I attain the financial security my family and I need? 3) Do I really enjoy my current work and lifestyle? 4) Have I ever thought of being "my own boss"? Happy Valley Marketing Solutions has your answers: If you are tired of working in the sale position with no chance of growth, if you are not making the income you deserve, or if you just don't love your career - this may be the one for you! Our Sales, Management, and Marketing Representative Professional: The main focus of this position is to promote our clients brand names by developing and supporting field marketing programs. You will work closely with other event marketing specialists, and corporate marketing and sales organizations to support sales activities (shows, events, campaigns, etc) and utilize your marketing expertise to help develop and execute marketing programs that will increase demand and drive revenue. Primary Duties: - Impacts sales results by developing, supporting and executing field marketing and segment activities. - Executes marketing campaigns and plans events depending on expertise. - Works with various corporate/field marketing managers to determine appropriate customized programs and strategies for various market segments. - Provides coordination and project management to ensure event success. - Publicizes event and works with Account Development to raise awareness and drive high levels of attendance and participation by targeted audience.

item.title: Contract to Hire Network Engineer Job Opportunity in Savannah, GA
item.description: Details: Modis has a Contract to Hire Network Engineer Job opportunity in Savannah, GA. We are looking for an experienced Network Engineer to fill a contract to hire opportunity in the Savannah, GA area. The Network Engineer Job responsibilities include: Designs and implements short- and long-term operational plans to make certain network capacity meet existing and future business requirements Develops, implements, and maintains policies and procedures for network resources Provides network performance statistics and reports to management Manages the operation of all data and voice software and hardware Ensures the security of all network systems according to industry best practices and governmental guidelines Conducts research, works with vendors and contractors, and attends vendor training in order to make recommendations and secure network products and services Maintains inventory of all network related equipment and associated maintenance contracts Provides 3rd level technical support for computer hardware, office equipment, and software applications Manages multiple projects effectively and efficiently through analysis and procedural implementation according to needs and deadline demands Aids in development of business continuity and disaster recovery plans, and maintains current knowledge of plan executables Responds to emergency network outages in accordance with business continuity and disaster recovery plans Participates in after-hours support as required Coordinates after-hours maintenance of network and server systems Ensures system availability, redundancy, security, and performance of equipment and function Establish and maintain standards for the networking devices, including routers, switches, etc. Work with internal and external customers to understand current and future requirements and develop scalable and cost efficient voice and data network design and operating solutions If you are interested in this or other Network Engineer Job opportunities in Savannah, GA please apply below and thank you for considering Modis.

item.title: Supplier Diversity Specialist
item.description: Details: Job Classification: Full-Time Regular About Us: USM, a wholly owned subsidiary of EMCOR Group, Inc., is a leading provider of essential facilities maintenance services, including interior and exterior services and electrical, mechanical and plumbing services, to national and regional commercial customers that typically maintain more than 100 sites across wide geographic areas. With its highly developed proprietary network of over 11,000 service partners, USM delivers consistent facilities maintenance services across a nationwide footprint for approximately 150 customers in over 75,000 locations in all 50 states and Canada. Job Title: Supplier Diversity Specialist Job Summary: The Supplier Diversity Specialist will have overall responsibility for the coordination of the Company's Supplier Diversity Program. The Specialist recommends proposal strategies to facilitate small business participation as subcontractors and suppliers; develops small business subcontracting plans; monitors and reports the Company's progress towards achieving supplier diversity/small business targets with emphasis on continuous improvement. Duties and Responsibilities: *Provides guidance and advice to the proposal, procurement and operations organizations within the Company on the development of relationships with and utilization of MWDVBE business. *Provides opportunities for suppliers to learn how to do business with the Company and develops and provides training and briefings to Company key management on MWVBE practices. *Supports business development initiatives. *Performs hands on data collection/entry, reporting & presentation development, in addition to producing metrics and training. *Plans, monitors and documents developmental activities. *Develops, coordinates and facilitates meetings, workshops, and procurement roundtables for the purposes of informing, training and collecting information. *Develops and implements sustainable practices to support our Supplier Diversity *Program, along with providing sourcing and contract activities *Assists with the development and implementation of the strategic plan and initiatives to strengthen our commitment with a specific focus on Minority & Women-owned Business Enterprises (MWBE), Disabled Business Enterprises and Veteran Business Enterprises. *Coordinates relationships with MWBE's. Provides a leadership role in planning and implementing outreach initiatives such as Supplier Diversity Open Houses and Trade Fairs, along with mentoring programs. *Develops new MWBEs through mentor/prot?g? programs and conducts seminars for diverse suppliers to learn how to do business with USM. *Able to analyze and report on customer data. *Any other duties as requested by management. Qualifications: *Undergraduate degree in a business or related field, or equivalent combination of experience and acquired skills. *Minimum of 3-5 years of supplier diversity experience *Contracts Experience *Negotiation Skills *Project Management skills *Proficiency with Microsoft Office especially in MS Excel *Certification in Supply Management preferred *Bi-lingual English/Spanish preferred *Ability to travel up to 25% We offer our employees a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package and are always looking for individuals with the talent and skills required to contribute to our continued growth and success. EOE M/F/Vet/Disabled Click here to apply online

item.description: Details: Job Classification: Full-Time Regular About Us: USM, a wholly owned subsidiary of EMCOR Group, Inc., is a leading provider of essential facilities maintenance services, including interior and exterior services and electrical, mechanical and plumbing services, to national and regional commercial customers that typically maintain more than 100 sites across wide geographic areas. With its highly developed proprietary network of over 11,000 service partners, USM delivers consistent facilities maintenance services across a nationwide footprint for approximately 150 customers in over 75,000 locations in all 50 states and Canada. As part of our annual hiring program for snow season, we have a need for On Demand/Part Time Seasonal Customer Service Representatives at our Norristown, PA headquarters from the fall of 2014 to early spring 2015. As a member of our On Demand team you will be contacted regularly to provide your availability for work, and we will do our best to match up your availability with our business need. Job Title: Seasonal Customer Service Representative Job Summary: These roles are seasonal in nature as well as to supplement full time, existing staff. It is expected the first date of availability will be mid to late Fall 2014 through late February 2015. Further, given our national scope, client reporting requirements and the unpredictability of snow, preference will be given to those candidates with the most flexibility in their availability. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: *Manage the work order process of planned or ?reactive? services to successful completion *Conduct advanced work order triage and troubleshooting via email, telephone or 3rd party communications *Be a trusted resource for both customers and vendors *Prepare customer invoices *Other tasks as required Qualifications: *Prior experience working in a high volume, fast paced customer service role. *Proficiency with MS Office (including but not limited to Excel and Word), and email required (Lotus Notes preferred). *Ability to reliably reach our offices in Norristown, PA, regardless of inclement weather conditions. *Demonstrated ability to problem solve, multitask and prioritize. *Excellent oral and written communication skills. *Experience in the trades, such as HVAC, Floor Care, Electrical, Plumbing, Roofing, Landscaping or building repair and maintenance a plus *Previous experience working with a work order management system a plus *Bi-lingual English/Spanish skills a plus *Undergraduate college degree or equivalent combination of experience and acquired skills. *Work hours for this position are subject to change; ample notice will be provided prior to any schedule changes. We offer our employees a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package and are always looking for individuals with the talent and skills required to contribute to our continued growth and success. EOE M/F/Vet/Disabled

item.description: Details: Apply NOW for immediate consideration for a FULL TIME ENTRY LEVEL position. Better Business Consultants Inc. is currently hiring for entry level individuals with experience in the customer service and sales industries for an account management position. item.title: Alarm Installation Technician
item.description: Details: If you have low-voltage installation experience and a positive, customer-oriented personality, join our team at Alliance Security and earn a fantastic income! In business since 2003 and servicing 26 states, we are a national home automation and security company based in Warwick, RI. Due to rapid expansion, we are currently seeking Security Technicians. You will install our alarm systems at customer locations while also identifying opportunities to upgrade customer service packages. Our top Technicians earn as much as $70,000 a year. We offer a fun and dynamic work environment as well as the flexibility to work either full- or part-time. You will receive paid training and certifications and will find plenty of room for career advancement as our company continues to grow. No degree is necessary! If this sounds like the kind of job you've been looking for, and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!

item.description: Details: The Executive Assistant is responsible for completing all executive and administrative work for the company executives. Performs varied administrative office duties, including but not limited to: greeting guests upon entry into the office, maintaining schedules and appointments, answering and responding to all office phone calls and emails, maintaining office records, files or documents, providing administrative support to executives, summarizing any office reports and information to provide clear communication, assists with and coordinates executive appointments and schedules. Job Duties: Executes a variety of office administrative support to company executives Greet all office visitors or guests upon entry into the office Receiving, screening and responding to all office telephone calls and emails Reviewing all incoming mail and correspondence Scheduling appointments and meetings while maintaining the executive calendar Maintaining any office record-keeping systems Maintains and updates any office databases and spreadsheets using MS Word, MS Excel, and MS Access. Assists with the development and creation of MS PowerPoint presentations for executives Prepares any office reports, documentation and agendas while keeping all sensitive information confidential Summarize reports, documents and any information needed executives Arranges travel arrangements for executives when needed Completes errands off site out of the office when needed for the executives Any other office duties that may be assigned

item.title: Weatherization Assessor
item.description: Details: COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP of KERN Energy Program Assessor Disclaimer: Job descriptions are written as a representative list of the ADA essential duties performed by a job class. They cannot include nor are they intended to include all duties performed by all positions occupying a class. Salary Range: FLSA Status: Date Approved: 07/01/2013 SUMMARY : Responsible for assessing, diagnosing and gathering information about measure feasibility and materials needed to weatherize a dwelling. SUPERVISION RECEIVED : Receives supervision from Weatherization Coordinator SUPERVISION EXERCISED : None DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES : Disclaimer - This list is meant to be representative, not exhaustive. Some incumbents may not perform all the duties listed or may perform related duties as assigned. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. A. Essential Job Specific Duties: 1. Conduct on-site assessment of dwelling to determine which program measures are feasible to install. 2. Check and measure attic floor and walls to determine if insulation is needed. 3. Measure square footage and provide a drawing of the house. 4. Perform pre-weatherization Combustion Appliance Safety (CAS) testing. 5. When required, Blower door and duck blaster diagnostics shall be conducted to measure shell leakage and duct systems leakage. 6. Provide a justification for replacing higher-cost items such as and document client’s file. 7. Provide mandatory photo documentation when replacement of windows, doors, and appliances are recommended. 8. Determine if mechanical ventilation is required. 9. Educate the client on the pros and cons of mechanical ventilation. 10. Attend mandatory trainings on-line and offsite. 11. Act as liaison between Federal, State, Utility funding sources and vendors. 12. Perform other duties as required B. Other Job Specific Duties: 1. Attends all meetings, trainings, and conferences as assigned. 2. Maintains safe and functional work environment. 3. Work alternative hours as required, including nights and weekends. 4. Is proactive in the program effort to recruit and enroll families that qualify for Partnership programs. 5. Performs any other like duties as assigned. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS : The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required to satisfactorily perform the essential duties and responsibilities. Knowledge of: Agency policies and procedures Applicable federal, state, and local laws, codes, and regulations Departmental policies and procedures Modern office practices, methods, procedures and equipment including computers Word processing, spreadsheet, database, and other related software applications Ability to: Ability to deal with conceptual matters Ability to plan, organize, allocate, and control substantial resources. Ability to communicate effectively Good interpersonal skills. Willingness to attend evening and weekend meetings Effectively present program to the general public. Establish professional working relationships with staff, agencies and parents. Bilingual language fluency (Spanish/English) fluency highly desirable EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE : The following requirements generally demonstrate possession of the minimum requisite knowledge and ability necessary to perform the duties of the position. A. Minimum Qualifications High School diploma or GED certificate required. Any equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be acceptable. Experience 1. At least two (2) years experience in weatherization, general home repair and/or construction. 2. Knowledge of principles and methods of home weatherization. 3. Ability to maintain effective working relationships with program staff, public and private 4. Must have ability to Establish and maintain a cooperative working relationship with co-workers. Communicate effectively. Manage time effectively for maximum productivity. Bilingual (English/Spanish) capabilities desirable. OTHER REQUIREMENTS • Possession of a valid California Driver’s License and State automobile insurance, and acceptable driving record substantiated by a DMV printout. • Completion of a fingerprint, physical and substance abuse screening upon offer of employment. • Travel is required in this position to various homes and worksites located throughout Kern County. An agency vehicle is provided for agency travel. • At times, may require bending and stooping twisting, reaching above and below shoulder level, crawling, kneeling, climbing, overhead reaching, lifting, and prolonged standing, sitting and driving. • During installations and servicing, position may require working in dark cramped quarters and in conditions where you may be exposed to dust, sawdust, pollens, fiberglass and cellulose insulation. WORK ENVIRONMENT : The work environment characteristics described are representative of those an employee encounters in performing the essential functions of this job. • Work is primarily performed indoors. • Noise level is quiet to moderately quiet. • Hazards are minimal.

item.title: Reporting Solutions Analyst
item.description: Details: The Reporting Solutions Analyst is a direct hire opportunity. Responsible for developing and maintaining reporting and budgeting analytical systems. Liaison with assigned customer groups under the Essbase Center of Excellence model. Responsible for primary assigned customer group and secondary (back-up) customer group. Support all business planning efforts that use Dodeca. This includes design, update, and creation of new and existing templates, databases and reports, including integration with between financial services and other lines of business’ business plan templates. Develop and maintain database and reporting structures and process flows. Provide reporting and budgeting solutions to management

item.title: SQL DBA
item.description: Details: TEKsystems has an immediate need for a SQL DBA for a large financial client in Charlotte, NC. If you are looking for long term Direct Hire opportunities, please apply directly for more details! Responsibilities: * Act as point of contact and SQL Server technical resource for application/business partners. * Installation of new SQL Server Instances and Upgrades. * Migrate Instances/Databases from one machine to other. * Run diagnostic tools to identify database performance bottlenecks, and take appropriate corrective actions to improve database performance. Work with development teams to tune SQL queries. * Troubleshoot SQL Server performance and non-performance related issues either independently or in conjunction with other DBAs. * Provide solutions to development teams when proposed solutions do not comply with architectural, configuration, performance, or security guidelines. * Manage backup/recovery for SQL Server instances * Management of database and resource capacity planning. * Implement and enforce database security based upon best practice, SOX regulations, and company policies * Provide support on all stages of database implementation and/or database related deployments * Provide recommendations for process improvements * Participate in project meetings, as necessary, to understand application and database requirements. * Willingness to learn the business and new technology. * Provide after hours support as required Experience and Skills Required: * 12+ years experience with SQL Server 2000,2005,2008 R1, 2008 R2 ** Experience with SQL Server High Availability technologies * Experience with HP PolyServe a strong plus * Prefer BSCS or MIS related degree * MCDBA and/or MCITP: Database Administration certifications a plus * Experience in managing Windows 2000/2003 Servers * Experience with Windows 2008 Server a plus * Experience with DTS, SSIS, and/or other ETL applications * Familiarity with SSRS * Familiarity with data/database encryption technologies (data at rest, data in memory, and data in transit) * Experience with Oracle a plus. * Familiarity with SUN, Linux, and/or HPUX Operating Systems a plus General Skills: * Excellent documentation, communication and soft skills * Strong organization and time management skills * Team-oriented work ethic that includes willingness to help others * Able to work independently and share results of assigned projects with team members About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Sanitation Technician
item.description: Details: Job Title: Sanitation Technician Location: Kent, WA About Us Real Foods, a division of Taylor Farms, is a Food Processing facility located in Kent, WA. Our company services the retail and food service industry offering a variety of value added items including but not limited to ready to eat green and pasta salads, dips, quiches, veggie trays and fruit trays. We are a growing business that currently employs over 400 individuals. We are searching for a qualified candidate that is looking for the ability to learn and grow within our organization. If you are a dynamic individual with Sanitation Technician experience we invite you to apply with our team today! Summary of Responsibilities: Sanitation Technicians are responsible for cleaning an industrial kitchen and food processing facility. Technicians are responsible for the daily sanitation of floors, dishes, stoves, broilers, mixers, coolers, etc. This position works closely with the Quality Control department to ensure all USDA and HACCP requirements are met on a nightly basis. The Sanitation Technician p osition requires worker to perform any combination of the following tasks to maintain sanitary work area of food production facility: Cleans floor of production area, by removing garbage, moving floor mats, picking up food items, and tearing empty cardboard boxes. Uses high pressure water hose to pre-rinse all machines, tables and work surfaces from top to bottom. Soap clean and scrub all work surfaces, machines, and implements using nylon brushes and abrasive cleaning pads. Rinses all work surfaces and equipment. Spray sanitizer on equipment, work surfaces, and floor. Cleans and sanitizes barrels, utensils, and pans using the same process. Cleans and removes debris from drains and drain pits. Empty debris from garbage cans into large totes. Use pallet-jack (electric or manual) to move tote to the garbage disposal area. Use forklift to dump totes. Responsible for sweeping floor of garbage disposal area, and hosing down forklift, and equipment in garbage disposal area. Essential Functions of the Prep Cook Position: Must be able to stand for a minimum of 2 hours to work at each processing station. Able to work in cold a refrigerated environment of 34 -37 degrees. Must be able to lift a minimum of 25lbs. frequently. Processing food according to HACPP regulations. Cut food items to recipe specification. Weigh servings to meet product weight requirement. Pack items in designated containers or bags per customer order. Report discrepancies to supervisors. Prepare ingredients needed for recipes of food service items. Master functions specific to food service items in preparation requirements. Safely use equipment as necessary in preparation of food service items. Safely and efficiently use knives and other utensils necessary to complete preparation of food service items. Read a thermometer correctly and accurately. Operate all functions of position alone and without assistance if necessary. Accurately count and weigh in all incoming product and compare to order sheet; notify supervisor of any discrepancies. Check to insure quality of food product (ie: freshness, color, shape, temperature, and proper size specifications). Accurately store, label, and date all incoming food product to insure maximum shelf life. Alert supervisor of any product that needs attention due to possible spoilage. Insure all food storage areas are properly secured and locked. Maintain a clean and orderly work area to ensure safety and insure proper sanitation guidelines are followed. Other duties as assigned. *** The above guidelines are merely a general outline of the present needs of this position. We are in a dynamic industry, therefore these guidelines may change.
