item.title: Senior Director, Facility Management
item.description: Details: • Responsible for all areas of facility management / maintenance, procurement, and engineering relating to Petco Park’s fundamental operating systems including but not limited to mechanical, electrical, plumbing, HVAC, elevator/escalator, life safety, building management control system, security and audio/video systems. • Operates and maintains the facility in an efficient, economic and environmentally-friendly / sustainable manner by formulating mission-critical vision and operating plans, procedures and protocols while determining performance expectations, prioritizing preventative maintenance and repair activities and developing, implementing and managing operating and capital budgets with the concurrence of Vice President, Ballpark Operations. • Effectiveness, efficiency and overall success will be measured monthly based on a series of mutually developed reports. • Recruit, hire, manage and supervise the Directors of Facility Services, Engineering, a team of operating engineers and painters and their associated responsibilities. • Responsible for the oversight of all annual general and preventative maintenance for the facility and all associated equipment and fundamental systems to supply and operate the facility with maximum effectiveness while presenting established fan service expectations. • Evaluate, prioritize and communicate work activities with the Director, Engineering, in addition to effectively and efficiently scheduling staff for baseball & non-baseball events and during normal work days. Look for every opportunity to align work responsibilities and labor scheduling for maximum efficacy. • Act as owner’s representative and general contractor for selected capital projects and improvements which includes, but is not limited to, responsibility for forecasting, budgeting (acquiring multiple bids whenever possible), permitting and inspections, selecting and managing sub-contractors and vendors, oversight of construction schedule and progress, commissioning and updating as-builts. • Communicate with manufacturers, suppliers and vendors to ensure the proper published preventative maintenance procedures, warranties and O & M manuals are received with each piece of equipment purchased. • Monitor utility usage throughout the year and initiate programs that can be implemented through the Building Management System or presented to the Vice President, Ballpark Operations for funding approval, in order to maximize efficiency and reduce operating expense, without compromising service or safety. • Responsible for oversight and administering programs that meet safety and environmental standards as stated in the Memorandum of Understanding between the San Diego Padres and the City of San Diego that includes Pollution Prevention Plan in coordination of the Environmental Health Coalition. Other programs include Integrated Pest Management Plan, OSHA and Hazmat standards and requirements. • Represents the Club in a positive and professional manner at all times. • Other duties as assigned ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: • Directs fundamental systems management, maintenance and operational programs to ensure maximum life and reliability of all Ballpark mechanical systems, which include, but are not limited to: o Plumbing o Electrical o HVAC (including auxiliary equipment) • Directs general ballpark maintenance, including: o Door, ceiling, and floor repair o Structural repair o Waterproofing repair o Painting o Other miscellaneous area • Provides general oversight of engineering staff. • Monitors and approves time sheets for administrative and engineering staff. • Purchases parts and supplies according to company policy and apportioned guidelines as directed by the Vice-President, Ballpark Operations. • Establishes inventory control programs with appropriate parts, stocking levels and accurate and timely records of receipts and issues. • Evaluates, recommends, and monitors all sub-contractors. • Prepares annual budget proposal, monitors and explains variances from approved budget to actual expenses/income. • Monitors building energy use, produces reports on a periodic basis, proposes and maintains energy management programs. • Maintains required CalOSHA and Workers’ Compensation safety and accident reports on engineering personnel and facilities. • Monitors all requirements levied by the City of San Diego, State of California and Federal Government pertaining to Indoor Air Quality, Life Safety, American with Disabilities Act and any other propositions affecting the Ballpark and make compliance and implementation recommendations as required by the Vice-President , Ballpark Operations and the Padres. • Monitors current and historical preventative maintenance records on Ballpark equipment. • Maintains emergency equipment in good working order and perpetual inventory of emergency equipment. • Establishes and implements procedures for timely response to customer, patron and Ballpark work orders. • Initiates any necessary insurance claims on HVAC and other fundamental systems equipment. • Controls engineering activities and Ballpark mechanical systems to include fire and life safety in emergency situations. • Acts as a team member and promotes cooperation with all employees of the fundamental systems management staff. • Complies with all written Padres company policies. The San Diego Padres are an Equal Opportunity Employer . 11/2014

item.title: Admissions Assistant
item.description: Details: JOB DESCRIPTION ADMISSIONS COORDINATOR PURPOSE OF YOUR POSITION The primary purpose of your position is to assist in the planning, organizing, implementing, evaluating and overall operations of all admissions in accordance with current federal, state and local standards, guidelines, and regulations that govern our facility, and as may be directed by the Director of Admissions. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY As the Admissions Coordinator you are responsible and accountable to carry out your assigned duties and report directly to the Director of Admissions. JOB FUNCTION Every effort has been made to make your job description as complete as possible. However, it in no way states or implies that these are the only duties you will be required to perform. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from your position. The position includes other duties deemed appropriate and assigned by the Director of Admissions and/or the Administrator. WORKING CONDITIONS Works in office areas as well as throughout the facility. Sits, stands, bends, lifts, and moves intermittently during working hours. Is subject to frequent interruptions. Is involved with residents, personnel, visitors, government agencies, etc., under all conditions and circumstances. Is subject to hostile and emotionally upset residents, family members, etc. Communicates with the medical staff, nursing services, and other department supervisors. Works beyond normal working hours, weekends and holidays, in other positions temporarily when necessary. Scheduled hours may change to meet facility needs. 5A CORPORATE COMPLIANCE Fully complies with all federal and state laws and standards of ethical and professional conduct applicable to their position. Knowledge about laws and regulations relating to job responsibilities, e.g., EEO, OSHA, patient rights, fraud/abuse laws. Is consistently truthful and accurate in all written and verbal communications. Demonstrates adherence to employee code of ethics and conduct. (Refer to personnel policies) Exhibits ethical/moral responsibility in problem resolution and decision making. Required documentation/record keeping is accurate, complete and timely. Reports suspected violations of federal and state laws and any types of misconduct to facility administrator, or other appropriate staff member. 5C

item.title: Retail Cosmetics Sales - Counter Manager Shiseido, Full Time: Wauwatosa, WI - Macy’s Mayfair Mall
item.description: Details: Overview:With a role as a Counter Manager in the Macy's Cosmetics Department, you will be responsible for supervising the complete operations of a cosmetics line, including developing a team of highly productive Beauty Advisors. Additionally, you will make one-on-one connections with customers to learn their sense of beauty and style, develop your artistic side through customer consultation and make-up and product application, and attain a sense of accomplishment when your skills combine with your passion for beauty to reach personal and team sales goals. Performs other duties as assigned. The summary below may not include all the essential functions and qualifications for this position. For more information, we encourage you to review the complete job description by clicking here. Essential Functions:- Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration - Recruit, train, coach, motivate and develop new and incumbent associates on company policies and procedures, product knowledge, and personal/department productivity goals - Alert Sales Manager of needs and concerns of the business and staff; Communicate regularly with vendors, planners, distributors, and buyers regarding stock needs, customer preferences, and special events - Develop and implement business-driving events and ensure proper execution to achieve counter productivity goals - Review and analyze business performance of daily, weekly, monthly, seasonal, and annual sales results - Regular, dependable attendance & punctuality Qualifications: Education/Experience: High school diploma or equivalent. A minimum of one year of previous selling experience required, preferably in Cosmetics. Previous supervisory experience preferred Communication Skills: Ability to read, write, and interpret general business reports and labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products. Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers, vendors, buyers, peers, and all levels of management Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator and calculate percentages and ratios. Must be able to make change in American monetary units Other Skills: Superior organizational and time management skills. Must be able to build relationships and influence others. Ability to set and achieve goals. Ability to multi -task in a fast-paced environment. Must possess a strong sense of urgency and a thirst for knowledge. Must be able to lead by example Work Hours: Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, holidays, and sales events, based on department and store/company needs This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an EqualOpportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.title: Financial Reporting Specialist
item.description: Details: General Function: Responsible for the supervision of the financial reporting teamincluding month-end consolidation of domestic and gloabl operations, external reporting in an SEC-like environment and ad hoc responsibilities related to tax, internal reporting requests and technical accounting. Essential Duties & Responsibilities: Supervise Month-end consolidations process Team with local accounting staff in foreign locations to obtain, load and consolidate results on a monthly basis Lead the consolidation process and preparation of monthly internal financial statements and provide thought leadership regarding improvements to deliverables; assist in performance and documentation of high level results of operations narrative Coordinate schedules with Manager and Sr Analyst to ensure appropriate staffing coverage of month end process Supervise Quarterly Earnings release process and maintenance of investor relations (IR) website Maintain primary responsibility for preparation of full financial statements and MD&A on a quarterly basis (done within Workiva / WebFilings) Manage data request list for documentation required from other departments in preparation process; assign tasks to department Sr Analyst or other departments as necessary Serve as primary liaison with external audit firm (Big 4) for financial statement and other requests as necessary; prepare quarterly support binder for 10-Q / K-like documents Prepare initial draft of earnings call script and prepare earnings call binders for attendees Schedule earnings calls and communicate with investors and internal attendees Monitor the IR website and Inbox and work with Manager and Corporate Controller on developing responses Supervise tax compliance Support data requests from external tax advisors (Big 4) for regular preparation of taxable income estimates and tax filings Prepare city / local filings as needed and respond to surve ys and requests for data as appropriate; coordinate with external advisors as necessary Assist and participate in initiatives and special projects relatedto the respective area: Liaise with other Accounting and Finance groups to ensure effective cross functional communication between departments and be a point person for projects Perform research and write memos / create presentations on technical accounting / one-off accounting issues as they arise Become the system and department expert on all systems used

item.title: IT Finance Systems Analyst -- Global Development
item.description: Details: Job is located in Morristown, NJ. Colgate-Palmolive's IT Finance Systems Analyst plays an integral role in developing, leading, and maintaining global financial systems that support global business processes. Specific responsibilities include but not limited to: Understanding concepts of business processes, industry practices, and technology in the area of Finance Leading and managing technology developments utilizing SAP including HANA modeling, SAP Planning Application Kit (PAK), SAP BPC, SAP EPM, SAP Analysis Office, SAP ECC (Finance & Controlling) Collaborating and partnering with SAP on co-innovation projects, solution design and program services Interacting with Finance business partners in global project teams to understand business processes and gather business requirements Teaming up with cross-functional categories in Global IT to understand integrated business planning systems requirements, develop technical specifications, and design IT solutions Developing global bundle IT solutions, coding and testing application programs, maintaining and testing data and documentation applying Agile development methodology Managing and collaborating IT solution development and applications support with IT Shared Service Organizations and SAP consultants

item.title: Practice Manager - Medical Office
item.description: Details: PRACTICE MANAGER for Medical Office SPECIALTY CARE/ ENT, HEARING, AND VISION INSTITUTE OF ILLINOIS LOCATIONS: Elgin, Barrington Seeking an experienced, highly motivated, and resourceful Practice Manager for a successful, busy, growing ENT/Ophthalmology group with 4 doctors and 2 offices- Barrington and Elgin, and soon to be opening a third in Hoffman Estates. This position will be responsible for oversight of the operational and administrative functions associated with the practice. Accountable for ensuring smooth and efficient operations that facilitate the delivery of the state-of-the-art highest quality care for our patients. The successful candidate will be expected to formulate and implement a strategic plan consistent with the practice’s goals. Additionally, he/she will be expected to contribute to and foster a professional environment consisting of professional staff with positive attitudes. Must be highly organized and able to run the various departments within the organization, ENT, Hearing, and Vision Institute. Must spearhead meetings and proactively and independently ensure that the practice runs smoothly and efficiently, including accounts receivable, accounts payable, shipping and inventory, purchasing, budgeting, etc. Must be proficient with quick books and excel and prepare weekly and monthly reports. Create budgets and run business within the budget. The successful candidate will manage all aspects of the practice including those related to patient care, human resources, finances and payroll, coding, and billing among others. Qualified candidates must possess proven understanding and demonstrated success with fiscal management of a medical practice and the components of revenue cycle - specifically registration, billing and collection functions. The billing responsibilities are managed in collaboration with the company’s in-house billing services. The Practice Manager will be accountable for personnel management, including schedules, payroll, hiring, training, and performance evaluations for staff at the three locations. Additional responsibilities include maintaining provider credentialing and other administrative needs for the group. Also responsible for ensuring staff compliance with HIPAA, OSHA and other regulations and overseeing meaningful use measures. The Practice Manager will also be intricately involved in setting up the new office, getting competitive bids for equipment, hiring and training new staff. He/she will also be responsible for updating marketing materials and instituting marketing plans to continue to increase the practice growth. REQUIREMENTS: Minimum 5 years practice management experience at a large or multi-specialty medical practice Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in business or medical administration Extensive experience with Microsoft Office Suite of products including advanced Microsoft Word and Excel skills, and Microsoft Outlook Understanding of medical terminology, experience with EMR a must, e-CW is a plus Expert level experience with QuickBooks/ accounts payable,fiscal management Thorough understanding of ICD-9, billing, and accounts receivable Familiarity with health care regulations, HIPAA, OSHA, and meaningful use measures Self-directed, operate independently and strong management/leadership skills Excellent written and verbal communication, analytical and problem-solving skills Must be highly organized, understand priorities and possess strong attention to detail Overseeing marketing duties, building relationships with referring doctors A positive disposition and strong HR/personnel management skills Local travel between offices required (within 25-30 minutes of each other) Full-time salaried position with a long-term career track Highly Competitive compensation with health, dental, and life insurance and participation in 401-K plan and pension plan and a vacation package. About Specialty Care Institute: This is a busy multi-specialty practice with a group of 4 doctors who are compassionate about offering the highest quality of care to their patients. We have 2 offices and are looking to open a third location. This is a great opportunity for an experienced hard working office manager to really take this to the next level. It is a highly rewarding on an upwards career path with excellent salary and benefits including paid vacation, health, dental, and life insurance, and 401-K and pension plans. Please write "Practice Manager" in your email with cover letter.

Previous cosmetic or fragrance sales experience a plus Communication Skills Ability to read, write, and interpret labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products. Able to use a calculator. Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios. Must be able to make change using American Monetary units. Other Skills Superior organizational and time management skills. Must be able to build relationships and influence others. Ability to set and achieve goals. Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Must possess a strong sense of urgency and a thirst for knowledge. Must be able to lead by example. item.title: Controller - Real Estate Property Management
item.description: Details: Well established, small commercial property management and development company located in West Los Angeles looking for an experienced Controller to join our team. This is a great opportunity, with room for future advancement for someone who is extremely detail-oriented, organized and self-motivated. Company established for over 40+ years with Creative Office Spaces with large well-known high profile clients on the Westside. The Controller is responsible for the day-to-day accounting functions that are required to support the company, including preparation of reports for the field personnel and corporate management. The Controller will work closely with senior management to add measurable value to the organization from an accounting and operational perspective. He or she will cover a broad range of duties with the ability to make an impact and will assist in driving the performance of the company in a broad range of areas. This position is also responsible for assisting with the strategic planning, development and execution of all financial and IT activities required to support the growth and profitability. This position will report directly to the Executive Vice President and Asset Manager. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Responsibilities include oversight of the financial health of the company, budgeting, planning, effective financial controls, annual audit, cash management, financing, review of security investment portfolio, maintain General Ledger accounts, regulatory compliance and reporting, and ensuring IT systems are maximized to support all business activities. Main Responsibilities: • Responsible for all finance and accounting operations. • Work and coordinate with employees in the department to ensure deliverables are met • Responsible for the preparation and accuracy of accounting/financial reports including but not limited to; Month End Close, Month End reporting, Annual budget creation, consolidated financial statements, cash flows, operational reports, profitability analysis, variance analysis, Balance Sheet reconciliations, CAM reconciliations, trend analysis, amortization of loan and lease commissions; straight-line rent (FAS 13) calculations, assignment of CAM, taxes, insurance, management fees and CAM reserves, determine cost allocations for properties and job cost, lease summaries, loan draws, loan covenants; coordinate and execute escrow documents for sale and purchase of properties, general ledger, fixed assets, annual property tax returns, operating budget and forecasting, ROI analysis, profit and loss and balance sheets. • System administrator of accounting software: Yardi Voyager; Responsible for set-up of (General Ledger accounts, Banking, Property codes, Job codes, Cost Category codes; Property List for consolidations of business units; Tenant, Vendor, CAM set-up; rebuild account tree; • Responsible for Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable processes through review of lease agreements, Construction, Consultant and Maintenance contracts, purchase orders, and invoices. • Assist with operational activities including the preparation of margin analysis for overhead cost, inter-company transactions, cost reduction activities, financial and scenario modeling and due diligence in business development projects, compiling research when needed, on key macroeconomic market indicators, trends and specific market analysis • Coordinate with IT activities in cooperation with Corporate IT and outside consultants. This includes evaluating and maximizing benefits from the current systems, and driving improvements and innovations. • Ad hoc reports as required • Presentations as required • Team member for the development of the annual and multi-year strategic plans • Recommend and assist with development programs and performance objectives • Interface with 200+ Tenants and build relationships with the financial institutions Salary is commensurate with experience, and annual bonus based on performance and company profitability. Benefits include paid parking, medical insurance vaca tion time.

item.title: Receptionist/Administrative Assistant
item.description: Details: Receptionist / Admin Assistant Carmel, IN $10.50/hour temp to hire Mon – Fri: 8am – 4:30pm Our client is a leading specialty health insurance provider with over 34 million members nationwide. They are now seeking a Receptionist / Admin Assistant to join the Claims Department. If you’re a dedicated and organized administrator or support professional looking for a new challenge, this is a superb opportunity to work for a recognized Best Employer and Fastest Growing Business that supports the professional growth of their employees. Joining a friendly team as the welcoming face of the Fitness Claims Office, you will play an integral role in the day-to-day running of the organization. As a Receptionist / Admin Assistant, you will be the first point of contact for telephone calls and visitors, answering queries and provide vital administrative support throughout the office. Fielding incoming calls to our client’s office, you will transfer calls, relay messages and prepare incoming claims for batch processing via the electronic database system requiring strong computer skills and attention to detail in a production environment.

item.title: Help Desk Technician - 2nd Shift
item.description: Details: Envera Systems, is a successful and growing firmspecializing in applying leading edge technology to provide remote guard basedsecurity solutions to gated communities. We are seeking a proven technicalprofessional with a strong work ethic and sense of ownership to serve in therole of level 2 help desk technician. This individual will have 4+ years of 2 nd shift work experience to join the team working Tuesday – Saturday 3PM toMidnight, with rotational on-call. This position comes with virtually unlimitedpotential for upward mobility for a highly motivated self-starter and is basedin our Central Station / NOC, which is located in Sarasota, FL. Team members at Envera Systems experience afast-paced, demanding, and supportive entrepreneurial environment thatemphasizes mutual respect and effective communication. The vast majority of ourwork involves end-users. As such, Envera Systems team members must enjoy andexcel in the area of interpersonal communication. Job Description: Help Desk / NOC Technicians are part of a teamthat is responsible for supporting the information technology infrastructureand the end users of our client organizations. They operate in various modesdepending on the need at the time: Help Desk – Responding to phone calls and email requests for assistance from external customers. Inter Office Support – Responding to phone calls and email requests for assistance from internal customers. NOC – Remote monitoring and assisting internal Technicians with devices at various external locations. Project / Integration Services – Implementing new technology for clients – usually as a member of a project team.

item.title: Assistant Production Coordinator
item.description: Details: Assistant Production Coordinator Needed (Fontana) Granite Counter Top Subcontractor is in need of an exceptional individual with superior customer service skills, who is computer savvy (intermediate knowledge of the Microsoft programs) to assist in our Production Department: SKILLS: • Exceptional customer service skills a MUST. Individual must be willing to go above and beyond to assist our customers. • Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft programs, with an emphasis on Excel and Word. • Two years' experience as an Assistant Production Coordinator, but we are willing to train the right candidate. • Accounting software knowledge is a plus. • CAD (computer aided drafting) experience is a plus. • Fast learner with a friendly and helpful demeanor, who is able to multi-task, follows procedures and is a team player. • Bi-lingual (English/Spanish) preferred but not required. DUTIES , including but not limited to: • Ensure client's needs are met in a timely and cost effective manner. • Create jobs and schedules in the system for the template, fabricators, and installers; taking into consideration the customer's expectations. Maintain communications with all departments. • Ensure project documents are complete, current and filed properly. • Responsible for tracking project change orders, including approval and/or order to proceed. Also, update the schedule accordingly as agreed with owners and project managers. • Participate in team meetings to coordinate multiple projects. • Keep project teams and others informed about the project status and any issues that may impact client relations. • Other duties as may be assigned. WORK ENVIRONMENT: • Fast paced, high pressure, deadline oriented environment; must be able to handle several projects at once. • Occasional lifting up to 20 pounds. • Must be able to sit at work station for extended periods of time. BENEFITS: • Five (5) days paid vacation after one year of continuous employment. • Three (3) days sick pay per year after one year of continuous employment. • Six paid holidays after completion of 90 day probationary period. • Medical, Dental, Aflac, Vision and Chiropractic care available. Applicant must be able to pass a background check and drug screening.

item.title: Sales Account Executive - Marketing Sales! Paid Training
item.description: Details: ***IMMEDIATE START*** ***NO EXPERIENCE*** ***ENTRY LEVEL*** Are you looking for a career that gets you EXCITED to come to work every day? Are you looking for a CAREER rather than just a job? Welcome to ATTIDZA CONSULTING GROUP, where no 2 days are the same! Our sales and marketing firm has huge opportunities to expand in 2014! OUR FOCUS: Attidza Consulting Group performs marketing and sales promotions with client acquisition for the largest, most reputable, telecommunications company in America. With a rapidly growing customer base, we are in the midst of a major expansion. Servicing a high volume of our clients’ customers, we currently have several immediate openings available in the following areas: Entry Level Sales/Promotions Marketing Potential to move into Management Positions College internship Opportunities Benefits Offered OUR CULTURE: Attidza Consulting Group has a friendly, family-oriented environment. Each week the office strives to build and maintain relationships between owners and employee through weekly team building activities. The office also participates in quarterly philanthropy and community service. We are known for our creativity and innovation, we pride ourselves on being unique, forward thinking and fun company. When you’re a part of our family, you’ll be a part of the “WILL DO" atmosphere that makes our company unlike others. We love dealing with people. This job involves face to face sales to new business prospects. Pay base upon performance.

item.title: IT Business Process Analyst
item.description: Details: Colgate-Palmolive's Global Information Technology organization invites applications for the position of Business Process Analyst, Global Technology (GT). This is an exciting opportunity to work on a top corporate strategic initiative and develop leading edge technology and tools to bring innovative products to market. Apply conceptual knowledge of business processes and technology to solve complex business process and procedural problems. Participate in projects of a cross-functional nature, and deliver/negotiate SAP processes and applications to customers. Identify and assess new technology and concepts that can add value to the business. Ensure appropriate subsidiary involvement in project teams to build ownership for solutions. Act as regional or global advisor for most complex processes within the IT function. Manage and/or perform the design, testing, implementation & documentation of SAP systems in according to agreed timelines, business requirements and global standards. Liaise/act as the technical analyst to ensure the new functional configuration is transported into production environments without unintended impact on business units.

item.title: JUNIOR MARKETING ASSISTANT - ADVANCEMENT OPPORTUNITIES
item.description: Details: ENTRY LEVEL MANAGEMENT / MARKETING / ADVERTISING / SALES / PROMOTION Junior Marketing Associate- MARKETING / ADVERTISING EXPANSION Learn Marketing and Client Relations from the one who started the business! DFW Consultants, Inc is seeking a Junior Marketing Associate for our firm providing marketing, advertising and consulting services to large corporations on local and national levels. This position would work closely with Marketing Specialists to identify and develop new streams of revenue for clients through UNIQUE advertising strategies including sales, promotions, and innovative marketing solutions. The Junior Marketing Associate would create and execute these campaigns and convey the promotions to each respective target market within a dynamic team environment. www.dfwconsultantsinc.com MAJOR RESPONSIBILITY AREAS: • Implementation of marketing plans, including product positioning, campaign strategies, market strategy insights • Discovery of strategic business opportunities through cross function collaboration with sales, HR, etc. • Marketing opportunity for revenue • Provide product/service support in order to establish proper channels of information and communication. • Responsible for branding, advertising, trade shows, company events and promotional collateral • Work with management on projects dealing with media relations, business communications, success stories

item.title: Macy's Seasonal Cosmetics Beauty Advisor - Springfield, MO - Battlefield
item.description: Details: JOB OVERVIEW:With a role in the Macy's Cosmetics Department, you will have the opportunity to help others look their best every day. You'll make one-on-one connections with customers to learn their sense of beauty and style, develop your artistic side through customer consultation and make-up and product application, and attain a sense of accomplishment when your skills combine with your passion for beauty to reach personal and team sales goals. Previous cosmetics experience is nice to have, but is not required to begin a career in beauty at Macy's. Performs other duties as assigned. The summary below may not include all the essential functions and qualifications for this position. For more information, we encourage you to review the complete job description by clicking here. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:- Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration - Partner with Sales Manager and Counter Manager to identify business driving opportunities and stock needs - Develop a repeat-business customer base in order to regularly communicate: upcoming events, new merchandise receipts and product replenishment to increase incremental sales - Participate in pre-selling and sales driving events as well as processing of new receipts, damages, testers, and return to vendors (RTVs)- Attend product training classes and seminars - Regular, dependable attendance & punctuality QUALIFICATIONS: Education /Experience High school diploma or equivalent. Previous cosmetic or fragrance sales experience a plus Communication Skills Ability to read, write, and interpret labels including warnings and ingredient lists on products. Ability to effectively communicate with and present information to customers, vendors, buyers, peers, and all levels of management Mathematical Skills Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator. Must be able to calculate percentages and ratios. Must be able to make change using American Monetary units. Other Skills Superior organizational and time management skills. Must be able to build relationships and influence others. Ability to set and achieve goals. Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment. Must possess a strong sense of urgency and a thirst for knowledge. Must be able to lead by example. Work Hours Ability to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, holidays, and sales events, based on department and store/company needs. This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, Macy's, Inc. reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. Macy's, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.description: Details: Welders/Production (Oklahoma City) Aerotek is looking for hardworking individuals with knowledge of Mig and Flux Core processes for a FULL TIME opportunity..Must have good work history and be willing to submit to drug and background screen If interested please contact David by responding via email with your resume, or a brief detail of yourself and work history. item.title: Staff Internal Auditor
item.description: Details: Internal Auditor Job Purpose: Performs individual internal audit projects as a part of the total internal audit plan. Major Reponsibilities of the Internal Auditor: Assists and learns development internal audit scope. Performs internal audit procedures. Prepares internal audit reports reflecting the results of the work performed including covering functional and operating units, focusing on financial, IT and operational processes. Performs follow-up on the status of outstanding internal audit issues. Assists Internal Audit management with periodic reporting to the Audit Committee. Future participation in the development process of the annual internal audit plan. Champions internal control and corporate governance concepts throughout the business. May review the work performed by other internal audit personnel, including resources from the co-sourcing firm.

item.title: Transportation & Delivery Supervisor
item.description: Details: TRANSPORTATION & DELIVERY SUPERVISOR PFG Customized Distribution, one of the nation’s largest food distributors, is seeking a Supervisor to direct drivers’ daily duties at our Elkton MD Distribution Center. Recent college grad with a desire to grow in the transportation industry could be successful. • Previous supervisory experience, preferably in trucking industry would be a plus. • Possession of a valid CDL Class A drivers license or willingness to pursue a CDL A is preferred. • Position is Monday thru Friday, but must be willing to work various shifts as needed. We offer: • Very competitive pay. • Excellent benefits, including healthcare, prescription card, dental, vision, life, disability, 401k retirement with company match, paid vacation, holidays and personal days. item.description: Details: Customer Service Representative Job Purpose: Attracts and Serves customers by providing product and service information at events and promotions. item.title: Alarm Installation Technician
item.description: Details: If you have low-voltage installation experience and a positive, customer-oriented personality, join our team at Alliance Security and earn a fantastic income! In business since 2003 and servicing 26 states, we are a national home automation and security company based in Warwick, RI. Due to rapid expansion, we are currently seeking Security Technicians. You will install our alarm systems at customer locations while also identifying opportunities to upgrade customer service packages. Our top Technicians earn as much as $70,000 a year. We offer a fun and dynamic work environment as well as the flexibility to work either full- or part-time. You will receive paid training and certifications and will find plenty of room for career advancement as our company continues to grow. No degree is necessary! If this sounds like the kind of job you've been looking for, and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!

item.title: Tory Burch Shoes Selling Specialist FT: Bloomingdale's San Francisco Centre, CA
item.description: Details: Bloomingdale's... like no other store in the world seeks a Luxury Brand Selling Specialist. Your fashion voice and authority is what makes you credible as you engage with an upscale client base. What makes you successful is your ease of conversation, building relationships and connecting with others. What excites you is a fast paced commission environment where the sales you generate drive your earnings. Our top performers are goal oriented and can balance multiple priorities in a fast paced environment and most importantly truly have fun at work. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:- Outstanding selling behaviors, listening and responding to customer needs to deliver service...like no other - Sharp awareness of current fashion trends - Building and cultivating relationships with customers through personal interaction - Develop repeat business to grow personal sales, utilizing B-connected to maintain client files - Meeting or exceeding sales and loyalty goals - Expert on product knowledge, understanding features and benefits and sharing with clients - Demonstrate knowledge of store products and services to build sales and loyalty SKILL SUMMARY: - Possesses drive, is goal oriented, has an entrepreneurial outlook - Drives to meet and exceed sales goals and customer expectations - Ability to build relationships, connect with others, solve problems and impact and influence others - Passionate and knowledgeable about luxury brands and services - Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities and learn new procedures - Exceptional communication skills with the ability to engage in conversation with customers, peers and managers - Ability to work as part of a productive team, or individually with little direct supervision - Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including weekends, evenings, extended hours, and key event days - Previous exposure to luxury brands preferred; retail selling experience a plus This job description is not all inclusive. item.title: SQL Database Administrator (DBA)
item.description: Details: Overview: This position will work within the Database Administration team to support the various database and application systems across multiple environments. Responsibilities: SQL Server 2008 and 2012 installations. Maintenance and basic troubleshooting. Basic database design / architecture. Documentation of database structure. Responsible for database file systems, device lay out, backup and recovery procedures of all databases. Writing, editing and optimizing moderately complex T-SQL statements for developers and SQL Reporting Services. Tuning and performance of SQL Server Databases. Monitor health and growth of SQL Server Databases. Solid understanding and experience designing and managing high availability SQL environments (availability groups, clustering). Good understanding of SAN disk technologies. Experience with Idera or other monitoring tools. Ability to perform other IT operational duties as required.

item.title: Macy's Seasonal Retail Selling Floor Recovery Overnight, Part Time - Flushing, NY - Downtown Flushing
item.description: Details: Job Overview: As a Seasonal Floor Recovery Associate at Macy's, you will be a critical link in ensuring that our customers have a rewarding experience that will keep them coming back time after time. You will be required to move between selling areas as directed to maintain high customer readiness standards. You will deliver a clean, neat and easy-to-shop store environment, while building quality customer relationships that result in increased sales and repeat business. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to demonstrating MAGIC Selling Skills and other operational tasks as assigned. This position is only in our Extreme Hard Shop Locations. Performs other duties as assigned. In order to present our customers with the best holiday shopping experience, many of our Holiday Selling Floor Recovery Associates arrive prior to store opening and remain after closing to ensure we are ready to make Macy's magic. Holiday associates will have the opportunity to work a flexible schedule on a temporary basis, which may include early mornings, evenings, weekends and busy events such as the day after Thanksgiving and the day after Christmas. And don't forget - just in time for holiday shopping, you will receive an employee discount of up to 20% starting your first day! Any schedule hours listed in the job posting title are subject to change based on business needs. All holiday associates may be required to work hours other than those stated in the job posting title on weekends, or on key holiday events such as the Friday after Thanksgiving. Essential Functions:- Assist customers in all aspects of service fulfillment by demonstrating proficient use of proprietary devices and applications; proactively create enhanced shopping experiences through the heightened use of tools, technology and collaboration - Drive sales by consistently demonstrating exceptional MAGIC Selling Skills - Provide an exceptional customer experience by ensuring the customer is always the priority - Leverage product knowledge to increase sales by educating and assisting the customer in making the best choice - Adhere to all safety and security policies and procedures - Regular, dependable attendance and punctuality Qualifications: Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate and present information to customers, peers and all levels of management. Mathematical Skills: Basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division. Able to use a calculator. Other skills: Ability to work as part of a team, or independently with minimal direct supervision. Strong customer selling orientation. Demonstrates a customer-first mentality Demonstrates an energetic and positive attitude. Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple priorities and open to learning new procedures. Work Hours: Ability to work a flexible retail schedule, including evenings and weekends. Macy's is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

item.title: IMMEDIATE HIRE - Entry Level Customer Service & Sales/Marketing
item.description: Details: ARE YOU LOOKING FOR AN EXCITING CAREER WITH UNLIMITED GROWTH POTENTIAL? Riverfront Marketing, Inc is one of the LEADING marketing firms providing exceptional service to large corporations in the Midwest. We are currently looking to fill positions in our Sales/ Marketing and Customer Service department. These positions are ENTRY LEVEL and have RAPID advancement OPPORTUNITY. Whether you are looking to get your foot in the door with a marketing position or already have experience, we are interested in hearing more about how your unique skill set can benefit our company. Riverfront Marketing, Inc has team members from all walks of life and believe that degrees and experience in marketing, as well as other industries, can benefit our company.

item.title: Client Sales and Service Representative
item.description: Details: Client Sales and Services Representative Position Overview Our mission is to develop people early on at entry level and mold them in to top sales and service reps nationally. This is your opportunity to join an privately owned company that is not just a job but a place that cares about each individual team members progress every single day. The Client Sales and Services Representative supports our company's mission by being the first point of contact for all of our clients and potential clients. The position responds to leads and forges relationships to build satisfied long lasting customers for our client. The CSSR’s must be capable of multitasking, working in a fast paced environment, confidently turn leads in to shown up appointments and be compassionate towards others. They should also be comfortable presenting to different types of people, assisting customers and working in a team environment. Essential Job Functions • Sales—Meet daily lead conversion goals, manage territory, and produce quality sales • Customer Service—Meet and greet clients, schedule appointments, go over installation process • Daily Operations—Organize files, print and copy documents, e-mails • Training—Facilitate group trainings, participate in 1:1 training sessions, attend group training sessions • Maintain a positive, upbeat and professional appearance at all times • All other duties as assigned Click the apply now>> button to send your resume in. If you are selected to continue on in the hiring process, you will be notified. All other applicants will not be contacted. No phone calls or walk-ins, please.

item.title: Civil Engineers CAD Designers Surveyors
item.description: Details: CIVIL ENGINEERS ENGINEERING MANAGERS CAD DESIGNERS SURVEYORS TIRED OF THE COLD WEATHER? MAKE YOUR MOVE NOW! Our client has permanent career opportunities available throughout the Eastern Seaboard Offices in Maryland, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Virginia, North Carolina, Florida, and more. Nationally recognized client is expanding along the Eastern Seaboard. Multiple opportunities in engineering design and project management for large scale commercial, industrial, and institutional clients. Positions in several regions are available. This is a very successful company that normally promotes from within, but explosive expansion has created many unique opportunities for BSCE's and supporting staff with dynamic personalities and proven land/site development related skills who are ready to step up to a higher level. Applicants should be seeking a high energy environment offering solid team support, mentoring when needed, and a passion for delivering above the norm. Expertise, training, or skill in any of the areas below is needed: CIVIL ENGINEERING (All Levels) ENGINEERING MANAGEMENT PROJECT MANAGEMENT TRAFFIC ENGINEERING LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTURE ASSIST. PROJECT MANAGEMENT CAD DESIGN LAND SURVEY Comprehensive benefits and lucrative compensation are offered! We are currently in a very dynamic marketplace. Please submit resume in MS Word format along with geographic preferences and salary history/requirements for immediate consideration. RELOCATION EXPENSES DETERMINED ON AN INDIVIDUAL BASIS

item.title: Manager of Forecast, Planning, and Analysis
item.description: Details: Job Classification: Full-Time Regular General Function: Direct responsibility for managing the finance relationship across all departments and operating segments of the Company. Supervise and develop staff to ensure that all strategies, products or operating changes are accurately represented and clearly communicated in Plan / forecast packages. Assist and provide recommendations to the Director of Forecast, Planning & Analysis on department direction-setting and staff development. Manage and communicate the results of highly complex financial analysis related to performance, state legislation, new product development, acquisitions and store performance. Maintain a robust forecasting and planning environment from both a process and a systematic perspective for a global footprint. Partner with operations to support analytical and operational needs of the global company - create forecast and analytical reporting to drive results for divisions Lead capital budgeting for the company - Ensure adequate capital is available to meet the current and future needs of the organization through development of an economic capital model. Prepare and review the assessment and implementation plans for acquisitions and other material investments on a global basis. Conduct all competitive bench marking for the company for current and future products and geographies.

item.title: Ad Agency/ Pharma Marketing Project Manager Needed!
item.description: Details: Seeking skilled Project Managers and Coordinators with advertising agency and pharmaceutical industry background. There are multiple openings and candidates MUST have the advertising and pharmaceutical experience! Manages internal clients, provides strategic counsel and assists in business development. Develops and maintains solid client relationships; encourages a collaborative approach with departmental team members. Educates clients on cost savings and leveraging opportunities aligned with their marketing efforts. Uses marketing and branding experience to create value-added benefits for internal clients. Interprets creative briefs in order to lead communication strategies and implement marketing efforts. Leverages knowledge and understanding of graphic design, creative and production to facilitate effective communication between client and departmental teams. Partners with outside agencies to manage promotional and marketing efforts for all clients. Oversees Traffic Coordinator activities, managing workload, priorities and project planning. Negotiates timelines and ensures all deadlines are maintained. Works closely with Assoc. Director and Manager, Account Management and Traffic, defining specific needs of the business and identifying additional areas of client service and cost savings. Collaborates on creative development and direction with client, design and production teams.

item.title: Software Engineer (.Net, jQuery, Entity)
item.description: Details: Our client here in San Diego has an exciting 9 month project enhancing a web application dashboard that overlays a data/reporting and analytics platform. The team has 5 people and they are trying to complete the enhancements in the next 9 months. They are replacing one of the developers on the team therefore the position starts immediately. There are several more projects lined up behind this one so the chances of contract extension are very high. Skills Required: BS Degree and 6+ years software development experience (can substitute experience for degree). Software Engineering skills to develop a solution, not just write code. .Net framework net MVC (or at the very least have solid MVC knowledge) C# development skills LINQ Entity Framework Visual Studio 2010, 2012 Jquery development experience SQL Server - Must have some experience connecting the software application to a database (i.e. strored procedures, etc. ). Understand the basics of SQL Server enough to be able to model the solutions or create the initial table and query/sproc designs for a given feature. Design Patterns, Object Oriented Development (OOD) - Solid experience in conceptualizing a solution and choosing certain design pattern. Also being able to articulate why they used a particular design solution versus the other options (for instance GoF Design Pattern to model the code). Unit testing Good communications skills, ability to contribute individually and work in a team, humble and confident Nice to Have: Other Javascript client side technologies like Bootstrap, Angular, Telerik etc. (this team uses Kendo UI but that's just a nice to have) Web Services, Restful Services, WCF - Understands interfaces and data flow, architectural bottlenecks, and performance limitations. Software Development in an Agile environment Job Duties: The Software Engineer contributes to the solution design in the .Net Framework. They also execute the solution by writing the code and following the solution through testing to implementation Must follow good design principles and produces well-documented and clear code that is unit tested Shows innovation and creativity in solving problems; draws upon different sources for ideas and solutions. (design patterns, concepts, etc.) Member of a Software Engineering Team that develops, enhances, and sustains software systems in a cross-functional team environment through adherence to established design control processes and good engineering practices Apply advanced knowledge of software engineering practices and techniques, technology trends, and working knowledge of domain expertise to Create functional requirements, use cases, and desired system behavior workflows and models. Work with Quality organization to create requirements traceability / dependency matrixes. Create use cases, alternative workflows and activity diagrams as needed to fully describe the required behavior of the solution. Create and maintain artifacts (models, diagrams, documents) by evaluating needs, clarifying requirements, and analyzing use cases and dependencies to recommend a course of action. Perform system validation by validating accurate and complete development of software, matching technical specifications and functional requirements. Work with various database architectures and interfaces and design robust databases and their communications structures. About TEKsystems: Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. We have more than 100 offices worldwide, and we partner with over 6,000 clients and place over 80,000 consultants per year. At TEKsystems, we seek to understand our consultants’ skills, goals and interests, allowing us to present targeted job opportunities on a contract, contract-to-hire or direct placement basis. TEKsystems' leadership in the market stems from our sincere and personal commitment to driving the success of our customers, consultants and each other.

item.title: Sr Specialist Technical Process\Quality TDP Network Operations
item.description: Details: At AT&T, our job is to deliver the future before anyone else. We do this with people. People who want to create and deliver new technology that can transform the lives of our customers, our communities and our society. Our professionals innovate every day, whether they are working on upgrading our wireless and broadband infrastructure or delivering new possibilities for our consumer and business customers. They make the impossible, possible. The TDP-Network Operations program is a college hire development program that provides the opportunity for participants to collaborate with project teams while gaining broad experience across the AT&T Network Operations organization. This program will allow you to gain the professional development and peer/leadership support that will help you jump start your career with AT&T. Being part of this program will help you build your technical, problem-solving, communication, and analytical skills to achieve real impact at a much earlier stage than many of your peers. It will also give you the ability to have plenty of networking opportunities that include key executive leadership sessions, business area and industry overview presentations, volunteer and social activities and Individual team member responsibilities. After the initial training, you will continue to showcase your skills on a variety of technical platforms, disciplines and strategic project areas and support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations. Specifically, as an Network Process & Quality Manager , your primary responsibilities will include Candidate should be able to facilitate moderately complex technical network support programs/initiatives for ntwk data standards/integrity, quality management, process design, methods/procedures through analyzing, tracking and publishing ntwk performance and process/quality indicators and results by constructing reports illustrative of process trends and ntwk performance. This position requires good communication skills with the desire to learn all aspects of organization from reporting, analysis, project mangement and technical development. Working as a Network Process & Quality Manager, you will facilitate moderately complex and/or technical organizational process improvement activities in an individual contributor role. This position facilitates the identification, analysis, development, and documentation of process improvements and identifies process improvement training needs. As a member of this team, you will assist in identifying and making recommendations for process improvements and data analysis while supporting project managers and other staff where needed. You will exercise independent judgment in developing methods, techniques, and evaluation criterion for obtaining results. Degree: Engineering degree (non chemical or petroleum) or Techinical degree. Desired Skills: Strong experience with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint); Strong verbal and written communication skills; Strong project management skills; Strong presentation skills; Ability to work with all levels of management; Ability to prioritize projects and handle multiple demands simultaneously AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position. Keywords: Sr Specialist Technical Process\Quality TDP Network Operations

item.title: Retail Sales Consultant
item.description: Details: AT&T: So Much More of What You Work For Looking for an opportunity where you can put your energy and enthusiasm to work to create unlimited earning potential? Of course you are. How about a chance to learn, grow and advance with the number one wireless company in America? Even better. We're AT&T, and the only thing we enjoy more than pioneering and selling the latest devices is helping people make the most of them. Our retail opportunities are among the best, offering you great pay, strong benefits, advancement potential and a work environment full of fast-paced fun. Opportunity, Security and Great People Find out what it's like to work in an industry that's not about to slow down- with a company that has a legacy of successful innovation. Start with the paycheck: Base plus commission. Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn an average of $47,175.00 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals. Our top sellers earn an average of $55,521 per year. Add a full benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, work/life resources and discounts on AT&T products and services Round out your experience with training on the latest technologies and devices today, tomorrow and for as long as you work with us As you learn and succeed, you'll be eligible for new opportunities and financial rewards And every day, you'll work in a fast-paced environment with customers and colleagues that appreciate your energy and assistance JOB DESCRIPTION Develop and attain customer experience and sales objectives for store. Sell all products and services offered by the Company. Meet all sales objectives. Handle all administrative aspects of the sale including: completing customer contracts and warranties, pulling products from inventory, accepting customer payments and filing the completed orders. Maintain strong knowledge of all products, accessories, pricing plans, promotions and service features. Maintain knowledge of competitive offers and provide critical market feedback to the Store Manager regarding local competition and product/service needs. Handle service inquiries from customers. Provide efficient, courteous customer service and assist in all aspects of product offerings and services. Ensure an extraordinary customer experience. Position may be commissioned and quota based. GENERAL DUTIES The essential functions listed below are representative of duties performed by this job title. Duties generally include but are not limited to the following: GENERAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS WHICH ARE NORMALLY REQUIRED: Possess a competitive spirit and desire to meet and exceed sales goals Stay up-to-date on the latest data/entertainment technology and devices, such as Wi-Fi, data devices, TV entertainment tools Understand customers' needs and help them discover how our products meet those needs Multi-task in a fast paced team environment Educate and engage customers through product demonstrations Interact with customers and provide prompt and courteous customer service to all customers The successful candidate will be able to perform the following with or without reasonable accommodation: Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays Ability to stand for long periods of time Ability to complete all paperwork completely, accurately, in a timely manner Ability to lift up to 25 pounds Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax Ability to work in other locations as the needs of the business dictate may be required. Complete all aspects of opening and closing the store in accordance with written procedures. Submit all transaction journals on a daily basis. Assists with inventory maintenance May be required to wear a uniform Desired Qualifications: 1-3 years retail/customer facing/sales experience preferred. Retail Sales Consultants are paid a competitive hourly rate and can earn additional monthly commission dollars by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives! Provisions listed in these job descriptions may be changed or modified by AT&T Mobility without prior notice at any time, at the Company's sole discretion. Keywords: Sales, Part Time, Entry Level, Customer Service, Retail Associate, Sales Associate, Retail, Sales Representative, New College Gradate, Recent College Graduate, Entry-level Retail Sales Consultant Philadelphia PA (Andorra)

item.title: NGEN (Navy) IT Service Delivery Rep Junior
item.description: Details: Job Locations: Gulfport, MS and Meridian, MS Zero to four (0-4) years of information technology experience. Installs, maintains, and services IP network and transport services hardware and software under direct supervision. Develops knowledge of and skill with Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) layers 2 through 4, and of Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) incident, problem, change, and availability management. Responds to tasking in support of configuration change requests for new or expanded network and transport services. Assists in creating new and modifying existing network interfaces, and supports implementation and maintenance of network designs. Applies firmware and software updates to network and transport components. Responds to tasking in support of incident reports by troubleshooting, repairing, and/or reconfiguring network and transport services. Monitors and enforces network and transport service security, integrity and business continuity controls. Assists in planning and executing special network and transport service projects. ***This position may be cross-trained to provide Enterprise Services Tier I/II system administration and Desktop Support*** H.S./GED; DOD 8570 Certification IAT-1: A+ or Network+ Required Clearance: Secret Keywords: NGEN (Navy) IT Service Delivery Rep Junior

item.title: Principal Big Data Software Eng
item.description: Details: Responsible for the development of high performance, distributed computing tasks using Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, NoSQL, text mining and other distributed environment technologies. Familiarity with JVM-based function languages including Scala and Clojure; Hadoop query languages including Pig, Hive, Scalding, Cascalog, PyCascading; along with alternative HDFS-based computing frameworks including Spark and STORM are desirable. Key Roles and Responsibilities: Uses Big Data programming languages and technology, writes code, completes programming and documentation, and performs testing and debugging of applications. Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs and modifies software enhancements and/or new products used in distributed, large scale analytics and visualization solutions. Interacts with data scientists and industry experts to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented. Works in a highly agile environment. Job Contribution: Expert level technical professional. Technical Subject Matter Expert (SME) within organization. Contributes through own development of advanced technologies/concepts with global reach or industry application. Has direct impact on creation of technical products/services. Serves as a role model and mentor. Has extensive specialized technical expertise. Applies expert knowledge and broad understanding of multiple disciplines. Integrates expert knowledge of technical principles/methods of multiple disciplines with knowledge of products/services and internal operations. Advisor on AT&T technologies/systems/procedures. Solves complex, critical problems related to significant and unique issues. Uses extensive research and interpretative thinking. Utilizes innovative methods in developing solutions. Works on abstract problems requiring evaluation of intangible variables. Guided by functional goals/objectives. May influence organization goals/objectives. Applies discretion to develop innovative solutions to problems without precedent. Lead contributor on critical projects/technology initiatives. Develops enterprise wide integrated solutions. Contributes to complex and innovative business solutions to achieve strategic objectives. Provides technical expertise to peers across the company. Actively promotes good working relationships. Develops mutually beneficial strategic alliances with customers. Education: Masters of Science in Computer Science, Math or Scientific Computing preferred. Experience: Typically requires 8-10 years experience . Keywords: Principal Big Data Software Eng

Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn an average of $47,175.00 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals. Our top sellers earn an average of $55,521 per year. Sell all products and services offered by the Company. Meet all sales objectives. Handle all administrative aspects of the sale including: completing customer contracts and warranties, pulling products from inventory, accepting customer payments and filing the completed orders. Maintain strong knowledge of all products, accessories, pricing plans, promotions and service features. Maintain knowledge of competitive offers and provide critical market feedback to the Store Manager regarding local competition and product/service needs. Handle service inquiries from customers. Provide efficient, courteous customer service and assist in all aspects of product offerings and services. Ensure an extraordinary customer experience. Position may be commissioned and quota based. GENERAL DUTIES The essential functions listed below are representative of duties performed by this job title. Duties generally include but are not limited to the following: GENERAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS WHICH ARE NORMALLY REQUIRED: Possess a competitive spirit and desire to meet and exceed sales goals Stay up-to-date on the latest data/entertainment technology and devices, such as Wi-Fi, data devices, TV entertainment tools Understand customers' needs and help them discover how our products meet those needs Multi-task in a fast paced team environment Educate and engage customers through product demonstrations Interact with customers and provide prompt and courteous customer service to all customers The successful candidate will be able to perform the following with or without reasonable accommodation: Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays Ability to stand for long periods of time Ability to complete all paperwork completely, accurately, in a timely manner Ability to lift up to 25 pounds Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax Ability to work in other locations as the needs of the business dictate may be required. Complete all aspects of opening and closing the store in accordance with written procedures. Submit all transaction journals on a daily basis. Assists with inventory maintenance May be required to wear a uniform Desired Qualifications: 1-3 years retail/customer facing/sales experience preferred. Retail Sales Consultants are paid a competitive hourly rate and can earn additional monthly commission dollars by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives! item.title: Premises Technician
item.description: Details: LOOKING FOR A COMPANY THAT VALUES YOUR POTENTIAL? A job with AT&T as a Premises Technician can provide you with exactly that! Take advantage of our paid training and wide range of career possibilities. AT&T offers a competitive salary, company provided vehicles and tools and benefits that include medical, dental, paid vacation, and more! Our Premises Technicians work both inside and outside and are responsible for the installation and customer care of the new U-verse integrated digital TV, high speed Internet and voice services. What you'll do as an AT&T Premises Technician: Educate customers on service features and functionality Verify all services are working correctly Install and rearrange inside wires Possibly work in small confined spaces or aloft (up to 28ft) Work with hand tools Work outdoors in all kinds of weather Click here to learn more about this job from AT&T employees! In addition to STRONG communication skills, our Premises Technicians must have the following: Valid state drivers license and non-negligent driving record Meet 275lbs weight limit due to safety restrictions Ability to lift and move up to 80lbs Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and weekends Satisfactory results from a background/employment history investigation and drug screening Qualification on pre-employment screening Ability to perceive differences in wire and cable colors Ability to complete on-the-job and/or classroom training as required to remain on the job Technical/Mechanical Test - Field II (TMT-F II) Premises Technician Assessment (PTA) Premises Technician Inventory (PTI) Physical Abilities Evaluation (PAE) Test study guides can be found at : http://att.jobs/test-guides.aspx #rsr Keywords: Technician, cable installer, general labor, entry level, entry-level, new college graduate Premises Technician

item.title: Customer Service Representative (CC)
item.description: Details: Do you like helping people get the most out of the technology they love? Is being part of an award winning team that passionately cares about customers and delivers best-in-class service important to you? Then you’ll love being a member of our customer service community. Our call center representatives are the front line of our company, offering solutions, identifying opportunities and serving millions of customers - one at a time. What does it take to handle customer questions and concerns? Courtesy, professionalism and product knowledge. The goal? Help customers and provide them with solutions. We’ll get you started by providing on-the-job training and resources. On our team, you’ll be an important part of shaping our customer experience - from setting up new accounts, to answering questions and actively listening for opportunities to expand and deliver great services. Bottom line? When our customers think of AT&T, they’ll think of you. What’s in it for you? Start with the paycheck: Customer Service Representatives start between $10.51 and $14.98 per hour Add a full benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, and work/life resources Plus a 50% off your AT&T wireless service and discounts on other AT&T products and services Career possibilities are limitless with AT&T. You will have the chance to round out your experience with training on the latest technology, devices, and our entire lineup of products, services and promotions. If you’re 18 years or older, let’s talk. Our employees say it best! Watch now. Keywords: Customer Service Representative (CC)
