item.title: Sr. Contract\Sourcing Specialist TDP Network Operations
item.description: Details: At AT&T, our job is to deliver the future before anyone else. We do this with people. People who want to create and deliver new technology that can transform the lives of our customers, our communities and our society. Our professionals innovate every day, whether they are working on upgrading our wireless and broadband infrastructure or delivering new possibilities for our consumer and business customers. They make the impossible, possible. The TDP-Network Operations program is a college hire development program that provides the opportunity for participants to collaborate with project teams while gaining broad experience across the AT&T Network Operations organization. This program will allow you to gain the professional development and peer/leadership support that will help you jump start your career with AT&T. Being part of this program will help you build your technical, problem-solving, communication, and analytical skills to achieve real impact at a much earlier stage than many of your peers. It will also give you the ability to have plenty of networking opportunities that include key executive leadership sessions, business area and industry overview presentations, volunteer and social activities and Individual team member responsibilities. After the initial training, you will continue to showcase your skills on a variety of technical platforms, disciplines and strategic project areas and support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations. Specifically, as a Sr. Contract/Sourcing Specialist, your primary responsibilities will include Candidate should have a good understanding of business processes related to construction project management. This includes development and execution of plan to meet demands of the customer which includes obtaining material, securing contractor, negotiating with both internal and external customers during placement of these assets, and paying invoices. Candidate should be proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word). As a Contract/Sourcing Specialist (Contract Coordinator) you will develop and administer contracts in accordance with company policies and procedures,provide interpretation and analysis of contract documents and reviews and evaluates customer requests for changes in or revisions of contracts that involve technical specifications, cost or schedule impact on the company. Uses skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry practices and company policies and procedures; resolves a wide range of issues including project mgt, data collection and budgeting. Degree: BS/ BBA (Project Mgt, Accounting, IT) Skills: Communication, Leadership, Self-Starter. Strong experience with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Candidate should have a good understanding of business processes related to construction project management. This includes development and execution of plan to meet demands of the customer which includes obtaining material, securing contractor, negotiating with both internal and external customers during placement of these assets, and paying invoices. Candidate should be proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position. Keywords: Sr. Contract\Sourcing Specialist TDP Network Operations

item.title: Sales Support Representative-Part Time
item.description: Details: AT&T: So Much More of What You Work For Looking for an opportunity where you can put your energy and enthusiasm to work? Of course you are. How about a chance to learn, grow and advance with the number one wireless company in America? Even better. We’re AT&T, and the only thing we enjoy more than pioneering and selling the latest devices is helping people make the most of them. Our retail opportunities are among the best, offering you great pay, strong benefits, advancement potential and a work environment full of fast-paced fun. Opportunity, Security - and Great People Find out what it’s like to work in an industry that’s not about to slow down- with a company that has a legacy of successful innovation. •Start with the paycheck: We offer a competitive base pay. •Add a full benefits package for both full and part time team members, which includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, work/life resources and discounts on AT&T products and services. •Round out your experience with paid training on the latest technologies and devices - today, tomorrow and for as long as you work with us •As you learn and succeed, you’ll be eligible for new opportunities and financial rewards •And every day, you’ll work in a fast-paced environment with customers and colleagues that appreciate your energy and assistance JOB DESCRIPTION Function in multiple roles that support the performance of the store’s retail experience. Responsible for ensuring an extraordinary customer experience by facilitating the coordination of customers being welcomed in, prioritizing transactions and advising of any wait time. Own the store’s service customer experience! Responsible for troubleshooting effectively and then resolving and/or following up on customer issues, ensuring our customers needs are addressed promptly, and communicating with the management team effectively. Ensure positive experience for our internal/external customers by maintaining the integrity of store operating procedures including but not limited to: Inventory management, cash management, point of sale paperwork/recordkeeping, assists in the adherence to store merchandising standards, and the safety and security requirements in the store. Operate various internal tools and systems, terminal consoles and peripheral devices, and maintain time sensitive daily, weekly, and monthly records with a high degree of detail and accuracy. Act as the operational liaison between agents, vendors, customers and various AT&T departments. May sell all products and services offered by the company. Answer inbound calls and assist sales representatives and customers by performing quick hit sales transactions. Perform other duties as assigned by management. GENERAL DUTIES The functions listed below are representative of duties performed by this job title. Duties generally include but are not limited to the following: GENERAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTION WHICH ARE NORMALLY REQUIRED: Customer Experience and Sales •Deliver AT&T’s “Our Retail Promise” •Welcome customers to our store, coordinate check-in process and customer flow •Function as a customer experience advocate •Assist with sales when needed •Work in a team environment to meet and exceed assigned goals Store Operations (*may or may not not be required in all locations) •Inventory management - including counts, ordering, maintaining, receiving, returning, tracking and securing equipment and supplies •Perform operational tasks to maintain audit-ready status in store at all times •Prepare bank deposits •Balance cash drawer •Process and prepare paperwork for recordkeeping and report generation •Assist with store merchandising MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: •Perform the following with reasonable accommodation: o Work flexible hours (including evenings, weekends and holidays) o Stand for long periods of time o Ability to lift up to 25 pounds o Operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax o Work in other locations as the needs of the business dictate what may be required o May be required to wear a uniform or company apparel as designated by management PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: •Associate Degree •1+ years of relevant work experience •Telecommunications industry knowledge •Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail •Strong working knowledge of computer systems/software and computerized billing •Strong customer service skills •Thorough research skills Provisions listed in these Job Descriptions may be changed or modified by AT&T Mobility without prior notice at any time, at the Company's sole discretion. Keywords: Sales, Part Time, Entry Level, Customer Service, Administrative Assistant, Receptionist, Administrative, Part-Time, Entry-Level, New College Gradate, Recent College Graduate Part Time Sales Support Representative Boca Raton FL (Boca Town Center)

item.title: Retail Sales Consultant-Bilingual
item.description: Details: AT&T: So Much More of What You Work For Looking for an opportunity where you can put your energy and enthusiasm to work to create unlimited earning potential? Of course you are. How about a chance to learn, grow and advance with the number one wireless company in America? Even better. We're AT&T, and the only thing we enjoy more than pioneering and selling the latest devices is helping people make the most of them. Our retail opportunities are among the best, offering you great pay, strong benefits, advancement potential and a work environment full of fast-paced fun. Start with the paycheck: Base plus commission. Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn an average of $47,175.00 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals. Our top sellers earn an average of $55,521 per year. Add a full benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, work/life resources and discounts on AT&T products and services Round out your experience with training on the latest technologies and devices today, tomorrow and for as long as you work with us As you learn and succeed, you'll be eligible for new opportunities and financial rewards And every day, you'll work in a fast-paced environment with customers and colleagues that appreciate your energy and assistance JOB DESCRIPTION Develop and attain customer experience and sales objectives for store. Sell all products and services offered by the Company. Meet all sales objectives. Handle all administrative aspects of the sale including: completing customer contracts and warranties, pulling products from inventory, accepting customer payments and filing the completed orders. Maintain strong knowledge of all products, accessories, pricing plans, promotions and service features. Maintain knowledge of competitive offers and provide critical market feedback to the Store Manager regarding local competition and product/service needs. Handle service inquiries from customers. Provide efficient, courteous customer service and assist in all aspects of product offerings and services. Ensure an extraordinary customer experience. Position may be commissioned and quota based. GENERAL DUTIES The essential functions listed below are representative of duties performed by this job title. Duties generally include but are not limited to the following: GENERAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS WHICH ARE NORMALLY REQUIRED: Possess a competitive spirit and desire to meet and exceed sales goals Stay up-to-date on the latest data/entertainment technology and devices, such as Wi-Fi, data devices, TV entertainment tools Understand customers' needs and help them discover how our products meet those needs Multi-task in a fast paced team environment Educate and engage customers through product demonstrations Interact with customers and provide prompt and courteous customer service to all customers The successful candidate will be able to perform the following with or without reasonable accommodation: Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays Ability to stand for long periods of time Ability to complete all paperwork completely, accurately, in a timely manner Ability to lift up to 25 pounds Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax Ability to work in other locations as the needs of the business dictate may be required. Complete all aspects of opening and closing the store in accordance with written procedures. Submit all transaction journals on a daily basis. Assists with inventory maintenance May be required to wear a uniform Desired Qualifications: 1-3 years retail/customer facing/sales experience preferred. Retail Sales Consultants are paid a competitive hourly rate and can earn additional monthly commission dollars by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives! Provisions listed in these job descriptions may be changed or modified by AT&T Mobility without prior notice at any time, at the Company's sole discretion. Keywords: Sales, Part Time, Entry Level, Customer Service, Retail Associate, Sales Associate, Retail, Sales Representative, Bilingual, New College Gradate, Recent College Graduate, Entry-level at&t Retail Sales Consultant Bilingual Preferred (Solano County Stores CA)

item.title: Assistant Store Manager
item.description: Details: Meet and exceed customer experience and sales objectives for store. Assist the Store Manager in the daily operation of a retail store. Under the direction of the Store Manager, schedule employees, maintain inventories, conduct physical inventories, maintain store appearance and complete day-to-day paperwork as directed. Assist Store Manager, as directed, by assisting in the development, training and management of assigned team, which may consist of support or sales personnel. Ensure an extraordinary customer experience at all times. ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES Customer Experience and Sales •Execute store’s implementation of The AT&T Retail Promise •Assist Store Manager to: o Execute store initiatives related to sales, service, and customer experience o Meet and exceed assigned customer experience and reputation, sales and service, revenue and productivity targets o Create a work environment where motivated people can excel o Coach personnel on “opportunities” with key sales and reputation metrics, recognize teams on positive performance against key sales and reputation o Perform role plays with personnel on a regular basis to improve interactions with customers o Demonstrate the right customer behaviors defined by Delivering an Extraordinary Experience • Facilitate weekly personnel training/educational sessions as directed by Store Manager • Monitor Customer Experience Dashboard • Resolve or escalate appropriately any billing or service issues o Deliver the right customer experience by assisting with management of the store, customer coordination, the welcome and wait time process, supporting the team and assisting sales personnel with customer transactions • Consistently demonstrate excellent leadership and coaching skills Employee Management and Development •Assist, inspire and engage employees by motivating team to succeed •Lead by example •Develop employees for growth and promotion •Partner with Store Manager to observe and coach employees, providing feedback around sales technique effectiveness and providing excellent customer service •Improve employee engagement through leadership skills • Partner with Store Manager to observe and coach all employees as needed, providing feedback around sales technique effectiveness and providing excellent customer service • Improve store employee engagement through leadership skills • Assist Store Manager in ensuring personnel adhere to the Code of Business Conduct and company policies as directed by Store Manager • Fully understand and assist in educating personnel on compensation plan and how to maximize their earnings • Assist in ensuring all time cards are reviewed and accurate •Communicate temporary assignments and overtime for floating personnel Product Launches •Partner with Store Manager to successfully launch new products, services or processes •Actively inspect post-launch and drive improved results with best practices •Inspect that employees are properly trained on new products and promotions to sell with confidence •Report concerns with sellers’ knowledge and/or behavior to Store Manager or provide coaching as appropriate •Coordinate with security, facilities and mall management to ensure smooth product launch day execution Store Operations Staffing/Scheduling •Assist Store Manager with scheduling, coverage and resource planning to ensure the store has the right number of employees in the right roles at the right times •Facilitate the monthly scheduling process Merchandising •Adhere to the iPOG and the merchandising standards •Instill a sense of pride and ownership in store appearance - where all employees understand their store is the face of AT&T to every customer Compliance •Drive operational compliance of back office processes, procedures and policies •Inspect existing and new retail programs, tools and training Other •Report fraudulent activity to Asset Protection •On call for store emergencies Demonstrate AT&T Extraordinary Leader Model Characteristics •Continuously display high integrity •Develop strategic perspective and champion change •Inspire others to high performance through collaboration and teamwork •Utilize professional expertise to solve problems and analyze issues •Capture initiative and strive for results Desired Qualifications Three or more years sales/customer service experience in the telecommunications or related industry Previous management experience Well developed planning, analytical and problem-solving skills Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Strong communication, leadership, and presentation skills Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax Ability to work at multiple locations within district preferred Familiarity with wireless terminology and AT&T Mobility systems preferred Assistant Store Managers are paid a competitive hourly rate and can earn additional monthly commission dollars by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives! Provisions listed in these Job Descriptions may be changed or modified by AT&T Mobility without prior notice at any time, at the Company's sole discretion. Keywords: Retail Manager, Store Manager, Sales, Supervisor, Customer Service, Manager, Management, New College Graduate, Recent College Graduate Assistant Store Manager Ross Park Mall (Pittsburgh PA)

item.title: GSM O Network Controller\Operator Intermediate
item.description: Details: Serves as serves as a technical specialist responsible for monitoring, operating and managing the NORTEL OPTERA 3500, NET Promina, CISCO 15454/15310, CIENA CORESTREAM, SYCAMORE SN16000 Intelligent Switch, LARSCOM CSU/DSU, ADTRAN M13 MUX(s), and other associated transport equipment (such as modems, smart jacks, media converters, circuit switching units, data switching units, cryptographic equipment, routers, front-end processors, secure telephone switches, and PBX's). Technician is responsible to troubleshoot, restore, provide service, and oversee maintenance actions on the legacy and new Defense Information Systems Network (DISN) Core Networks. This includes performing pro-active monitoring of all circuit, trunk, node, and network level alarms and alerts to identify those components/elements, which may lead to or are already causing a network degradation or failure. The operator accomplishes this through use of network management system(s) such as PRESIDE AP, Panavue, NETMS, SARDIMSS, CISCO TRANSPORT MANAGER, CIENA ON-CENTER, SILVX MANAGER, TELENIUM, MicroMuse, INMS, and other Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) associated assets on a continuous 24x7x365 (rotating shifts) basis. Performs pro-active monitoring of network elements alarms and alerts to identify those components/elements that may lead to or already are causing network degradation or failure. Accomplishes this through use of network management system(s) and associated assets on a continuous (rotating shifts) basis. Performs fault isolation and diagnostic/assessment functions to include determination and execution of corrective action(s) on real-time basis. Interfaces with functional users as well as remote operations centers in both routine and reactive monitoring situations. Maintains logs and records associated with reported problems or situations. Executes all reporting functions and data input associated with network management. Monitors security posture of network(s); reports suspected violations to designated authority. Coordinates with configuration management and implementation entities to ensure optimum dissemination of information and network efficiency. Performs operator level maintenance on all components/assets associated with network management systems. Provides functional guidance, technical support, training and quality assurance/quality control as part of the Tier 1 network operations team.This position requires a minimum of 3 years’ experience with 2 years specific experience in telecommunications network management, operations, installation or development. General experience includes increasing technical responsibilities in network management. Current Security + certification | This position requires a minimum of seven years experience with five years specific experience in telecommunications network management, operations,installation or development. General experience includes increasing technical responsibilities in network management. Required Clearance: Secret (minimum) Keywords: GSM O Network Controller\Operator Intermediate

item.title: General Accountant
item.description: Details: The General Accountant is a direct hire opportunity. Our client is a specialty subcontractor specializing in self-performing the installation of reinforcing steel, post-tensioning cables and mesh for hotels, convention centers, hospitals, parking garages, waste treatment plants, sports stadiums and other commercial projects. We are searching for a jack of all trades type person. They will be handling all of the AP, payroll, P&L, financial statements, GL for this client. Ideal candidates will have 5-10 years of experience in general accounting who can handle P&L, GL, and Financial Statements. This person MUST have construction accounting experience. What makes the construction accounting slightly different is “work in progress" or “construction in progress". There is a specific way to account for the materials, labor, etc for WIP or CIP. This will be a highly visible position within the company.

item.title: Cloud Storage Engineer Technical Support
item.description: Details: This Engineer for Cloud Storage Solutions position is an engineering support role focused on providing technical support for integration of commercial cloud storage solutions into a DoD customer environment. Candidate will interface with Government customers and third party contractors supporting Government systems to which the storage capability must interface. The candidate will be required to lead technical discovery efforts to develop identify technical and operational requirements for new service requirements and work with internal (AT&T and AT&T vendors) to develop and deliver the services. He or she is responsible, in conjunction with the programs team(s), for a wide range of architectural activities from requirements analysis through solution design and presentation to the client. The Engineer must have the ability to work closely with clients to understand the business requirements, issues, and priorities and develop a solution that advances the client's business strategy and goals. The Engineer must develop and maintain a working knowledge of AT&T’s current portfolio of cloud storage services and an understanding of the roadmap for future direction. The engineer maintains an understanding of the current trends in cloud storage technology. The cloud engineer is responsible to support AT&T customer visits, capability presentations, and support the development (from concept to full scale operational capability) of responses to customer queries, whitepapers, RFIs and RFPs. He or she develops and leads execution of the technical risk management plan for the solution to be implemented. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related field of study. 10 years work experience, 7 years experience in networking and telecommunications technologies, protocols and platforms, and 3 years experience in sizing and scoping, in design, implementation and provisioning of EMC storage solutions and associated enabling appliances. Excellent speaking and writing skills. Familiarity with DoD IT security requirements and DIACAP certification process. Must have IAT II certification (minimum of Security+ and Microsoft OS Certification or Training Required Clearance: Secret Keywords: Cloud Storage Engineer Technical Support

item.title: Information Assurance Security Specialist Junior
item.description: Details: Information Assurance Security Specialist supporting a new contract providing on premise Cloud Storage as a Services to a DoD customer. This project will install, integrate, and maintain a commercial cloud solution into the customer’s environment. Candidate will be a member of a small Information Security team responsible for obtaining ATO certification of the system. Candidate will participate in the development of security test plans, verify STIG compliance, test the system for security compliance, and prepare test reports and other artifacts required to achieve IATT, IATO and ATO. Candidate will work under the guidance and supervision of a senior Information Security Specialist. Periodic local travel to customer site in metropolitan D.C area will be required. Required Skills, Experience, and Education: 5 years of relevant experience in supporting DIACAP certification/achievement of ATO. 2 year technical degree. Possess an excellent understanding of government security policy and hands-on security features and procedures associated with implementing them. Excellent speaking and writing skills and must be capable of working in an integrated project team environment. Must have IAT II certification (minimum of Security+ and Microsoft OS Certification or Training.) Required Clearance: Secret Keywords: Information Assurance Security Specialist Junior

item.title: Sr Manager eCommerce
item.description: Details: This exciting opportunity on the att.com Home Solutions Sales team as a Senior Manager eCommerce of Product Development is responsible for executing initiatives to expand Home Solution sales online for U-verse TV, Internet, Voice, Access Line, DirecTV, and DSL. This role will be responsible for end-to-end implementation of sales initiatives designed to double sales in the channel and increase customer satisfaction while ensuring delivery of high-quality work for both internal and external customers. Projects may also include process improvements, strategic initiatives, and reporting optimization. You will analyze the att.com site and execute sales initiatives with focus on the end-to-end user experience to deliver an effortless customer experience. This includes; ongoing support to enable meeting/exceeding channel sales plan, creating and leading taskforces, collaborating with others to resolve online customer experience issues, implementing enhancements, and measuring the success of our site improvements based on customer satisfaction results. This position will interact heavily with the analytics, Online Sales & Marketing, Product Marketing, optimization, PMO and various IT and web design teams. Acts as a gateway for the channel with organizations external to CDE, works on 3-year roadmap strategy, forecast planning, target setting and benefits for new initiatives. Represent the online Home Solutions Sales channel and execute on its strategies and goals as the business lead on all internal and external to CDE portfolio projects Desired: • A problem solver — someone who uses strong analytical and fact-based decision-making skills to discover and apply project solutions Keywords: Sr Manager eCommerce

item.title: Supplies Attendant
item.description: Details: LOOKING FOR A COMPANY THAT VALUES YOUR POTENTIAL? A job with AT&T as a Supplies Attendant can provide you with exactly that! Take advantage of our paid training and wide range of career possibilities. AT&T offers a competitive salary and benefits that include medical, dental, paid vacation, and more! Our Supplies Attendants order, receive, stock, disburse and take inventory of plant telephone supplies and tools. What you'll do as an AT&T Supplies Attendant: Load and unload material Receive and prepare supplies, equipment and tools for delivery Check incoming supplies, equipment and tools against orders Enter data and obtain information via a computer terminal Our Supplies Attendants must be able to: Lift and move up to 150 pounds Perceive differences in wire and cable colors Meet 325lbs weight limit due to safety restrictions Qualify on pre-employment screening Test study guides can be found here Keywords: Supplies Attendant

Ensure an extraordinary customer experience at all times. ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES Customer Experience and Sales •Execute store’s implementation of The AT&T Retail Promise •Assist Store Manager to: o Execute store initiatives related to sales, service, and customer experience o Meet and exceed assigned customer experience and reputation, sales and service, revenue and productivity targets o Create a work environment where motivated people can excel o Coach personnel on “opportunities” with key sales and reputation metrics, recognize teams on positive performance against key sales and reputation o Perform role plays with personnel on a regular basis to improve interactions with customers o Demonstrate the right customer behaviors defined by Delivering an Extraordinary Experience • Facilitate weekly personnel training/educational sessions as directed by Store Manager • Monitor Customer Experience Dashboard • Resolve or escalate appropriately any billing or service issues o Deliver the right customer experience by assisting with management of the store, customer coordination, the welcome and wait time process, supporting the team and assisting sales personnel with customer transactions • Consistently demonstrate excellent leadership and coaching skills Employee Management and Development •Assist, inspire and engage employees by motivating team to succeed •Lead by example •Develop employees for growth and promotion •Partner with Store Manager to observe and coach employees, providing feedback around sales technique effectiveness and providing excellent customer service •Improve employee engagement through leadership skills • Partner with Store Manager to observe and coach all employees as needed, providing feedback around sales technique effectiveness and providing excellent customer service • Improve store employee engagement through leadership skills • Assist Store Manager in ensuring personnel adhere to the Code of Business Conduct and company policies as directed by Store Manager • Fully understand and assist in educating personnel on compensation plan and how to maximize their earnings • Assist in ensuring all time cards are reviewed and accurate •Communicate temporary assignments and overtime for floating personnel Product Launches •Partner with Store Manager to successfully launch new products, services or processes •Actively inspect post-launch and drive improved results with best practices •Inspect that employees are properly trained on new products and promotions to sell with confidence •Report concerns with sellers’ knowledge and/or behavior to Store Manager or provide coaching as appropriate •Coordinate with security, facilities and mall management to ensure smooth product launch day execution Store Operations Staffing/Scheduling •Assist Store Manager with scheduling, coverage and resource planning to ensure the store has the right number of employees in the right roles at the right times •Facilitate the monthly scheduling process Merchandising •Adhere to the iPOG and the merchandising standards •Instill a sense of pride and ownership in store appearance - where all employees understand their store is the face of AT&T to every customer Compliance •Drive operational compliance of back office processes, procedures and policies •Inspect existing and new retail programs, tools and training Other •Report fraudulent activity to Asset Protection •On call for store emergencies Demonstrate AT&T Extraordinary Leader Model Characteristics •Continuously display high integrity •Develop strategic perspective and champion change •Inspire others to high performance through collaboration and teamwork •Utilize professional expertise to solve problems and analyze issues •Capture initiative and strive for results Desired Qualifications Three or more years sales/customer service experience in the telecommunications or related industry Previous management experience Well developed planning, analytical and problem-solving skills Strong organizational skills and attention to detail Strong communication, leadership, and presentation skills Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax Ability to work at multiple locations within district preferred Familiarity with wireless terminology and AT&T Mobility systems preferred Assistant Store Managers are paid a competitive hourly rate and can earn additional monthly commission dollars by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives! Provisions listed in these Job Descriptions may be changed or modified by AT&T Mobility without prior notice at any time, at the Company's sole discretion. Keywords: Retail Manager, Store Manager, Sales, Supervisor, Customer Service, Manager, Management, New College Graduate, Recent College Graduate Assistant Retail Store Manager Eugene OR (West Eugene)

item.title: Manager OSP Plng & Engineering Design TDP Network Operations
item.description: Details: At AT&T, our job is to deliver the future before anyone else. We do this with people. People who want to create and deliver new technology that can transform the lives of our customers, our communities and our society. Our professionals innovate every day, whether they are working on upgrading our wireless and broadband infrastructure or delivering new possibilities for our consumer and business customers. They make the impossible, possible. The TDP-Network Operations program is a college hire development program that provides the opportunity for participants to collaborate with project teams while gaining broad experience across the AT&T Network Operations organization. This program will allow you to gain the professional development and peer/leadership support that will help you jump start your career with AT&T. Being part of this program will help you build your technical, problem-solving, communication, and analytical skills to achieve real impact at a much earlier stage than many of your peers. It will also give you the ability to have plenty of networking opportunities that include key executive leadership sessions, business area and industry overview presentations, volunteer and social activities and Individual team member responsibilities. After the initial training, you will continue to showcase your skills on a variety of technical platforms, disciplines and strategic project areas and support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations. Specifically, as an Manager OSP Plng & Engineering Design, your primary responsibilities will include Their responsibilities will include learning overall Planning functions, policies and systems. This will include analyzing and forecasting feeder network primarily focusing on fiber deployment to support Vision 2020. Providing facilities for customer orders that require feeder facilities. This person will work as part of our Midwest Planning team. Their responsibilities will include learning overall Planning functions, policies and systems. They will be responsible for a specific geographic area including all day to day activities as well as improving the network for the future. They will help create project handoffs, analyze and prioritize their workload to drive efficiency, fiber studies . Responsible for the Design and Analysis of the outside plant network. Will work on High Profile AT&T Projects. Interface with internal and external customers regarding AT&T feeder facilities. Analyze and respond to customer's requests for service and determine the best method to satisfy their service demand. Skills Required: Good communication skills will be critical in this role because being successful depends on interactions with many other organizations. Ability to work independently and as a team. Having the ability to prioritize and focus on tasks to completion will also be important because there are many high profile projects that will be vying for time. Strong in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Experience working in databases such as Microsoft Access would be a benefit. An Engineering or IT degree ia a plus. Degree: Engineering, IT- Candidate should have a good understanding of Microsoft Office with experience in using spreadsheets and being overall computer literate. Will need the ability to prioritize work and adapt to changing requirements. Good communication skills and strong anayltical skills are a must have. Their responsibilities will include learning overall Planning functions, policies and systems. This will include analyzing and forecasting feeder network primarily focusing on fiber deployment to support Vision 2020. Providing facilities for customer orders that require feeder facilities. AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position. Keywords: Manager OSP Plng & Engineering Design TDP Network Operations

item.title: Manager Outside Plant Planning & Engineering Design TDP Network Operations
item.description: Details: At AT&T, our job is to deliver the future before anyone else. We do this with people. People who want to create and deliver new technology that can transform the lives of our customers, our communities and our society. Our professionals innovate every day, whether they are working on upgrading our wireless and broadband infrastructure or delivering new possibilities for our consumer and business customers. They make the impossible, possible. The TDP-Network Operations program is a college hire development program that provides the opportunity for participants to collaborate with project teams while gaining broad experience across the AT&T Network Operations organization. This program will allow you to gain the professional development and peer/leadership support that will help you jump start your career with AT&T. Being part of this program will help you build your technical, problem-solving, communication, and analytical skills to achieve real impact at a much earlier stage than many of your peers. It will also give you the ability to have plenty of networking opportunities that include key executive leadership sessions, business area and industry overview presentations, volunteer and social activities and Individual team member responsibilities. After the initial training, you will continue to showcase your skills on a variety of technical platforms, disciplines and strategic project areas and support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations. Specifically, as an Manager Outside Plant Planning & Engineering Design, your primary responsibilities will include Working as a Manager of Outside Planning & Design, you will be responsible for the analyszing outside plant feeder facilities, current capacity planning, and issuing capital projects as required to support growth and company initiatives. You will closely coordinate with Network Planning, Design Engineering, and Equipment Engineering groups. Responsible for the planning and analysis of the outside plant feeder facilities. Develop two to five-year views of capacity requirements; issue projects as needed to meet forecasted demands and individual service requests. Additional Responsibilities: • Review/analyze capacity information in several software tools which track loop facility deployment and usage. • Develop and document fiber facility plans to accomodate growth and expansion of Ethernet network • Administer loop fiber capacity • Analyze network data to determine timing and location of Loop Electronics needs • Create, support/document, and approve capital undertakings • Coordinate closely with Loop Electronics Engineering and Transmission Equipment Engineering peers to ensure timely completion of projects • Project Manage undertakings as needed. • Meet Quality standards for all undertakings. Note: Additional skills / competencies may be added to this specific requisition. During the application process, you will be asked to provide your proficiency and experience with all the skills / competencies associated with the requisition. Four-year Engineering/ technical degree, or must qualify on the Engineering Selection Module (ESM) test • Strong verbal and written communication skills • Strong experience with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) •Must be able to build and maintain relationships with coordinates in other work groups. • Must have a satisfactory driving record and valid driver’s license AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position. Keywords: Manager Outside Plant Planning & Engineering Design TDP Network Operations

item.title: Retail Sales Consultant-Bilingual Spanish
item.description: Details: AT&T: So Much More of What You Work For Looking for an opportunity where you can put your energy and enthusiasm to work to create unlimited earning potential? Of course you are. How about a chance to learn, grow and advance with the number one wireless company in America? Even better. We're AT&T, and the only thing we enjoy more than pioneering and selling the latest devices is helping people make the most of them. Our retail opportunities are among the best, offering you great pay, strong benefits, advancement potential and a work environment full of fast-paced fun. Opportunity, Security and Great People Find out what it's like to work in an industry that's not about to slow down- with a company that has a legacy of successful innovation. Start with the paycheck: Base plus commission. Our current full-time Retail Sales Consultants earn an average of $47,175.00 in total compensation in the first year when successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals. Our top sellers earn an average of $55,521 per year. Add a full benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, paid time off, work/life resources and discounts on AT&T products and services Round out your experience with training on the latest technologies and devices today, tomorrow and for as long as you work with us As you learn and succeed, you'll be eligible for new opportunities and financial rewards And every day, you'll work in a fast-paced environment with customers and colleagues that appreciate your energy and assistance JOB DESCRIPTION Develop and attain customer experience and sales objectives for store. Sell all products and services offered by the Company. Meet all sales objectives. Handle all administrative aspects of the sale including: completing customer contracts and warranties, pulling products from inventory, accepting customer payments and filing the completed orders. Maintain strong knowledge of all products, accessories, pricing plans, promotions and service features. Maintain knowledge of competitive offers and provide critical market feedback to the Store Manager regarding local competition and product/service needs. Handle service inquiries from customers. Provide efficient, courteous customer service and assist in all aspects of product offerings and services. Ensure an extraordinary customer experience. Position may be commissioned and quota based. GENERAL DUTIES The essential functions listed below are representative of duties performed by this job title. Duties generally include but are not limited to the following: GENERAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS WHICH ARE NORMALLY REQUIRED: Possess a competitive spirit and desire to meet and exceed sales goals Stay up-to-date on the latest data/entertainment technology and devices, such as Wi-Fi, data devices, TV entertainment tools Understand customers' needs and help them discover how our products meet those needs Multi-task in a fast paced team environment Educate and engage customers through product demonstrations Interact with customers and provide prompt and courteous customer service to all customers The successful candidate will be able to perform the following with or without reasonable accommodation: Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends and holidays Ability to stand for long periods of time Ability to complete all paperwork completely, accurately, in a timely manner Ability to lift up to 25 pounds Ability to operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax Ability to work in other locations as the needs of the business dictate may be required. Complete all aspects of opening and closing the store in accordance with written procedures. Submit all transaction journals on a daily basis. Assists with inventory maintenance May be required to wear a uniform Desired Qualifications: 1-3 years retail/customer facing/sales experience preferred. Retail Sales Consultants are paid a competitive hourly rate and can earn additional monthly commission dollars by meeting and/or exceeding sales objectives! Provisions listed in these job descriptions may be changed or modified by AT&T Mobility without prior notice at any time, at the Company's sole discretion. Keywords: Sales, Part Time, Entry Level, Customer Service, Retail Associate, Sales Associate, Retail, Sales Representative, Bilingual, Spanish, New College Gradate, Recent College Graduate, Entry-level AT&T Retail Sales Consultant Bilingual Spanish (East Bay CA Stores)

item.title: Premises Technician
item.description: Details: LOOKING FOR A COMPANY THAT VALUES YOUR POTENTIAL? A job with AT&T as a Premises Technician can provide you with exactly that! Take advantage of our paid training and wide range of career possibilities. AT&T offers a competitive salary, company provided vehicles and tools and benefits that include medical, dental, paid vacation, and more! Our Premises Technicians work both inside and outside and are responsible for the installation and customer care of the new U-verse integrated digital TV, high speed Internet and voice services. What you'll do as an AT&T Premises Technician: Educate customers on service features and functionality Verify all services are working correctly Install and rearrange inside wires Possibly work in small confined spaces or aloft (up to 28ft) Work with hand tools Work outdoors in all kinds of weather Click here to learn more about this job from AT&T employees! item.title: Director Employment Tax and Benefits
item.description: Details: This Director Employment Taxes and Benefits will support the Director Tax. Provides strategic direction for the development and implementation of tax strategies, policies, and reporting of taxes, for a broad functional area through several department managers within the company having overall responsibility for planning, budgeting, implementing and maintaining costs methods and employees. Responsible for federal and state benefit plan filings. May be responsible for only one or two levels of taxation making the final decisions on administrative or operational matters and ensures effective achievement of objectives. Researches and advises senior and executive level management on taxation implications of business decisions, mergers and acquisitions, business plans and legislative changes at the local, State, Federal and International levels. Participates with other senior managers to establish corporate strategic plans and objectives across the enterprise. Oversees due diligence tax work performed on projects, mergers and acquisition, and other highly sensitive projects at the request of senior and/or executive management. Responsibilities: Responsible for benefit tax planning and reporting Assist with tax efficient international planning and international tax reporting responsibilities as the Company expands globally.Assist with managing and resolving tax audits related to federal, state and local income tax reporting. Liaise with operating management on tax issues and accounting staff on tax accounting issues. Work with internal and external legal and human resource personnel to ensure that federal, state, and local legislative changes impacting employee benefits are properly reflected in company benefit plans. Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Master’s Degree in Business Taxation preferred. CPA a must. 5+ years Employment Tax/Taxation of Benefits in Corporate/Public Accounting. 10+ years Corporate Tax - Public Accounting. Strong leadership, analytical, written, verbal and presentation communication skills. Ability to think strategically and critically. Ability to work independently and make decisions. Technical Income Tax Knowledge. Keywords: Director Employment Tax and Benefits

Own the store’s service customer experience! Responsible for troubleshooting effectively and then resolving and/or following up on customer issues, ensuring our customers needs are addressed promptly, and communicating with the management team effectively. Ensure positive experience for our internal/external customers by maintaining the integrity of store operating procedures including but not limited to: Inventory management, cash management, point of sale paperwork/recordkeeping, assists in the adherence to store merchandising standards, and the safety and security requirements in the store. Operate various internal tools and systems, terminal consoles and peripheral devices, and maintain time sensitive daily, weekly, and monthly records with a high degree of detail and accuracy. Act as the operational liaison between agents, vendors, customers and various AT&T departments. May sell all products and services offered by the company. Answer inbound calls and assist sales representatives and customers by performing quick hit sales transactions. Perform other duties as assigned by management. GENERAL DUTIES The functions listed below are representative of duties performed by this job title. Duties generally include but are not limited to the following: GENERAL ESSENTIAL FUNCTION WHICH ARE NORMALLY REQUIRED: Customer Experience and Sales •Deliver AT&T’s “Our Retail Promise” •Welcome customers to our store, coordinate check-in process and customer flow •Function as a customer experience advocate •Assist with sales when needed •Work in a team environment to meet and exceed assigned goals Store Operations (*may or may not not be required in all locations) •Inventory management - including counts, ordering, maintaining, receiving, returning, tracking and securing equipment and supplies •Perform operational tasks to maintain audit-ready status in store at all times •Prepare bank deposits •Balance cash drawer •Process and prepare paperwork for recordkeeping and report generation •Assist with store merchandising MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: •Perform the following with reasonable accommodation: o Work flexible hours (including evenings, weekends and holidays) o Stand for long periods of time o Ability to lift up to 25 pounds o Operate a personal computer, wireless equipment, copier and fax o Work in other locations as the needs of the business dictate what may be required o May be required to wear a uniform or company apparel as designated by management PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: •Associate Degree •1+ years of relevant work experience •Telecommunications industry knowledge •Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills and attention to detail •Strong working knowledge of computer systems/software and computerized billing •Strong customer service skills •Thorough research skills Provisions listed in these Job Descriptions may be changed or modified by AT&T Mobility without prior notice at any time, at the Company's sole discretion. item.title: Lead Manager Planning and Communications
item.description: Details: Job Description: Reporting to the Associate Director Planning, Forecasting & Results (PFR), the Lead Manager of Planning and Communications will support planning and driving ideas to projects for eServices efforts and coordinate communications of portfolio status, results, and implementation planning to CDE teams and leadership and other relevant groups within AT&T. This position plays a key, integral role in providing the details and focus needed to assure optimum planning and communications for eServices projects/enhancements, thus facilitating the ability to effectively meet the demands of the business. The responsibilities include: Contribute to the business efforts for providing accurate planning and communications development, and direct and manage, if applicable, appropriate staff support positions Participate in a data-driven approach to support eServices in planning and prioritization, implementation, and sustainment of eServices portfolio projects Work with appropriate groups within AT&T to determine planning development capacity, timelines, and risks for implementation schedules Implement and manage the defined approach for the eServices organization planning for new and enhanced capabilities Collaborate with Operations, Adoption, and Results teams to support planning tactics and procedures in support of online capabilities/products Oversee and prepare digital servicing communications to external teams and the Digital Leadership team Provide coordination of Ops review Work with Metrics and other relevant groups to define, coordinate, and report results and the business impact of ongoing customer transactions/interactions, especially related to new or enhanced capabilities to ensure solid planning Support product managers with defining specific product KPIs for ongoing assessment of product performance and use with identifying enhancement opportunities. Have extensive knowledge of a customer KPIs and assist with regular monitoring of KPI results Partner with other appropriate AT&T organizations to share results, drive alignment, gather input and drive a cohesive cross-channel experience Prepare organizational information for onboarding new employees and contractors Prepare and present departmental level briefings of capabilities, projects and key metrics Required Skills, Experience, and Education: 2+ years of communications for a variety of internal teams and groups within a multi-faceted corporate environment 2+ years of experience using data/metrics in problem solving and analysis of issues and driving decisions and results. Experience defining key metrics and reporting needs. 2+ years working in a highly collaborative, cross-functional environment with multiple teams 1+ years working in defining business case benefit assumptions and developing inputs to business cases 1+ years of planning experience Demonstrated leadership capabilities in a fast-paced, growth environment Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal skills. Ability to prepare concise presentations and interface well with multiple disciplines Experience working across multiple business groups of a multi-level organization Self-starter, familiar with planning, forecasting, and reporting processes as it relates to the telecom industry Good decision-making skills and ability to generate ideas and solutions for opportunities and issues Fast learner, highly intuitive with technology end-user solutions and their real world applications Desired: Bachelor or MBA preferred Experience working with projects through a software development lifecycle Project or program management experience Experience writing business requirements Previous industry experience in Telecom Keywords: Lead Manager Planning and Communications

item.title: Manager OSP Planning & Engineering Design TDP Network Operations
item.description: Details: At AT&T, our job is to deliver the future before anyone else. We do this with people. People who want to create and deliver new technology that can transform the lives of our customers, our communities and our society. Our professionals innovate every day, whether they are working on upgrading our wireless and broadband infrastructure or delivering new possibilities for our consumer and business customers. They make the impossible, possible. The TDP-Network Operations program is a college hire development program that provides the opportunity for participants to collaborate with project teams while gaining broad experience across the AT&T Network Operations organization. This program will allow you to gain the professional development and peer/leadership support that will help you jump start your career with AT&T. Being part of this program will help you build your technical, problem-solving, communication, and analytical skills to achieve real impact at a much earlier stage than many of your peers. It will also give you the ability to have plenty of networking opportunities that include key executive leadership sessions, business area and industry overview presentations, volunteer and social activities and Individual team member responsibilities. After the initial training, you will continue to showcase your skills on a variety of technical platforms, disciplines and strategic project areas and support key strategic initiatives across Network Operations. Specifically, as an Manager OSP Planning & Engineering Design , your primary responsibilities will include Candidates will be responsible for the planning, design and analysis of the outside plant facilities/network. The candidate will need to support all practices and initiatives while engineering and designing a quality product to deliver service to all our customers in a timely manner. This position will require an individual that is detail oriented, has a strong desire to learn all aspects of the job, has the ability to produce results and is a team player. As a Manager of Outside Planning & Engineering Design, you will be responsible for the planning, design and analysis of the outside plant facilities/network. Members of the design team are required to meet with customers face to face to determine service requirements and interpret their needs in detailed facility design drawings that our Construction teams will execute within the customer's desired time frame. You will also be required to team with other internal organizations to negotiate service intervals and schedules on behalf of our customers as well as project manage every job from "cradle to grave" to meet our required metrics. As an engineer you will monitor expenditures to ensure incurred costs are within authorized levels and will be responsible for the coordination of the construction budget and project management activities. You will also develop action plans with other work groups to reduce expenses through facility replacement, modernization of plant, bulk recovery of defective plant and records corrections. Degree: Engineering degree from a four year accredited College or University Required Skills: Experience with CAD and Microsoft Office Suite. Must have strong written and verbal comunication skills, the ability to interact with all levels of management as well as professional deportment to interact with customers. Stong Project Management skills and the ability to multi task/ prioritize work are a must. OSP Design Engineering and/or Construction experience is a plus. Must have a satisfactory driving record and a valid, current DL. AT&T will not sponsor applicants for work visas of any kind for this position. Keywords: Manager OSP Planning & Engineering Design TDP Network Operations

item.title: Principal Technical Architect Cricket Wireless
item.description: Details: Overall Purpose : Responsible for translating business needs into technical solutions, and defining solutions to problems through reasoned application of information technology. Key Roles and Responsibilities : Designs, develops, documents and analyzes overall architecture of systems, including hardware and software. Determines integrated hardware and software architecture solutions that meet performance, usability, scalability, reliability, and security needs. Coordinates design and integration of total system including subsystems. Researches and recommends technology to improve the current systems. Job Contribution: Expert level technical professional. Technical authority Subject Matter Expert (SME) within organization. Contributes through own development of advanced technologies/concepts with global reach or industry application. Has direct impact on creation of technical products/services. Serves as a role model and mentor. KNOWLEDGE Has extensive specialized technical expertise. Applies expert knowledge and broad understanding of multiple disciplines. Integrates expert knowledge of technical principles/methods of multiple disciplines with knowledge of products/services and internal operations. Advisor on ATT technologies/systems/procedures. ANALYSIS/PROBLEM SOLVING Solves complex, critical problems related to significant and unique issues. Uses extensive research and interpretative thinking. Utilizes innovative methods in developing solutions. Works on abstract problems requiring evaluation of intangible variables. INDEPENDENCE Guided by functional goals/objectives. May influence organization goals/objectives. Applies discretion to develop innovative solutions to problems without precedent. CONTRIBUTION TO ATT TECHNOLOGY Lead contributor on critical projects/technology initiatives. Develops enterprise wide integrated solutions. Contributes to complex and innovative business solutions to achieve strategic objectives. COMMUNICATION Provides technical expertise to peers across the company. Actively promotes good working relationships. Develops mutually beneficial strategic alliances with customers. Technical Career Pathway (TCP) role. Entry into this title may require TCP Governance Board Review. Supervisory: No. Required Qualifications - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Telecommunications, Electrical Engineering or related field 8-10 years related technical architect experience Proficient in engineering cost estimates and economic analyses and models Knowledge of wireless technologies standards and protocols (3GPP, Wi-Fi, WiMax, antennas, amplifiers, base stations, propagation, interference, spectrum) Proficient in voice, video, and app technologies/protocols (circuit, VoIP, SIP, IMS, AIN, Camel, etc.) Proficient in network and system architecture (subsystems, interfaces, hw/sw dependencies). Proficient in message and conference systems and networks (multiple media, notification, presence, unified communications, video). Knowledge in Network Management, Tools and Protocols (Configuration, IP network Address Management, Perf, Mgmt). Understands Virtualization, Storage and Content Delivery Networks (Cloud, CDM, Grid, SAN). Proficient in specifying and evaluating architecture requirements for RFXs. Desired Qualifications - Enterprise wide deployment planning and support for mission critical applications for major releases, both business and infrastructure related Develops technical documentation on applications and systems Ability to work with technical and business-oriented teams Keywords: Principal Technical Architect Cricket Wireless

item.description: Details: At AT&T, our job is to deliver the future before anyone else. We do this with people. People who want to create and deliver new technology that can transform the lives of our customers, our communities and our society. Our professionals innovate every day, whether they are working on upgrading our wireless and broadband infrastructure or delivering new possibilities for our consumer and business customers. The TDP-Network Operations program is a college hire development program that provides the opportunity for participants to collaborate with project teams while gaining broad experience across the AT&T Network Operations organization. This program will allow you to gain the professional development and peer/leadership support that will help you jump start your career with AT&T.
