item.title: Diesel Mechanic - 1m
item.description: Details: Job Overview Primary Purpose and Essential Functions: To perform thorough inspections and related repairs on equipment owned or operated by Swift Transportation as directed by supervisor. Assist in the diagnosis and repairs of the tractor/trailer fleet Assist in the completion of all necessary tags and work orders Assist in the moving of equipment on/off the Safety Lane and around the yard Maintains a clean and safe area Skills: Demonstrated/proven superior customer service skills; valid drivers license; ability to read and understand repair manuals, understanding and ability to complete/fill tags and repair orders; computer keyboarding. Education: High School Diploma GED or graduation from Trade/Technical school preferred. Valid drivers license required. Experience Required: Requires successful placement and designated scoring on M-Grade testing aptitude test. Position Requirements Demonstrated/proven superior customer service skills; valid drivers license; ability to read and understand repair manuals, understanding and ability to complete/fill tags and repair orders; computer keyboarding. Required Education High School Diploma GED or graduation from Trade/Technical school preferred. Valid drivers license required. Required Experience Requires successful placement and designated scoring on M-Grade testing aptitude test.

item.title: Site Verification Representative
item.description: Details: JOB SUMMARY: Respond to alerts in the National Communications Center (NCC) from the post confirmation (PoCo) system. Provide responsive and reliable assistance by exercising good judgment and by using good customer service skills at all times. Take appropriate action to assure that the Company is providing the best service to its customers and clients. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job or position. Specific duties or tasks may vary and be documented separately. An associate might or might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity. Monitor Post Confirmation System (PoCo) to respond to all alerts as they occur during the course of the shift. Respond appropriately to PoCo alerts by evaluating the situation and reviewing the office profiles on what steps to take. Involves routing messages and immediately contacting appropriate field supervision to respond to open posts. Inform NCC and/or field management of any serious safety or business jeopardy situations. Produce written Call Reports that are concise, informative, and accurate. Ensure that departmental standards regarding quality and productivity are maintained. Advise shift supervision of any changes in office profiles or database information that needs to be updated. Seek out updates when talking to field management so that the NCC database information is current, to proficiently respond to field operation requirements. Provide ongoing administrative support for the NCC and assistance to shift supervision. Respond to office schedule and profile changes by accurately entering information into system and communicating changes to appropriate shift supervision and or field office personnel in a timely manner. Perform other duties as requested by management.

item.title: Region Business Development Assistant
item.description: Details: JOB SUMMARY: Provides broad-based administrative support for Region business development efforts. Maintains various databases, office records, calendars and travel itineraries. Produces, verifies, and analyzes reports for distribution. Carries out direct mail program for Region. Answers questions about the company’s services. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS The functions listed describe the business purpose of this job. Specific duties or tasks may vary and be documented separately. The employee might not be required to perform all functions listed. Additional duties may be assigned, and functions may be modified, according to business necessity. All assigned duties or tasks are deemed to be part of the essential functions, unless such duties or tasks are unrelated to the functions listed, in which case they are deemed to be other (non-essential) functions. Employees are held accountable for successful job performance. Job performance standards may be documented separately, and may include functions, objectives, duties or tasks not specifically listed herein. In performing functions, duties or tasks, employees are required to know and follow safe work practices, and to be aware of company policies and procedures related to job safety, including safety rules and regulations. Employees are required to notify superiors upon becoming aware of unsafe working conditions. All functions, duties or tasks are to be carried out in an honest, ethical and professional manner, and to be performed in conformance with applicable company policies and procedures. In the event of uncertainty or lack of knowledge of company policies and procedures, employees are required to request clarification or explanations from superiors or authorized company representatives. Provides broad-based administrative support for Region business development efforts, including maintaining databases, office records, calendars and travel itineraries. Maintains, tracks and verifies information from Business Development Managers and Branch or Area offices within the Region for administrative purposes and to use in direct mail campaigns. Administers the Region’s direct mail campaign; prints direct mail materials, prepares mailing lists, stuffs envelopes, and mails materials to prospects. Tracks and analyzes Business Development Manager and management reports as required, including proposal tracking and activity reports. Maintains and tracks Region database information including rate increases, acquisitions and solutions sales activities. Maintains, tracks and reports the Region’s gain / loss report. Tracks, reports and assists with any Region business development information as needed. Provides administrative assistance in the business development cycle through verification of references, proposal preparation, preparation of presentation materials, and prospect research. May provide additional administrative support to the Region office as required. Performs tasks and duties of a similar nature and scope as required for assignment.

item.title: Diesel Mechanic - 5m
item.description: Details: Job Overview Primary Purpose and Essential Functions: To perform thorough inspections and related repairs on equipment owned or operated by Swift Transportation as directed by supervisor. Perform the diagnosis and repairs of the tractor/trailer fleet Perform the completion of all necessary tags and work orders Safely move equipment in/out of the shop and around the yard Maintains a clean and safe work area May also be designated as a "Foreman" but will also perform 5M functions Skills: Demonstrated/proven superior customer service skills; valid drivers license; ability to read and understand repair manuals, understanding and ability to complete/fill tags and repair orders; ability to use and learn various diagnostic software used on tractor/trailers. Education: High School Diploma/GED or graduation from an accredited technical school with a certificate in a mechanical related field preferred. Education/Aptitude testing may substitute for required experience. Valid drivers license required. Experience Required: Requires successful placement and designated scoring on M-Grade testing aptitude test and thirty-six (36) months mechanical related experience in the Transportation, heavy equipment, Agriculture, or Automotive Industry. Position Requirements Demonstrated/proven superior customer service skills; valid drivers license; ability to read and understand repair manuals, understanding and ability to complete/fill tags and repair orders; ability to use and learn various diagnostic software used on tractor/trailers. Required Education High School Diploma/GED or graduation from an accredited technical school with a certificate in a mechanical related field preferred. Education/Aptitude testing may substitute for required experience. Valid drivers license required. Required Experience Requires successful placement and designated scoring on M-Grade testing aptitude test and thirty-six (36) months mechanical related experience in the Transportation, heavy equipment, Agriculture, or Automotive Industry.

item.title: Trailer Mechanic - 4mt
item.description: Details: Job Overview Primary Purpose and Essential Functions: To perform thorough inspections and related repairs on equipment owned or operated by Swift Transportation as directed by supervisor. Perform Preventative Maintenance Inspections to comply with DOT regulations. Performs proper diagnosis and repairs of the trailer fleet. Performs Minor/Major trailer damage repairs. Completes all necessary tags and work orders. Responsible for moving equipment on/off the Safety Lane and around the yard. Maintains a clean and safe work area. Maintain a positive work atmosphere by acting and communicating in a manner which facilitates the success of business operations in order to meet company demands and expectations. Performs additional duties as assigned by leadership Skills: Demonstrated/proven superior customer service skills; valid drivers license; ability to read and understand repair manuals, understanding and ability to complete/fill tags and repair orders; computer keyboarding. Education: High School Diploma GED or graduation/certificate from trade/techinical school preferred. Education/aptitude testing may substitute for required experience. Valid drivers license required. May require CDL at designated terminal shop locations. Experience Required: Requires successful placement and designated scoring on M-Grade testing aptitude test and eighteen (18) months mechanical related experience in the Transportation, heavy equipment, Agriculture, or Automotive Industry. Position Requirements Demonstrated/proven superior customer service skills; valid drivers license; ability to read and understand repair manuals, understanding and ability to complete/fill tags and repair orders; computer keyboarding. Required Education High School Diploma GED or graduation/certificate from trade/techinical school preferred. Education/aptitude testing may substitute for required experience. Valid drivers license required. May require CDL at designated terminal shop locations. Required Experience Requires successful placement and designated scoring on M-Grade testing aptitude test and eighteen (18) months mechanical related experience in the Transportation, heavy equipment, Agriculture, or Automotive Industry.

item.title: Trailer Mechanic - 5mt
item.description: Details: Job Overview Primary Purpose and Essential Functions: To perform thorough inspections and related repairs on equipment owned or operated by Swift Transportation as directed by supervisor. Perform Preventative Maintenance Inspections to comply with DOT Regulations. Perform diagnostics and repairs of the trailer fleet (Body/Suspension). Responsible for complete trailer wreck rebuild. Responsible for diagnostics and repairs of the trailer fleet (Brakes, ABS, Electronics). Responsible for completion of all necessary tags and work orders. May assist with moving of equipment on/off the Safety Lane and around the yard. Maintains a clean and safe work area. May perform light tractor repair as needed. Maintain a positive work atmosphere by acting and communicating in a manner which facilitates the success of business operations in order to meet company demands and expectations. May perform additional duties as assigned by leadership. Skills: Demonstrated/proven superior customer service skills; valid drivers license; ability to read and understand repair manuals, understanding and ability to complete/fill tags and repair orders; computer keyboarding. Education: High School Diploma GED or graduation/certificate from trade/techinical school preferred. Education/aptitude testing may substitute for required experience. Valid drivers license required. May require CDL at designated terminal shop locations. Experience Required: Requires successful placement and designated scoring on M-Grade testing aptitude test and twenty-four (24) months mechanical related experience in the Transportation, heavy equipment, Agriculture, or Automotive Industry. Position Requirements Demonstrated/proven superior customer service skills; valid drivers license; ability to read and understand repair manuals, understanding and ability to complete/fill tags and repair orders; computer keyboarding. Required Education High School Diploma GED or graduation/certificate from trade/techinical school preferred. Education/aptitude testing may substitute for required experience. Valid drivers license required. May require CDL at designated terminal shop locations. Required Experience Requires successful placement and designated scoring on M-Grade testing aptitude test and twenty-four (24) months mechanical related experience in the Transportation, heavy equipment, Agriculture, or Automotive Industry.

item.title: Diesel Mechanic - 4m
item.description: Details: Job Overview Primary Purpose and Essential Functions: To perform thorough inspections and related repairs on equipment owned or operated by Swift Transportation as directed by supervisor. item.description: Details: Are you looking for an opportunity to help take your career to the next level? Our client is a Wholesale Broker that has been in business for 13 years. item.title: Toddler Teacher
item.description: Details: JOB DESCRIPTION The Goddard School® located at 16755 County Road 24, Plymouth, MN , an early childhood education center, is currently seeking qualified Toddler Teacher . The Goddard School® is a renowned program with a Piaget (Learning through Play) based foundation and a leader in the franchised preschool industry which is growing and continues to set the standard for excellence. The focus of the program is to provide a life-long love of learning. Our staff is made of loving and dedicated teachers who understand each child’s needs. They are highly qualified childhood educators who are able to use their creativity and the Goddard Developmental Guidelines as the basis for unique lesson plans that are brought to life in a fun and imaginative way. Teachers in a The Goddard School® must be professionally prepared as a teacher and meet the qualifications of their state and those set forth in the national standards for hiring for a teacher. They must, after an offer of employment is made, produce a current physical examination by a physician with a tuberculin test or chest x-ray, have approved state clearance forms for child abuse and a certificate demonstrating an approved criminal record check. They must have the ability to hear the conversational voice, with or without a hearing aid, and demonstrate the ability to see and read newsprint, with or without corrective lenses, to speak and be understood under normal circumstances. In addition, they must be able to lift and carry children and other items weighing up to 50 pounds, use arms hands, legs and feet, with or without corrective devices, to accomplish the job, including the evacuation of the building during emergencies. Please indicate salary requirements on resume or cover letter.

item.title: Enterprise Data Warehouse Analyst
item.description: Details: The Enterprise Data Analyst will be required to support EDW program stand-up (e.g., process definition/documentation), strategy definition (e.g., roadmap creation), and daily operations management . Must be a US Citizen. Responsibilities include, but not limited to: Provide face-to-face interaction and accountability with clients and contractor personnel Create and/or update business process designs/definitions to support EDW program stand-up Support the create and/or update program level documentation (e.g., project charter, DODAF/Architecture Models, RTM, Project Plan, IPR/checkpoint/gate reviews, status, project planning, reporting) Leverage SAP BI product knowledge (e.g., BW, Design Studio, HANA) to support EDW strategy/roadmap Effectively and comfortably communicate with client/contractor personnel possessing all ranges of technical ability, personality, and disposition Develop positive client relationships within own area of responsibility Maximize personal productivity with reduced dependence on supervisor's input Structure own or others' activities to minimize delays, wasted effort, or rework Conduct work planning/prioritization for own or others' activities Assist team members in completing their work or acquiring skills as needed Actively contribute to maintaining a collaborative work environment Project Background: The Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) currently possesses two large scale data warehouse systems (SAP Business Warehouse and Fusion Center) that house similar data, but are transformed differently which results in data inconsistencies. DLA has requested assistance to move towards a single data warehouse solution by migrating existing reporting and analysis capabilities (data/display layers) into their core SAP Business Intelligence (BI) environment and to simplify the distribution of data to external partners. This consolidation will result in the elimination of redundant capabilities, reduced storage and licensing costs, and improved data consistency. This individual will be required to work with DLA and contractor personnel to develop, test, and deploy Fusion Center capabilities within the Enterprise Data Warehouse architecture.

Manual CMM Optical Comparator Hardness Testers Inspection Hand Tools Automated CMM knowledge a plus! If this so, here's what we're looking for from you: A two year associate degree or equivalent of 4 years manufacturing experience 4 years Inspection experience EOE/AA Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran #CB

item.title: QE Engineer
item.description: Details: This is a “hands on” position where the person will be expected to dive into the requirements of the Quality Engineering department, and design and develop manual and automated regression tests to be implemented in a new platform. It is expected that the candidate in this position will work with Software Development groups, QE Automation Engineers, as well as in-house and over-seas contracted personnel. The candidate will have strong lab management skills, possessing the ability to configure servers at the hardware and software levels. Solid communications and project management skills will be required. The person must satisfy required experience and must be passionate about staying current with the latest test testing methodologies on the market, as well as constantly striving to apply the latest in enhancement techniques into the IPC test platforms. RESPONSIBILITIES The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing and developing a cost effective, long-term test strategy promoting reusable components, low maintenance costs, high efficiency and scalability. The scope of the position is: Design, research and develop components of test architecture for a new platform. Design an infrastructure to validate the requirements, functionality and performance goals for the particular product Identify the bottlenecks in the system during architecture and design Develop the performance test harness for execution on automated, performance, and endurance testing platforms Work with and potentially support off-shore automation and performance development resources, as well as contracted “on-site” personnel resources when required. Interact with development engineers to design and implement functional, performance interface applications when necessary. Be responsible for the specification and installation of required hardware and software for automation projects. Conduct documentation reviews for performance automation documents developed by QE automation engineers. Specify automation platform operation: automation servers, operating systems, simulator applications, automaton applications, and future automation environments. Plan and manage rollouts of enhancement and maintenance upgrades to performance automation platforms when necessary.

Accountability Completion of an accurate application, and compliance with all applicable compliance regulations relating to mortgage loan origination. Compliance with applicable underwriting guidelines for mortgage programs. Mortgage production and sales goals as established by Mortgage Services Manager.

item.title: Maintenance Engineer
item.description: Details: Job is located in Troutman, NC. Maintenance Engineer Engineered Sintered Components Company Inc., a Sumitomo Electric Group company, is looking for a Maintenance Engineer in our Troutman, North Carolina office. The primary role of the reliability engineer is to identify and manage asset reliability risks that could adversely affect plant or business operations. Job Duties and Responsibilities - Develop plans for equipment overhauls, equipment shut down/start up and PM/PDM scheduling. - Analyzes effectiveness of PM/PDM programs and develops/implements improvements. - Analyzes repetitive equipment failures and implements counter-measures. - Provides technical guidance and training to Technicians. - Assess maintenance costs and develops cost reduction activities. - Assess the overall needs for technical skill development of technicians. - Communicates and report to Engineering & Production groups on current status of major maintenance activities. - Coordinate with lead hands on a daily basis for assessment of support needs. - Submits written monthly reports providing analysis on MTTR, MTBF and overall equipment reliability. Qualifications - High School Diploma or GED. - A.A.S. in industry field or related experience. - Proven steady work history. If you have a resume, please click “Apply with Resume” button and upload or paste your resume there. If you do n o t have a resume, please click “Apply with Resume” button, then click “Paste your Resume” button, then type “No resume” in the space provided. Then, you will be directed to complete an application form online. About Engineered Sintered Components Company Engineered Sintered Components Company (ESC) is a manufacturer of powder metal components supplying the automotive industries. We are located 30 miles north of Charlotte in the heart of Troutman, North Carolina on 90 acres. Our campus consists of two facilities totaling 210,000 square feet and an employment level of 470 employees. Our original plant houses the main powder metal processing equipment and our newest facility was completed in 2004 and is a separate machining area for high accuracy part production. item.title: Maintenance Engineer
item.description: Details: Job is located in Troutman, NC. Maintenance Engineer Engineered Sintered Components Company Inc., a Sumitomo Electric Group company, is looking for a Maintenance Engineer in our Troutman, North Carolina office. The primary role of the reliability engineer is to identify and manage asset reliability risks that could adversely affect plant or business operations. Job Duties and Responsibilities - Develop plans for equipment overhauls, equipment shut down/start up and PM/PDM scheduling. - Analyzes effectiveness of PM/PDM programs and develops/implements improvements. - Analyzes repetitive equipment failures and implements counter-measures. - Provides technical guidance and training to Technicians. - Assess maintenance costs and develops cost reduction activities. - Assess the overall needs for technical skill development of technicians. - Communicates and report to Engineering & Production groups on current status of major maintenance activities. - Coordinate with lead hands on a daily basis for assessment of support needs. - Submits written monthly reports providing analysis on MTTR, MTBF and overall equipment reliability. Qualifications - High School Diploma or GED. - A.A.S. in industry field or related experience. - Proven steady work history. If you have a resume, please click “Apply with Resume” button and upload or paste your resume there. item.title: Specialty Pharmacy Technician
item.description: Details: The Specialty Pharmacy Technician supports pharmacy workflow by providing timely turnaround of Specialty Pharmacy medications. This includes extensive communication with CIGNA customers, health plans, claim processors and internal staff to resolve processing problems. Work the Specialty Pharmacy order from all workstations & know all the various depts. procedures. Walk orders through the system as needed for STAT delivery. Answer all incoming calls in a timely & professional manner. Work with the Lead and Supervisor to suggest system enhancements, new business procedures & good customer service processes. Responsibilities: Process Specialty Pharmacy medications within established guidelines, while providing detailed documentation via internal and external systems. Use and understand MailRx systems including, but not limited to, the following: 1) Specialty Order Entry, 2) Specialty Item Entry, 3) Patient Services, 4) Specialty Failed Claims, 5) Ship-to Confirmation, 6) Screening Tech, 7) Screening Tech Exceptions, 8) Screening Doctor Call Back. Employ and discern all claim processing system menus including, but not limited to, the following: 1) Member, 2) NDC, 3) Claimtest, 4) Claim, 5) Provider, 6) Planlist BP, 7) Auth, 8) Pharmacy, 9) Client. Support Customer Service in providing accurate and timely responses relating to order status, claim handling issues, and special processing circumstances as they arise. Provide detailed customer service for each order from beginning to end of the life of an order. Utilize multiple eligibility systems to accurately enter member information including, but not limited to the following: Argus GUI, Benefit Access and iCare. Be available to handle all incoming calls in a timely & professional manner. Initiate and/or respond to customer correspondence pertaining to new prescriptions, claim adjustments, payment inquiries, processing questions, or other product related inquiries. Work the order as required from Specialty workstations. Walk orders through the system as needed for STAT deliveries. Assist supervisory personnel in the development and maintenance of injectable processing. Assist in providing on-the-job training to new staff members when requested. Demonstrate good decision making skills and problem solving techniques. Take incoming calls, make outgoing calls in a timely manner while maintaining department stats. Other job related duties as assigned.

item.title: Project Manager, Pharmaceutical Development
item.description: Details: AAIPharma Services is a leading provider of drug development and manufacturing services to pharmaceutical, biotech and medical device companies around the world. With over thirty years of drug development expertise, we offer exciting and challenging career opportunities in a dynamic and growth oriented-business. Headquartered in coastal Wilmington, NC and just minutes from beautiful Wrightsville Beach, Wilmington is a vibrant city that boasts a variety of cultural resources, a strong business climate, and a family oriented environment. Wilmington is home to the University of North Carolina Wilmington, one of the top-ranked southern public universities. Wilmington has been recognized as one of the "The Best Places to Live" (Money Magazine) and ranked #13 as "Best Places for Business and Careers" (Forbes Magazine). Summary: The Project Manager is the key liaison for Client Product Development and Manufacturing projects at AAIPharma Services. Responsible for all daily project management and oversight of product development and CMC related activities (formulations, analytical, manufacturing, and packaging) to include the following: Key Job Responsibilities: Interact closely with assigned customers to ensure project scope and milestones are well defined. Build relationships with customers through frequent communication throughout the project and by ensuring their needs are met. Appropriately kick off, execute, and close out projects; educate client on AAI processes. Ensure team members understand project objectives, specifications, deliverables, timelines and tasks. Develop and track the project development plan using MS Project. Identify and track critical path/activities, risks, contingencies and alternatives. Communicate out-of-scope activities both internally and externally. Track project budget and implementing Change Orders. Facilitate team meetings with client and project team; setting-up sub-team meetings as necessary. Provide project status information both internally and externally through the use of project team meetings, minutes, e-mail, teleconferences, and direct communication. Maintain Client Dashboard site with current and relevant project information for each Client's project. Ensure the Project Coordinators have current information to maintain the Project Status Sheets and to execute on assigned project activities. Actively engage in and support business development efforts through ongoing contact with assigned clients Communicate budget related information to Business Analysts to aid invoicing and managing projected revenue. Lead business/project review meetings; support Clients during onsite visits, as needed. Qualifications: BS in a scientific and/or engineering discipline with at least 7 years of related pharmaceutical experience with at least 3+ years of project management experience managing multi-disciplinary project teams in a service business. Strong understanding of pharmaceutical product development and manufacturing. Strong knowledge of FDA regulation/ICH Guidelines, U.S. Drug Development process, Project Management Practices and Tools and ERP, CRM, and Documentation Systems and MS Project. PMP Certification preferred. Requires excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills; proficiency in Word, Excel; strong negotiation/ facilitation skills, strategic thinking and leadership skills; and a strong customer-service focus with the ability to professionally handle multiple priorities. We offer competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package and advancement opportunity. AAIPharma Services is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer M/F/D/V

item.title: Part Time Teller - Warsaw
item.description: Details: Summary: Performs financial transactions efficiently and accurately, and providing quality member service in a professional manner. Primary Responsibilities & Duties Maintains a high level of member service in accordance with the TCU Service Expectations. Responsible for maintaining a high level of confidentiality with regard to member account information. Ability to speak with members in an informative, knowledgeable, and helpful manner about TCU products and services to generate quality sales referrals. Responsible for processing member transactions in a proficient and accurate manner within security guidelines. May assume additional teller functions such as drawer audits, member account maintenance, and vault duties. Assumes additional duties as assigned by supervisor/manager. Assumes additional responsibilities as necessary for the continued growth and advancement of the Credit Union. FLSA Status Non-Exempt

item.title: Quality Engineer
item.description: Details: Job is located in Troutman, NC. Quality Engineer Engineered Sintered Components Company Inc., a Sumitomo Electric Group company, is looking for a Quality Engineer in our Troutman, North Carolina office. This person will improve manufacturing and quality by assisting in root cause analysis for non-conforming product, non-capable processes, and non-efficient operations in order to develop and implement countermeasures. Job Duties and Responsibilities - Assist root cause analysis on non-conforming material initiated through daily reviews of hold tags, scrap, or customer complaints. - Participate in new project development and APQP activities. - Support Process Engineering activities with data collection, process inspection, measurement inspection. - Support other QE’s, AE’s and PE’s with problem solving activities and implementation of CM’s. - Support Process Engineering activities to improve incoming and outgoing material quality from suppliers. Qualifications - B.S. Degree is preferred - 2+ years of experience in Quality in a manufacturing environment - Proven steady work history If you have a resume, please click “Apply with Resume” button and upload or paste your resume there. If you do n o t have a resume, please click “Apply with Resume” button, then click “Paste your Resume” button, then type “No resume” in the space provided. Then, you will be directed to complete an application form online. Our campus consists of two facilities totaling 210,000 square feet and an employment level of 470 employees. Our original plant houses the main powder metal processing equipment and our newest facility was completed in 2004 and is a separate machining area for high accuracy part production. item.title: Senior Cognos Developer
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: A Kforce client located south of downtown Cleveland, Ohio has a direct hire opportunity for a Senior Cognos Developer. This position sits within a leading edge BI department with an established history for innovation. Responsibilities and Expectations: Design, develop and deploy new OLAP cubes, reports and dashboards Maintain and modify existing OLAP cubes, reports & scorecards Design and develop complex Framework manager packages for ad-hoc reporting and report authoring Provide installation, configuration and ongoing technical support for Cognos 10.1 environment Troubleshoot performance related issues for reports, Framework Manager Packages Closely work with data warehouse team to ensure the data requirements are complete and accurate

item.title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER - JAVA / WEB SERVICES
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Our client is seeking a Software Engineer - JAVA / WEB SERVICES for their Scottsdale, AZ location. As a member of the team, you will develop software being used by thousands of customers worldwide. Job Summary: The Software Engineer - Java/Web Services will apply knowledge of software architecture and SDLC to perform tasks associated with designing, developing, or debugging software applications, build enhancements within existing software architecture and suggest improvements to the architecture/product. Job Responsibilities: Design, develop, create and maintain software for the company's suite of products, in all phases of the software development and maintenance cycle Lifecycle development phases include research, conceptual planning, design, scheduling, coding, code reviews, troubleshooting and debugging, and status reporting Maintain a focus on customer requirements and project objectives while mitigating project and product risk Troubleshoot and debug software programs, isolating and correcting customer reported defects Utilize superior debugging and problem solving skills to devise fixes for release to customers in the form of patches and service packs, and for integration into future products Design J2EE and Java application components as well as supporting data model Develop software product/solutions using a number of different technology stacks Perform unit testing to ensure quality Support Customer inquiries and customer issues for both internal as well as external customers

item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: A dynamic N. Scottsdale, AZ company is seeking an Accounting Supervisor to join their team. Duties will include the following: • Drive accounting for significant division • Management reporting • Audit support • Supervision of staff This is an ideal role for a Senior Accountant looking to grow with a large organization.

item.title: Security Architect
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Kforce has a client seeking a Security Architect in Emeryville, California (CA). Position Description: Perform security code reviews and penetration testing Perform risk assessment of new functionality Perform the audits required to assess compliance Product-facing responsibilities such as managing deficiencies or helping guide security requirements for application features Provide application security awareness to the organization through delivery of presentations and intranet content Work in a team of highly professional individuals focused on innovative solutions and meeting quality and deadline requirements Drive the Security maturity of our application Lifecycle

item.title: Patient Account Rep
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Kforce is partnered with a long-standing and highly respected hospital in northeast Oregon, and our client is currently on the search for a Patient Account Representative. This engagement is full-time over a 90-day period. The Patient Account Rep is tasked with hospital billing, adjustments, account follow-up and collection of accounts. If you have a strong hospital billing, follow-up and/or healthcare collections background, we'd love to learn more about you! Please respond with current contact information and an updated resume, and a member of our team will respond promptly. Thanks for taking a look!

item.title: Staff IT Auditor
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Kforce has a client seeking a Staff IT Audit professional within their Investment Audit Division in Newark, NJ. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, highly diversified financial services environment to assess risk, and execute integrated audits of the Company's Asset Management businesses. The Staff IT audit position participates in all aspects of the audit including the planning, control analysis, testing, issue development and reporting phases. This individual is responsible for understanding, analyzing and testing the technology controls including those over data accuracy, completeness and processing for trading, compliance, recordkeeping, accounting and client reporting systems.

item.title: Director, Accounting Policy
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Our world class financial services client is seeking a Director, Accounting Policy in New York, New York (NY). Description: Support the BA Controllers by providing expert accounting guidance on complex accounting issues by researching accounting topics and otherwise assisting in the resolution of technical accounting issues as they arise Assist in tracking technical accounting issues from inception to conclusion and, when necessary, present updates and obtain input from controllership leaders and the Company's auditors Collaborate and Review Memos for Record prepared by BA Controllers Support the development and implementation of technical accounting policies impacting Worldwide Loyalty including, but not limited to; Revenue Recognition Monitor emerging GAAP accounting issues that impact the COE and assist in impact assessment and implementation of newly issues Standards Assist and at times manage special projects, including preparation of board presentations, development of training, coordination of group meetings and other initiatives as required

item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Our client is seeking a Audit Manager, Public Accountant in the Westchester, New York (NY) area. Duties: Plan and lead audit engagements Report to internal and external management teams Identify and remediate risk controls Conduct financial operational and forensic audits Play a lead role in mentoring and developing staff Assist with business development activities and ensure the overall success and professionalism of each engagement while supplying client facing customer service

item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Kforce has a client seeking an Administrative Clerk to join their team in Juno Beach, FL. item.title: Event Marketing, Promotions, & Advertising
item.description: Details: Event Marketing, Promotions, & Advertising EQM is one of the New Jersey's largest retail and commercial marketing, advertising, and event sales organizations, providing comprehensive training in management, advertising, event promotions and client relationship marketing for our Top 100 client portfolio. OUR PORTFOLIO is comprised of approximately 30 top companies in the world, boasting 20,000 agents in 15 countries and territories worldwide. OUR COMPANY LEADERSHIP is recognized as a leader in event marketing, sales, and client relations and has received numerous awards. We pride ourselves on our relationships with our clients, ability to increase sales, and increase market share for our customers and clients. OUR MISSION AND VALUES focus on seizing every opportunity. Whether it’s serving a new client or analyzing a new marketing, we make it happen. OUR CAREERS are focused on the training from the bottom up. We are looking for people without too much experience, but that are willing to learn and grow. We are looking for people that are highly motivated and have a great character and integrity. Our company is actively increasing its presence both locally and globally, with international operations throughout Europe, Latin America, the South Africa and Australia. Contact us to learn more our careers and help us in our journey to bring the most recognized brand in sales and marketing to select markets in the U.S. or countries and territories abroad! Serious candidates can submit an application at

item.title: Cost Accountant
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Our client is seeking a Cost Accountant in Schaumburg, Illinois (IL). This global manufacturing company is in growth mode and continues to expand operations domestically and abroad and is looking to bring the right person on board immediately for a 3 month consulting opportunity. Responsibilities Include: Manages inventory and related work order systems including physical to perpetual to general ledger reconciliations, journal entries, audit explanations, and standard costs Manages preparation and execution of annual standard cost roll Analyzes the of purchase price variance general ledger account Prepares, reviews and distributes daily absorption report Provides cost support to cross functional areas as requested Provides product cost information utilized in month end financial closing Maintains the integrity and accuracy of product cost data Prepares account reconciliations Performs monthly closing activities including preparation and approval of journal entries

item.title: Staff Tax Associate
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Our client, a leading Tri-State public accounting firm, seeks a Senior Tax Associate to join their expanding staff in White Plains, New York (NY). In this role you will prepare diverse tax compliance activities for corporate, partnership, and individual returns, assist clients with identifying and implementing tax planning strategies, ensure compliance and respond to external tax authorities on inquiries. Public accounting tax compliance experience is required for consideration.

item.title: Personal Lines Agent
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Our client is currently seeking several experienced Personal Lines Agents for a temporary to hire opportunity in San Antonio, Texas (TX) clients. The selected candidates will provide expertise in sales, placement and service of personal lines accounts at financial institutions. Essential Duties: Maintains effective working relationships with current and prospective customers and agency personnel to include carriers and brokers Produces and services new/renewal business as it relates to individual goals set by the management while following policy and procedure Maintains complete, accurate, and thorough files on every customer (new and/or renewal) to insure successful compliance audits Tracks and monitors policy retention, policy cancellations, and technical issues as it relates to the book of business written Meets daily call service levels as it relates to Average Speed Answer (ASA), Abandon Rate, and Hold Times Performs other duties as required

item.title: Hardware Test Engineer
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Kforce has a client seeking a Hardware Test Engineer to join their team in Houston, TX. This resource will lead a small team of testers, create test plans, test, develop, execute test plans and perform ad-hoc testing for commercial notebooks in a team-oriented environment. Responsibilities Performs intermediate level testing tasks requiring strong analytical skills, interpretation of test cases and scripts, planning & scheduling of technical activities Configures notebook hardware, software and firmware as required for testing Involved in the investigation & resolution of problems Write/update Test Plans from specifications/requirements Write/update Test Plans based on adhoc test plans, previous issues, usability/experience Develop/Execute debug strategies to assist in root cause of complex issues Develop/Execute ad hoc testing strategy - familiar with directed ad hoc Operates independently and effectively, self-starter Perform intermediate level testing and ad hoc testing Provide leadership, direction and strategy on technical issues Responsible for and manage timely, quality test deliverables

item.title: Assistant Controller
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Our client, a leading global corporation in lower Cos Cob, CT, is seeking an Assistant Controller to oversee the preparation of the financial reporting package, month-end close activities; and provide leadership and oversight to the day to day operational accounting staff. This is a hands-on role open due to promotion and will require very little over-time. Current supervisory experience and an efficiently strong work ethic are required for consideration.

item.title: Assistant Controller
item.description: Details: RESPONSIBILITIES: Our client is seeking an Assistant Controller to join their accounting team in Farmington, Connecticut (CT). This individual will be responsible for the general accounting operations including, internal/financial controls, financial reporting, federal and state filings, overseeing compliance and Managing Accounting Staff. Primary job duties will include, but are not limited to: Training and overseeing employees and assist with using SQLTime, Excel, Outlook, etc Review A\P for valid invoices, ensure invoices are accurate and paid on a timely basis Review expense reports Review of all employees' work for accuracy and approve all new vendors for internal control Review nightly A\P reports Review and approve all invoicing Review monthly aging report and research unpaid items Make sure all cash receipts are deposited timely are accurately entered into the system Review and verify that all deposits are coded to the correct GL accounts Review the Month End commissions and work with Commissions Manager on any outstanding issues Review the Premiums Payable and Premium Deposits process on a monthly basis and work with Premium administrative Managers on issues that arise on a weekly basis Audit Premium accounting system to GL\Bank balances on a monthly basis. item.description: Details: Our innovative and dynamic organization is currently seeking a visionary and entrepreneurial individual to lead and guide our NY region in support of our current operations and future growth plans. Position would be based in Mount Kisco, NY but have oversight of Westchester, Putnam, and Dutchess counties. We are looking for a candidate who will be a self-motivated team member with a proven ability to foster strong customer and staff relationships. Candidate must have the ability to build relationships and trust among all the stakeholders and meet challenges head on to achieve the company's strategic goals. Candidates must be flexible, possess good communication skills and most of all - be a strong leader. The ideal leader will bring with them commitment, consistency and accountability on a daily basis.

item.title: Assistant Director, Woman's Board
item.description: Details: The Assistant Director of Development for the Woman's Board will provide Woman's Board leadership with fundraising and administrative support to manage and execute the priorities of the Woman's Board, including high-caliber programs, communications, and fundraising activities. Primary Duties and Responsibilities: Responsible for the administration of the Woman's Board including development and maintenance of a strategic master calendar and a communications plan; utilize database and web technology to facilitate list management, planning, and communications. Respond to the needs of all Board members to expedite programs and projects. Responsible for the management of fundraising activities that generate more than one million dollars annually. Manage all elements of these activities including the production of solicitation pipelines and strategies for the execution of solicitations, especially of host committee gifts and sponsorships for fundraising events. Provide complete and proactive administrative support for leadership of fundraising events and activities including establishing ambitious goals mapped to prospect lists, tracking of solicitations, production of solicitation briefings and proposal materials, and tracking of tasks and next steps for all committees. Serve as a liaison between the Woman's Board and all departments within the Art Institute including Curatorial departments, Events, Physical Plant, Protection Services, Membership, Accounting, and Stewardship. Represent the Woman's Board on intra-departmental teams or committees within the Museum. Ensure communication of Museum activities and priorities to the Woman's Board, and of Woman's Board activities and priorities to Museum leadership, including the Director and Deputy Directors of the Museum and the VP for Development. Manage accounting records for eight Executive Committee meetings, eight full Board meetings and eight Education Committee meetings, as well as all Woman's Board programs and events. Reconcile all Woman's Board accounts on a monthly basis with Museum Accounting Department. Devise systems for recording past/best practices and establish protocols for initiating regular, annual activities of the Woman's Board, including meetings and events. Implement systems for recording and dissemination of meeting minutes, distribution of agendas in advance of meetings, and archiving of past activities, including accounting and financial events/records. Supervise Woman's Board Coordinator; delegate above administrative duties as appropriate and ensure their efficient execution.

item.title: Network Engineer
item.description: Details: JOB SUMMARY: This position will be responsible for developing technical solutions to test functionality and remove user data from various electronics including enterprise networking, server and storage devices while also providing enhancements to existing processes to improve productivity and efficiency. RESPONSIBILITIES: • Research and develop test/erasure solutions for various devices to meet R2/RIOS, eStewards, DoD and NIST guidelines. • Design and build test fixtures to accommodate test solutions and data removal. • Identify, test and validate 3rd party test/erasure solutions. • Identify market trends in technology assets to aid in future planning for test/erasure solutions. • Identify high value assets received from clients for processing and provide input into the NPI (New Product Introduction) process. • Provide training to operations regarding technical solutions. • Provide recommendations for ERP Shop floor software system enhancements. • Provide technical product support to marketing and sales teams • Support computer product assembly, software loading/imaging, and testing. • Manage technical projects across multiple facilities. • Document, implement, and improve process efficiencies. • Develop engineering solutions for both customer requirements and internal process improvements • Work well in a team based environment with excellent communication skills BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: • BS in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Electronics, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent combination of training and experience • Advanced technical knowledge of computers, servers, networking devices, printers, mobile devices • Advanced technical knowledge in one or more of the following: Cisco IOS, Linux, Sun SPARC • Above average knowledge of MS Office applications (Word, Excel, Power Point, Visio) • Experience building / item.title: Global Components Finance Senior Manager
item.description: Details: Global Components Finance Senior Manager Arrow Electronics, Inc. Englewood, Colorado We are seeking a finance professional to work in the Global Components Headquarters group in our Englewood, CO office. This position will be responsible for establishing processes and analytical support for Global Product Management, a new initiative for the company. The position will have global responsibilities, and is a great opportunity to join a company with significant opportunity for professional growth and development. The individual must possess strong business acumen and thrive in a dynamic business environment. Responsibilities: • Establish standard processes to support Global Product Management, including the accounting flow of transactions, monthly and quarterly reporting of results, forecasting, and business case analysis for new opportunities. • Central coordination for the global finance team to ensure each region and corporate group understands their role in the processes and receives the information they need to complete the work. • Evaluate financial results and partner with the business leaders to drive improvements. • Analyze detailed global financial information and produce concise, executive ready presentations and reports. • Develop solid rapport with key leaders of businesses to facilitate information sharing. • Collaborate with business leaders to model complex global inventory, supplier, and customer deals. • Monitor intercompany accounting and transfer pricing for all global product management initiatives. Qualifications: • Strong accounting skills, preferably in a global organization • Experience in FPA processes • Self starter, with ability to lead teams and initiatives globally. • Proven ability to develop and maintain processes; experience at change management. • Comfortable digging into details and working at granular level as needed. • Bachelors Degree in Finance or Accounting, or equivalent required. • Ten plus (10+) years of related experience. item.title: Diesel Mechanic
item.description: Details: Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines and also provides customized financial services, information technology and truck parts related to its principal business. Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started! PACCAR Leasing (PLC) PacLease provides customers with value-added transportation services and premium-quality Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF vehicles. It is one of the fastest-growing and most innovative global leasing networks in the industry. Requisition Summary PACCAR Leasing Company is seeking motivated applicants for the position of Class C Technician. Our PacLease Technicians assume a high level of responsibility, supporting our field teams in their delivery of client services while consistently providing high quality work. This position is critical to the success of PACCAR’s company stores, providing excellent customer service in every day activity. This position will perform preventive maintenance inspections, tune-ups, lubrication service activities under supervision and be in a learning situation for full technician certification. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated, independent worker. The desired candidate would also have a minimum of two years truck-trailer repair experience. Job Functions / Responsibilities Responsible for performing diagnostic inspections on general truck-tractor systems. Ability to complete preventative maintenance inspection of truck-tractor components. Responsible for making repairs to truck-tractor components. Complete required paperwork to reflect hours, parts and lube, which are utilized within each job function. Ability to work with little or no supervision. Make road calls when component failure is in remote location. Ability to work in a team based environment. Provide superior customer service to clients. Qualifications & Skills Minimum of two years truck-trailer repair experience. High School diploma. Familiarity with safety requirements. Capable of completing job functions without repeat repairs. Flexibility with work hours. Additional Job Board Information If you would like more information about what makes PACCAR an excellent place to work, please visit the PACCAR Career Site . PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.

item.title: Collections Supervisor
item.description: Details: Job Description For over 125 years, ASCO Power Technologies has been pioneering every major product innovation in power transfer technology. Today, we are an industry leader in the manufacturing of automatic transfer switches, industrial control products and power control systems, and the world leader in emergency and standby power transfer solutions. We are the Power Authority - committed to providing a full range of quality-driven products backed by 24-hour nationwide service support. ASCO Power Technologies, an industry leader in the manufacturing of automatic transfer switches, industrial control products and power control systems, services and solutions, has an exciting career opportunity for Collections Supervisor for the organization at our Corporate Headquarters in Florham Park, NJ. Position Summary: The Collection Supervisorwill be responsible for the Collection and Risk Management of high level/exposure accounts. Manage all A/R deductions and the reconciliation of cash. Supervise the daily activities of the assigned Staff ensuring adherence to credit policy. Maintains accuracy, integrity, and completeness of specific accounts receivable portfolios. Responsibilities include: Resolves billing disputes and collects past due and maximizes cash collections to meet or exceed monthly cash targets. Adjusts transactions, processes credits & cancellations, bad debt & various write-offs, and processes refunds for customer's portfolio. Performs related follow-up such as accounts reconciliation, enters tax exempt certificates, etc. Perform a monthly analysis of A/R to make sure that accounts are distributed evenly by risk and credit limit. Escalate large collections issues appropriately and also work with the A/R Manager to develop and improve collection procedures. Regularly review credit hold report and ensure that all orders are released timely. Work with Credit Admin on credit limit reviews for order release. Work closely with remote staff to optimize their use of GetPaid and manage collections strategy. Teach and train subordinates to present and display account details in a clear and concise manner. Ensure team members receive orientation and appropriate development opportunities. Provide regular and effective performance management to team members. Be the focus person for all sales tax issues and deductions Prepares bi-weekly and monthly financial reports for assigned area or region. Various reports could include cash forecasting, analysis on A/R deductions and work with A/R Manager on the resolution of same. Meets with customers to structure and restructure payment processes. Coordinates resolution of issues by key internal personnel and supports supervisor in daily activities. Qualification and Experience: Associate's degree in Accounting, Finance or related financial field with 3-5 years Credit and Collections experience. Bachelor's degree preferred. Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet aggressive deadlines. Strong analytical skills combined with excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in Microsoft Office tools. JDE and Get Paid experience highly preferred. Exceptional communication skills including verbal, written, one-on-one and team. Must be able to interact with co-workers and Management within the Department. Demonstrated negotiation skills with a knack for finding creative solutions. Emerson’s Overview: Emerson is a global leader in bringing technology and engineering together to provide innovative solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and consumer markets around the world. Founded in 1890 in St. Louis, Missouri (USA), Emerson delivers solutions through five business segments: Process Management, Industrial Automation, Network Power, Climate Technologies, and Commercial & Residential Solutions. With sales of $24.7B and more than 130,000 employees in over 150 countries, we have a customer-focused, results-driven culture where employee performance is recognized and rewarded. Emerson Network Power’s Overview: Emerson Network Power provides integrated infrastructure solutions that help ensure availability and maximize efficiency for data centers, telecom networks, and industrial facilities around the world. We use a unique combination of industry expertise, technology, and global resources to make the future of our customers’ business possible. Emerson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment. If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, you can request help by calling 1-314-553-2544 (V/TTY/TDD) or by sending an email to .

item.title: SURGICAL TECHNOLOGIST
item.description: Details: Facility : Presence Health Corporate - Bolingbrook Department : PH OP SURG-SJMC MOB Schedule : Part-time (benefits eligible) Shift : Day shift Hours : 7-3 Location : Bolingbrook, IL Req Number : 134324 Job Details : Level of knowledge equivalent to that ordinarily acquired through a formal, college level technical training program in surgical procedures. 1-3 months job experience. CPR Certification. OR Tech Certification preferred.Level of knowledge equivalent to that ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 1. Function as scrub technician during operative procedures using initiative and judgment to anticipate needs of surgical team members. a. Pass instruments, sutures, sponges, and other equipment, assist with procedures as directed. b. Maintain aseptic technique during operative procedures. c. Monitor instruments, needles, and sponges before, during, and after procedures to ensure correct count. d. Maintain clean and orderly Operating Room in accordance with doctor's preference and established standards, ensure that routine supplies are available for surgical procedures. e. Inspect instrument packs to ensure they include required items, arrange instruments, sutures and linen in proper order for procedure. f. Assist in the care, processing, and handling of equipment, instruments, and supplies. 2. Perform duties including: ensure instrument functionality, store instruments and supplies, monitor dated packs, order linens and other supplies, test equipment, etc. a. Inventory and maintain inventory levels for stock instruments and equipment, provide a back-up supply of instruments used, replacing them as needed; receive and store instruments properly; and communicate, according to department procedure when instruments and equipment are required for replacement stock. b. Maintain records of supplies used and ensure stock supply checklist is noted per established department procedure. c. Ensure proper wrapping, sealing and labeling of instruments, supplies and equipment for sterilization; label each tray appropriately as a preparation for sterilization. d. Responsible for proper care, labeling and handling of specimens and cultures as directed by the professional nurse on the surgical team. 3. Other activities in support of department operations. a. Observe and report new symptoms of adverse reactions of patients to a professional staff member. Take appropriate action in life threatening situations. b. Assist in positioning, moving and transporting patients to and from the Operating Room. c. Seek appropriate resource person for guidance and assistance according to established procedures and guidelines. d. Provide and maintain a clean and safe environment for patients, physicians, and employees. This document represents the major duties, responsibilities, and authorities of this job, and is not intended to be a complete list of all tasks and functions. Other duties may be assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES Does Not Supervise Employees Directly supervises employee(s). Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education and/or Experience Knowledge equivalent to completion of a formal, college-level technical training program in surgical procedures. 1-3 months job experience. OR Tech Certification preferred. Computer Skills Knowledge of Meditech and Microsoft Office. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations CPR Certification. OR Tech Certification preferred. EOE of Minorities/Females/Vets/Disability PI87385123

item.title: SECURITY OFFICER
item.description: Details: Facility : Presence Resurrection Medical Center Department : SECURITY Schedule : Full-time Shift : Rotation Hours : Open Location : Chicago, IL Req Number : 133008 Job Details : SECURITY OFFICER SECURITY DEPARTMENT Position Details: Status: Full-Time, benefits eligible Shift: Rotating shift Weekends: Rotating Work Hours: Open On Call: No Location: Presence Resurrection Medical Center 7435 West Talcott Avenue Chicago, IL 60631 Summary: The Security Officer performs activities necessary to the provision of a safe and secure environment for employees, patients and visitors of the hospital and to protect the assets of the Presence Health Care system. Essential Duties include: - Makes rounds, inside and outside of assigned areas as scheduled or assigned, investigating and documenting on a Security Incident Report all unusual or suspicious incidents and initiating corrective action as appropriate. - Provides assistance to other security personnel, hospital employees, and escorts visitors to desired locations as necessary. - Observes and documents the non-conformance of policies and procedures including but not limited to the display of identification badges, fire, disaster, electrical, safety and infection control policies and procedures. - Responds to calls from nursing and other hospital departments in a timely manner to assist in the management of disorderly patients and/or visitors and emergency codes. - Transports patients in wheelchairs or those using assistive devices and assists with the release of deceased patients from the emergency room or morgue. item.title: IT Applications Support
item.description: Details: Company Overview: Located in Metro Detroit, RCO Engineering is a leading supplier to the automotive, aerospace and defense industries. As a full service product development partner, RCO offers customers a wide range of services, including production plastic and metal parts, prototype and production seat molds, prototype and production injection molds, a full service aluminum foundry, as well as complete product design and engineering services. Our fully equipped metal fabricating and stamping facility is capable of producing parts, assemblies and subassemblies for most any system. Additionally, RCO is the industry's largest and most trusted seating and soft trim development company, having worked with almost every automotive OEM and numerous aerospace firms. Job Overview: RCO Engineering, Inc. has an immediate opening for a skilled programmer/analyst to support our corporate data-sharing and accounting activities. This individual will work with our Lead IT Analyst writing reports, websites and supporting and enhancing enterprise applications used throughout our company.

item.title: RN
item.description: Details: Facility : Presence Pine View Care Center Department : PSS PCC SKILLED NSG Schedule : Part-time (benefits eligible) Shift : Night shift Hours : 10:45 pm - 7:00 am Location : St. Charles, IL Req Number : 134285 Job Details : Summary Assumes direct responsibility and accountability for the nursing care of ministry patients/residents under his/her care. Supervises nursing personnel including LPNs, nursing assistants, and health service aides. Complies with nursing standards, federal/state nursing regulations and the policies and procedures of Presence Life Connections. Responsibilities include defining, planning, organizing, directing, managing, implementing, and evaluating nursing services provided to Presence Life Connections residents. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Completes and documents comprehensive nursing assessment of the health status of patient/resident and addresses changes to patient/resident conditions. Develops and implements an interim plan of nursing care. Provides and documents observations and delivery of care according to established guidelines. Accurately transcribes and implements authorized healthcare professionals orders. Accurately administers and documents medications and treatments. Advocates for patients/patient/residents. Evaluates responses to interventions and the effectiveness of the plan of care. Communicates and collaborates with other health care professionals. Provides and documents patient/resident/family education. Participates in development of policies, procedures, and systems to support patient/resident care and safety. Responds appropriately to emergencies and protects patient/residents and staff from accident/injury by following safety procedures. Maintains environment of care in a neat and orderly manner. Assists in maintaining unit/department budget through appropriate monitoring/usage of unit and patient supplies and monitoring of staff time (appropriate breaks and meals). Reports discrepancies to nurse leaders. Assists with orientation and ongoing mentoring of peers. Other duties as assigned by the DON, ADON, or the nurse leader SUPERVISORY FUNCTIONS: Supervises LPNs, nursing assistants and health service aides in the provision of patient/resident care. Monitors employees to ensure that proper care and service is provided to patient/residents and responds to problems in patient/resident care accordingly. Provides direct input in the evaluation and corrective action plan process. May issue verbal warnings, written warnings, suspensions in accordance with Provena policy. Responds to staff concerns and personnel emergencies in accordance with Provena policies. Provides input/recommendation on transfer of employees to other units. Independently determines appropriate staffing levels for the unit and adjusts those ratios as necessary. This may include staffing increases or reductions and reassignments. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must possess exceptional communication and interpersonal skills Education and/or Experience Working knowledge of nursing regulations governing long-term care. Able to work with limited supervision and to provide supervision when needed. Ability to express or exchange spoken and/or written ideas in English with patient/residents, co-workers, families, and the public. Ability to learn and use current technology. Computer Skills PC proficient (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations Current license as RN in the state of Illinois/Indiana in good standing with the Department of Professional Regulations. Certified in CPR. Presence Pine View Care Center is located in beautiful downtown St. Charles, close to the Fox River. Presence Health is the largest health system based in Illinois, created in November 2011 through the merger of Provena Health and Resurrection Health Care. With over 150 locations, from physician offices and convenient outpatient centers to quality hospitals and senior living communities, were in communities big and small. Visit presencehealth.org to learn more. EOE of Minorities/Females/Vets/Disability PI87385086

item.title: REG/STAFF NURSE STAFFING RESOURCE CENTER
item.description: Details: Facility : Presence Health - Corporate Office Department : HR CENTRAL REGISTRY Schedule : Registry/PRN/Flex Shift : 12 Hr. Shifts Hours : 0700-1900 - CC Location : Chicago, IL Req Number : 131226 Job Details : We are excited to announce the development of a new system initiative that will meet the staffing needs of bedside nursing for our acute care hospitals. The Staffing Resource Center (SRC) will provide staffing support to each of our hospitals to improve the quality, consistency, continuity of patient care. We are looking for Registered Nurses with 12-18 months of experience currently working in Critical Care . As a member of the Staffing Resource Center (SRC), you will float throughout the six acute hospitals as an internal registry nurse based on your clinical skill, experience, and ability. Essential Functions: A registered professional nurse that integrates theoretical knowledge of highly complex patients. Facilitates patient care activities, including revision of direct patient care and collaborates with multidisciplinary team members to achieve quality patient driven outcomes. Requirements: Graduate from a School of Nursing with Current RN licensure by the Illinois State Board of Nursing. BLS and ACLS required. Certification in clinical specialty preferred. Experience in Critical Care required. Additional Information: $48/hr base pay plus shift differentials for pms, nights, and weekends. Six shifts minimum per month required (includes two weekend shifts). Must work one Winter and one Summer holiday. Positions may be based at unit based at one facility or float amongst units and/or facilities based upon tier level. This position is for the system wide registry pool. Advantages to work with Staffing Resource Center (SRC): Ability to work throughout the Legacy Resurrection Health Care System Increased rate of pay and shift differentials Greater opportunity to work scheduled shifts Less chance of being cancelled EOE of Minorities/Females/Vets/Disability PI87385062

item.title: REGISTRY RN
item.description: Details: Facility : Presence Health Corporate - Bolingbrook Department : PH OP SURG-SJMC MOB Schedule : Registry/PRN/Flex Shift : Day shift Hours : 7-3 Location : Bolingbrook, IL Req Number : 134322 Job Details : Candidate Must be an IL Licensed RN. This position is a ZERO hour, registry position working as needed in the department. Demonstrates current, comprehensive, professional knowledge and skills in conformance with recognized nursing standards and department policies including the Patient Bill of Rights and JCAHO regulations, Standards for Nursing Care and the Nurse Practice Act. 2. Performs initial physiological needs assessment on all patients on admission. 3. Identifies patients symptoms and changes and takes appropriate actions in a timely manner. 4. Observes behavioral and physiologic changes due to medications, takes appropriate actions and documents 5. Documents any change from baseline assessments. 6. Uses only approved abbreviations. 7. Writes legibly at all times. 8. Places verbal orders on the physician order sheet within 30 minutes of receiving them. 9. Assures completion of all ordered diagnostic work and support services. 10. Documents any unusual occurrences having a direct effect on patient care by completion of the designated form. 11. Clearly documents ideas, facts and concepts about the patient. Documentation is completed within reasonable time frames; meets standards, policies and procedures 12. Documents patient responses to interventions with 100% completion rate 13. Evaluates patient response to all procedures carried out both on a physical and psychological basis. 14. Evaluates patients response to education regarding their disease process 15. Carries out established techniques for safe administration of medications and parenteral fluids as per policies and procedures 16. Demonstrates knowledge of anesthetic drugs, actions and side effects. 17. Appropriately responds to the patient in an emergency or physically distressful situation. Makes decisions reflecting knowledge of dysrhythmia, followed by appropriate treatment 18. Assessment and reassessment of the patient is clearly and concisely communicated in charting. Documentation meets current standards, policies and procedures and is complete. 19. Utilizes initiative; strives to maintain steady level of productivity; self motivated. 20. Counts narcotics with another RN according to policy. 21. Performs as liaison to patient/family by providing accurate and timely information to ensure patient/family participation in care. Current IL Registered Nurse licensure. Current BCLS certification Current ACLS certification preferred or basic EKG or Arrhythmia identification certification EOE of Minorities/Females/Vets/Disability PI87385063
